title: WHO Dengue Guideline
text: Dengue commonly presents with high fever, myalgia, headache, and may have thrombocytopenia. Laboratory monitoring and NS1/IgM tests aid diagnosis.

title: SLE Clinical Review
text: Systemic lupus erythematosus may present with fever, malar rash, arthralgias; ANA is a sensitive test though non-specific.

title: Niemann-Pick Type C Review
text: Niemann-Pick type C presents with progressive ataxia, vertical supranuclear gaze palsy, and hepatosplenomegaly; diagnosis uses elevated plasma oxysterols and NPC1/NPC2 genetic testing.

title: Gaucher Disease Guideline
text: Gaucher disease often has hepatosplenomegaly, anemia, and bone crises; confirmed by low leukocyte glucocerebrosidase activity and GBA1 mutations.

title: Fabry Disease Clinical Review
text: Fabry disease causes acroparesthesias, angiokeratomas, and renal/cardiac involvement; α-galactosidase A activity and GLA gene testing establish diagnosis.

title: Pompe Disease Consensus
text: Infantile Pompe presents with hypotonia and cardiomyopathy; acid α-glucosidase enzyme assay and GAA genotyping confirm.

title: MPS I (Hurler) Overview
text: MPS I features coarse facies, developmental delay, and organomegaly; urinary glycosaminoglycans and α-L-iduronidase deficiency confirm.

title: MPS II (Hunter) Review
text: MPS II shows developmental delay and hepatosplenomegaly with X-linked inheritance; diagnosis by iduronate-2-sulfatase deficiency and IDS variants.

title: Krabbe Disease Summary
text: Krabbe disease presents with irritability, spasticity, and regression; low galactocerebrosidase activity and GALC mutations confirm.

title: Tay-Sachs Disease Review
text: Infantile Tay-Sachs causes neurodegeneration with hyperacusis and cherry-red spot; HEXA enzyme deficiency or HEXA gene testing confirms.

title: Metachromatic Leukodystrophy Overview
text: MLD presents with motor regression and peripheral neuropathy; arylsulfatase A deficiency and ARSA variants establish diagnosis.

title: Wilson Disease Practice Guideline
text: Wilson disease presents with hepatic or neuropsychiatric symptoms; low ceruloplasmin, elevated 24-h urinary copper, and ATP7B variants support diagnosis.

title: Alpha-1 Antitrypsin Deficiency Update
text: A1AT deficiency causes early emphysema and liver disease; low serum A1AT with Pi*ZZ genotype confirms.

title: Creutzfeldt-Jakob Disease Review
text: CJD presents with rapidly progressive dementia, myoclonus, and ataxia; CSF RT-QuIC and MRI DWI cortical ribboning aid diagnosis.

title: Ehlers-Danlos Syndromes Overview
text: EDS features joint hypermobility, skin hyperextensibility, and tissue fragility; clinical criteria plus gene panels (e.g., COL5A1/2, COL3A1) guide subtyping.

title: Marfan Syndrome Guideline
text: Marfan presents with tall habitus, ectopia lentis, and aortic root dilation; Ghent criteria and FBN1 sequencing support diagnosis and surveillance.

title: Rett Syndrome Review
text: Rett syndrome shows regression with loss of purposeful hand use and stereotypies in girls; MECP2 mutations confirm.

title: Angelman Syndrome Overview
text: Angelman presents with severe speech impairment, ataxia, and happy demeanor; UBE3A abnormalities via methylation analysis or sequencing confirm.

title: Prader-Willi Syndrome Summary
text: Prader-Willi involves neonatal hypotonia, hyperphagia, and obesity; diagnosis by loss of paternally expressed 15q11-q13 via methylation testing.

title: Bardet-Biedl Syndrome Review
text: BBS features retinal dystrophy, polydactyly, obesity, and renal anomalies; molecular confirmation via BBS gene panel.

title: Alstrom Syndrome Overview
text: Alstrom presents with cone-rod dystrophy, cardiomyopathy, and insulin resistance; ALMS1 variants establish diagnosis.

title: Stiff-Person Syndrome Review
text: SPS causes axial rigidity and painful spasms; anti-GAD65 antibodies support diagnosis, EMG shows continuous motor unit activity.

title: Lambert-Eaton Myasthenic Syndrome
text: LEMS presents with proximal weakness and autonomic symptoms; P/Q-type VGCC antibodies and incremental response on repetitive nerve stimulation confirm.

title: Langerhans Cell Histiocytosis Overview
text: LCH may present with lytic bone lesions, rash, or DI; biopsy with CD1a/Langerin positivity and BRAF V600E testing aid classification.

title: Hemophagocytic Lymphohistiocytosis Guideline
text: HLH presents with fever, splenomegaly, cytopenias, and hyperferritinemia; HLH-2004 criteria and NK-cell function guide diagnosis.

title: Aplastic Anemia Review
text: Aplastic anemia shows pancytopenia with hypocellular marrow; exclude PNH and inherited marrow failure syndromes; diagnosis by bone marrow biopsy.

title: Paroxysmal Nocturnal Hemoglobinuria
text: PNH causes hemolysis, thrombosis, and cytopenias; high-sensitivity flow cytometry for GPI-deficient clones (FLAER) confirms.

title: Thrombotic Thrombocytopenic Purpura
text: TTP presents with MAHA and thrombocytopenia; severe ADAMTS13 deficiency supports diagnosis; treat emergently with plasma exchange.

title: Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia
text: HHT causes recurrent epistaxis and AVMs; Curaçao criteria and ENG/ACVRL1 mutations assist diagnosis; screen for pulmonary AVMs.

title: Primary Ciliary Dyskinesia Review
text: PCD presents with neonatal respiratory distress, chronic sinusitis, and otitis; nasal NO is low and TEM/genetic testing confirm.

title: Brugada Syndrome Consensus
text: Brugada manifests with syncope or nocturnal agonal respiration; characteristic coved ST elevation in V1–V3 on ECG is diagnostic.

title: Long QT Syndrome Guideline
text: Congenital LQTS causes syncope or torsades; QTc prolongation and genotype (KCNQ1/KCNH2/SCN5A) guide risk and therapy.

title: ARVC Diagnostic Criteria Update
text: ARVC presents with ventricular arrhythmias and RV dysfunction; Task Force Criteria incorporate ECG, imaging, histology, and genetics.

title: Charcot-Marie-Tooth Disease
text: CMT causes distal weakness and pes cavus; nerve conduction studies classify demyelinating vs axonal forms; PMP22 duplication common in CMT1A.

title: Friedreich Ataxia Review
text: Friedreich ataxia presents with gait ataxia, areflexia, and cardiomyopathy; GAA repeat expansion in FXN confirms.

title: ALS Diagnosis and Management
text: ALS shows progressive upper and lower motor neuron signs; EMG supports and MRI/CSF exclude mimics; genetic testing in familial cases.

title: Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy
text: DMD presents with delayed walking and Gowers sign; markedly elevated CK and DMD gene deletions/duplications confirm.

title: Spinal Muscular Atrophy Overview
text: SMA causes symmetric proximal weakness; SMN1 deletion confirms, SMN2 copy number modifies severity.

title: MELAS Syndrome Review
text: MELAS presents with stroke-like episodes, lactic acidosis, and seizures; mtDNA m.3243A>G in MT-TL1 is common.

title: MERRF Clinical Overview
text: MERRF features myoclonus, epilepsy, and ragged-red fibers; mtDNA MT-TK mutations (m.8344A>G) typical.

title: Leber Hereditary Optic Neuropathy
text: LHON causes acute painless central vision loss in young men; mtDNA mutations (m.11778G>A, m.3460G>A, m.14484T>C) confirm.

title: Alport Syndrome Review
text: Alport causes hematuria, progressive renal failure, and hearing loss; COL4A3-5 variants and GBM thinning on biopsy support diagnosis.

title: Alkaptonuria Summary
text: Alkaptonuria presents with dark urine, ochronosis, and early OA; elevated homogentisic acid in urine confirms.

title: Maple Syrup Urine Disease
text: MSUD presents in neonates with poor feeding and lethargy; elevated branched-chain amino acids and BCKDHA/B variants confirm.

title: Phenylketonuria Practice
text: PKU is detected on newborn screening; elevated phenylalanine and PAH variants confirm; early dietary restriction prevents neurocognitive impairment.

title: Homocystinuria Review
text: Classic homocystinuria presents with ectopia lentis and thromboembolism; elevated homocysteine/methionine and CBS mutations confirm.

title: OTC Deficiency Overview
text: Ornithine transcarbamylase deficiency causes hyperammonemic crises; low citrulline and elevated urine orotic acid with OTC variants confirm.

title: Hereditary Angioedema Guidance
text: HAE presents with recurrent non-urticarial angioedema; low C4 and low/normal C1-INH function differentiate types I/II.

title: Acute Intermittent Porphyria
text: AIP causes episodic abdominal pain and neuropathy; elevated urinary PBG during attacks and HMBS variants confirm.

title: Porphyria Cutanea Tarda
text: PCT presents with photosensitive blistering on dorsal hands; elevated plasma/urine uroporphyrins and UROD deficiency confirm.

title: Erythropoietic Protoporphyria
text: EPP causes painful photosensitivity without blistering; elevated free protoporphyrin in erythrocytes and FECH variants confirm.

title: Hereditary ATTR Amyloidosis
text: hATTR presents with progressive neuropathy ± cardiomyopathy; tissue biopsy with Congo red and TTR variants establish diagnosis.

title: AL Amyloidosis Review
text: AL amyloidosis presents with nephrotic syndrome, restrictive cardiomyopathy, or neuropathy; monoclonal light chains on serum/urine studies and biopsy confirm.

title: X-linked Agammaglobulinemia
text: XLA presents with recurrent sinopulmonary infections; very low IgG/A/M and absent B cells with BTK variants confirm.

title: Common Variable Immunodeficiency
text: CVID shows hypogammaglobulinemia with recurrent infections and autoimmunity; diagnosis after excluding secondary causes and poor vaccine responses.

title: Hyper IgE (Job) Syndrome
text: HIES presents with eczema, recurrent staphylococcal abscesses, and elevated IgE; STAT3 variants common in autosomal dominant form.

title: Chronic Granulomatous Disease
text: CGD causes severe catalase-positive infections; neutrophil oxidative burst tests (DHR) and CYBB variants diagnose X-linked form.

title: Wiskott-Aldrich Syndrome
text: WAS features thrombocytopenia with small platelets, eczema, and infections; WAS gene mutations confirm.

title: Ataxia-Telangiectasia
text: A-T presents with progressive ataxia, telangiectasias, and immunodeficiency; elevated AFP and ATM mutations support diagnosis.

title: Fanconi Anemia
text: Fanconi anemia presents with pancytopenia and congenital anomalies; chromosomal breakage testing and FA gene panel confirm.

title: 22q11.2 Deletion (DiGeorge)
text: DiGeorge presents with conotruncal defects, hypocalcemia, and immune deficiency; microarray or FISH for 22q11.2 deletion confirms.

title: Noonan Syndrome Review
text: Noonan shows short stature, pulmonic stenosis, and facial features; RAS/MAPK pathway gene variants (PTPN11, SOS1, RAF1) confirm.

title: Williams Syndrome Overview
text: Williams presents with elfin facies, supravalvular aortic stenosis, and hypersociability; 7q11.23 microdeletion by microarray confirms.

title: Fragile X Syndrome
text: Fragile X causes intellectual disability and macroorchidism; FMR1 CGG repeat expansion with methylation confirms.

title: Tuberous Sclerosis Complex
text: TSC presents with seizures, facial angiofibromas, and renal AMLs; TSC1/TSC2 variants or clinical criteria diagnose.

title: Neurofibromatosis Type 1
text: NF1 features café-au-lait macules, neurofibromas, and Lisch nodules; clinical criteria suffice, NF1 testing helpful in atypical cases.

title: Neurofibromatosis Type 2
text: NF2 presents with bilateral vestibular schwannomas and hearing loss; NF2 variants confirm.

title: Von Hippel-Lindau Disease
text: VHL causes hemangioblastomas, renal cell carcinoma, and pheochromocytoma; VHL gene variants confirm and guide surveillance.

title: Li-Fraumeni Syndrome
text: LFS is a TP53 cancer predisposition with early sarcomas and breast cancers; TP53 pathogenic variants diagnose.

title: Hereditary Pheochromocytoma/Paraganglioma
text: Hereditary PPGL presents with catecholamine-mediated symptoms; plasma metanephrines and SDHx/VHL/RET mutations guide diagnosis and management.

title: GSD Type I (von Gierke)
text: GSD I causes hypoglycemia, lactic acidosis, and hepatomegaly; G6PC or SLC37A4 variants confirm.

title: GSD Type III (Cori)
text: GSD III presents with hepatomegaly and myopathy; AGL gene variants confirm debranching enzyme deficiency.

title: GSD Type V (McArdle)
text: McArdle disease presents with exercise intolerance and second-wind phenomenon; PYGM variants and absent myophosphorylase confirm.

title: Lymphangioleiomyomatosis
text: LAM causes progressive dyspnea in women with diffuse cystic lung disease; VEGF-D elevation and CT findings support diagnosis.

title: Pulmonary Alveolar Proteinosis
text: PAP presents with dyspnea and crazy-paving on CT; milky BAL and anti-GM-CSF antibodies in autoimmune PAP confirm.

title: Hypophosphatasia Overview
text: Hypophosphatasia presents with fractures and premature tooth loss; low ALP with ALPL variants confirm.

title: Mitochondrial DNA Depletion Syndromes
text: MDDS causes infantile liver or myopathic failure; very low mtDNA copy number in tissue and nuclear gene variants confirm.

title: Pulmonary Tuberculosis Guideline
text: Pulmonary TB presents with cough, fever, and weight loss; Xpert MTB/RIF is recommended for rapid diagnosis, culture confirms and tests susceptibility.

title: Tuberculous Meningitis Review
text: TB meningitis presents with subacute fever and altered sensorium; CSF shows lymphocytic pleocytosis with low glucose; NAAT and culture support diagnosis.

title: HIV Infection Primary Care
text: Acute HIV may present with fever and rash; 4th-generation Ag/Ab tests and HIV-1 RNA confirm early infection; screen all at risk.

title: Falciparum Malaria Management
text: Severe falciparum malaria presents with coma or acidosis; rapid diagnostic tests plus microscopy confirm; treat with IV artesunate.

title: Vivax Malaria Overview
text: Vivax malaria causes cyclical fevers and relapse via hypnozoites; microscopy/RDT diagnose, radical cure requires primaquine after G6PD testing.

title: Dengue Guideline Update
text: Dengue presents with high fever, myalgia, and leukopenia; NS1 antigen/IgM support early diagnosis and monitor for plasma leakage and thrombocytopenia.

title: Chikungunya Clinical Review
text: Chikungunya causes abrupt fever and severe polyarthralgia; RT-PCR in first week and IgM thereafter assist diagnosis.

title: Zika Virus Update
text: Zika presents with mild fever, conjunctivitis, and rash; RT-PCR confirms in acute phase; counsel on pregnancy risks (microcephaly).

title: COVID-19 Diagnosis
text: COVID-19 commonly presents with fever, cough, and anosmia; NAAT/RT-PCR is diagnostic, antigen tests useful when symptomatic and early.

title: Influenza A Clinical
text: Influenza A causes abrupt fever and myalgias; RT-PCR is preferred diagnostic assay; oseltamivir most effective when started early.

title: RSV Bronchiolitis Guideline
text: RSV bronchiolitis presents with wheeze and increased work of breathing in infants; diagnosis is clinical, support care is primary.

title: Leptospirosis Review
text: Leptospirosis presents with fever, myalgia, and conjunctival suffusion; MAT is reference test and PCR useful early.

title: Scrub Typhus Overview
text: Scrub typhus presents with fever and eschar; serology (IFA) or PCR confirms; treat with doxycycline.

title: Enteric Fever Update
text: Typhoid presents with sustained fever and abdominal pain; blood culture is gold standard; Widal is unreliable; consider local resistance.

title: Cholera Guidance
text: Cholera causes acute watery diarrhea with dehydration; stool culture or rapid tests confirm; prompt ORS/IV fluids are lifesaving.

title: Hepatitis A Summary
text: HAV presents with acute hepatitis and jaundice; anti-HAV IgM confirms; disease is self-limited and vaccine-preventable.

title: Hepatitis B Guideline
text: HBV presents from asymptomatic to cirrhosis; HBsAg and HBV DNA quantification guide staging; HBeAg indicates replication.

title: Hepatitis C Update
text: HCV often asymptomatic until chronic disease; anti-HCV screening followed by RNA confirm; pangenotypic DAAs achieve high cure rates.

title: Hepatitis E Review
text: HEV causes acute hepatitis, severe in pregnancy; anti-HEV IgM/IgG and RNA testing confirm.

title: Rabies PEP Guidance
text: Rabies presents with encephalitis and hydrophobia; diagnosis is clinical/RT-PCR; post-exposure prophylaxis with wound care, vaccine, and RIG is essential.

title: Tetanus Clinical
text: Tetanus presents with trismus and muscle spasms; diagnosis is clinical; TIG and wound care with metronidazole recommended.

title: Diphtheria Overview
text: Diphtheria causes sore throat with gray pseudomembrane; culture/PCR confirms; treat with antitoxin and antibiotics.

title: Pertussis Update
text: Pertussis presents with paroxysmal cough and posttussive vomiting; PCR is preferred early; macrolides reduce transmission.

title: Measles Clinical
text: Measles presents with fever, cough, coryza, conjunctivitis, and rash; RT-PCR or IgM confirms; airborne precautions and vaccination key.

title: Mumps Overview
text: Mumps causes parotitis and fever; RT-PCR/IgM confirm; complications include orchitis and meningitis.

title: Rubella Summary
text: Rubella presents with mild fever and rash; IgM/RT-PCR confirm; congenital infection causes severe defects—vaccination prevents.

title: Varicella (Chickenpox)
text: Varicella presents with pruritic vesicular rash in crops; PCR from lesion confirms; vaccination prevents severe disease.

title: Herpes Zoster
text: Zoster presents with dermatomal vesicular rash and neuropathic pain; PCR confirms; antivirals shorten duration when early.

title: Cytomegalovirus Infection
text: CMV causes mononucleosis-like illness in immunocompetent and severe disease in immunosuppressed; PCR/antigenemia detect viremia.

title: EBV Mononucleosis
text: EBV mono presents with fever, pharyngitis, and lymphadenopathy; heterophile antibodies (Monospot) or EBV serology confirm.

title: Toxoplasmosis Review
text: Toxoplasmosis is asymptomatic or causes lymphadenopathy; in pregnancy or immunosuppression, PCR/serology guide treatment.

title: Histoplasmosis Guidance
text: Histoplasmosis causes fever and pulmonary symptoms; urine antigen useful in disseminated disease; culture/serology assist.

title: Cryptococcal Meningitis
text: Cryptococcal meningitis presents with headache and raised ICP in HIV; CSF cryptococcal antigen is highly sensitive; treat with amphotericin plus flucytosine.

title: Coccidioidomycosis Update
text: Coccidioidomycosis presents with cough and erythema nodosum in endemic areas; serology and culture diagnose.

title: Blastomycosis Review
text: Blastomycosis causes pulmonary disease and verrucous skin lesions; culture is definitive, urine antigen cross-reacts with histo.

title: Invasive Aspergillosis
text: Invasive aspergillosis presents with fever and pleuritic pain in neutropenia; serum/BAL galactomannan and CT halo sign support diagnosis.

title: Candidemia Management
text: Candidemia presents with persistent fever in hospitalized patients; blood cultures diagnose; echinocandins are first-line empiric therapy.

title: MRSA Bacteremia
text: MRSA bacteremia presents with fever and sepsis; blood cultures positive for MRSA; treat with vancomycin or daptomycin and source control.

title: Lyme Disease Practice
text: Lyme presents with erythema migrans and flu-like symptoms; clinical diagnosis in early disease, two-tier serology thereafter.

title: Syphilis Diagnosis
text: Syphilis presents with painless chancre (primary) or rash on palms/soles (secondary); nontreponemal plus treponemal tests confirm.

title: SLE Classification Update
text: SLE presents with fever, malar rash, and serositis; ANA is sensitive while anti-dsDNA/anti-Sm are specific; complement often low in flares.

title: Rheumatoid Arthritis Criteria
text: RA presents with symmetric polyarthritis and morning stiffness; anti-CCP and RF support diagnosis and predict erosive disease.

title: Sjögren Syndrome Review
text: Sjögren causes dry eyes and mouth; anti-SSA/Ro antibodies and salivary gland biopsy help confirm.

title: Hashimoto Thyroiditis
text: Hashimoto presents with hypothyroid symptoms and goiter; high TPO antibodies and elevated TSH with low free T4 confirm.

title: Graves Disease Guidance
text: Graves disease presents with hyperthyroidism, ophthalmopathy, and goiter; suppressed TSH with elevated FT4/T3 and TSH receptor antibodies confirm.

title: Type 1 Diabetes Overview
text: Type 1 diabetes presents with polyuria, weight loss, and DKA; low C-peptide and islet autoantibodies (GAD65, IA-2) support diagnosis.

title: Celiac Disease Practice
text: Celiac disease causes diarrhea and malabsorption; tTG-IgA with total IgA screening followed by duodenal biopsy confirms.

title: Crohn Disease Guideline
text: Crohn presents with abdominal pain, diarrhea, and weight loss; ileocolonoscopy with biopsy confirms, fecal calprotectin supports monitoring.

title: Ulcerative Colitis Guideline
text: UC presents with bloody diarrhea and urgency; colonoscopy with continuous mucosal inflammation confirms; pANCA may be positive.

title: Psoriasis Clinical Review
text: Psoriasis shows well-demarcated erythematous plaques with silvery scale; nail pitting common; screen for psoriatic arthritis.

title: Psoriatic Arthritis
text: Psoriatic arthritis presents with dactylitis, enthesitis, and asymmetric oligoarthritis; ultrasound/MRI can detect enthesitis early.

title: Ankylosing Spondylitis
text: AS presents with inflammatory back pain and decreased spinal mobility; sacroiliitis on MRI and HLA-B27 positivity support diagnosis.

title: Dermatomyositis
text: Dermatomyositis presents with proximal muscle weakness and heliotrope rash; CK elevation and myositis-specific antibodies support; biopsy confirms.

title: Polymyositis
text: Polymyositis presents with symmetric proximal weakness; elevated CK and EMG suggest myopathy; biopsy shows endomysial inflammation.

title: Granulomatosis with Polyangiitis
text: GPA presents with sinusitis, pulmonary nodules, and glomerulonephritis; c-ANCA/PR3 positivity supports; biopsy shows necrotizing granulomas.

title: Microscopic Polyangiitis
text: MPA causes rapidly progressive GN and pulmonary capillaritis; p-ANCA/MPO common; biopsy demonstrates pauci-immune vasculitis.

title: Eosinophilic Granulomatosis with Polyangiitis
text: EGPA presents with adult-onset asthma, eosinophilia, and neuropathy; p-ANCA/MPO may be positive; biopsy shows eosinophilic vasculitis.

title: Takayasu Arteritis
text: Takayasu presents with limb claudication and pulseless upper extremities; CTA/MRA show large-vessel stenoses.

title: Giant Cell Arteritis Update
text: GCA presents with new headache, jaw claudication, and vision symptoms in elders; temporal artery ultrasound/biopsy confirm; treat urgently with steroids.

title: Antiphospholipid Syndrome
text: APS causes arterial/venous thrombosis or pregnancy morbidity; persistent aCL/β2-GPI/LAC positivity on two occasions confirms.

title: IgG4-Related Disease
text: IgG4-RD presents with painless swelling of salivary/lacrimal glands or pancreatitis; elevated serum IgG4 and storiform fibrosis on biopsy.

title: Autoimmune Hepatitis
text: AIH presents with elevated transaminases and fatigue; ANA/SMA positive and interface hepatitis on biopsy confirm.

title: Primary Biliary Cholangitis
text: PBC presents with pruritus and cholestasis; anti-mitochondrial antibodies (AMA) and elevated ALP are characteristic.

title: Primary Sclerosing Cholangitis
text: PSC shows cholestasis and biliary strictures; MRCP demonstrates beading; associated with ulcerative colitis.

title: Myasthenia Gravis
text: MG presents with fluctuating ptosis and fatigable weakness; AChR/MuSK antibodies and decrement on repetitive stimulation support diagnosis.

title: Guillain-Barré Syndrome
text: GBS presents with ascending weakness and areflexia; CSF albuminocytologic dissociation and demyelinating features on NCS support.

title: CIDP Consensus
text: CIDP causes progressive symmetric weakness and sensory loss; elevated CSF protein and demyelinating NCS/EMG confirm.

title: Multiple Sclerosis
text: MS presents with optic neuritis or myelitis; MRI dissemination in space/time and CSF oligoclonal bands support diagnosis.

title: NMOSD Diagnostic Criteria
text: NMOSD presents with optic neuritis and longitudinally extensive myelitis; AQP4-IgG positivity is highly specific.

title: MOGAD Overview
text: MOGAD features optic neuritis, myelitis, or ADEM-like presentations; MOG-IgG helps distinguish from MS/NMOSD.

title: Anti-NMDA Receptor Encephalitis
text: Anti-NMDA encephalitis presents with psychosis, seizures, and dyskinesias; CSF anti-NMDA-R antibodies confirm; screen for ovarian teratoma.

title: Autoimmune Autonomic Ganglionopathy
text: AAG presents with orthostatic hypotension and anhidrosis; ganglionic AChR antibodies support diagnosis.

title: Primary Adrenal Insufficiency
text: Addison disease presents with fatigue, hyperpigmentation, and hypotension; low cortisol with elevated ACTH and 21-hydroxylase antibodies in autoimmune cases.

title: Pernicious Anemia
text: Pernicious anemia presents with macrocytosis and neuropathy; low B12 with anti-intrinsic factor antibodies confirms.

title: Immune Thrombocytopenia
text: ITP presents with isolated thrombocytopenia and mucocutaneous bleeding; diagnosis of exclusion; test for secondary causes (HIV/HCV).

title: Autoimmune Hemolytic Anemia
text: AIHA shows anemia with jaundice and reticulocytosis; positive direct antiglobulin test (Coombs) confirms.

title: Autoimmune Enteropathy
text: Autoimmune enteropathy presents with chronic diarrhea and malabsorption; anti-enterocyte antibodies and villous atrophy on biopsy support.

title: Pemphigus Vulgaris
text: Pemphigus vulgaris causes flaccid bullae and erosions; anti-desmoglein 3 antibodies and intraepidermal acantholysis on biopsy confirm.

title: Bullous Pemphigoid
text: Bullous pemphigoid presents with tense bullae and pruritus in elders; BP180/BP230 antibodies and subepidermal split on biopsy confirm.

title: Acute Myeloid Leukemia
text: AML presents with fatigue, infections, and bleeding; blasts ≥20% in marrow and cytogenetic/molecular risk stratify.

title: Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia
text: ALL presents with fatigue and bone pain; marrow lymphoblasts confirm; flow cytometry immunophenotypes (B- or T-lineage).

title: Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
text: CLL often incidental lymphocytosis; flow cytometry shows CD5+CD23+ B-cells; FISH for del(17p)/TP53 guides therapy.

title: Chronic Myeloid Leukemia
text: CML presents with leukocytosis and splenomegaly; BCR-ABL1 fusion by PCR confirms; TKIs achieve deep molecular responses.

title: Hodgkin Lymphoma
text: Hodgkin lymphoma presents with painless lymphadenopathy and B-symptoms; biopsy shows Reed-Sternberg cells; PET-CT stages.

title: Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma
text: DLBCL presents with rapidly enlarging nodes; biopsy confirms; cell of origin and MYC/BCL2/BCL6 status inform prognosis.

title: Follicular Lymphoma
text: Follicular lymphoma often indolent with waxing/waning nodes; biopsy shows t(14;18) BCL2 rearrangement.

title: Multiple Myeloma
text: Myeloma presents with anemia, bone pain, and renal dysfunction; M-protein and ≥10% clonal plasma cells or myeloma-defining events confirm.

title: Burkitt Lymphoma
text: Burkitt presents with rapidly growing tumor and high LDH; biopsy shows MYC translocation; treat urgently.

title: Pancreatic Adenocarcinoma
text: Pancreatic cancer presents with painless jaundice or weight loss; CT pancreas protocol and CA 19-9 aid staging and monitoring.

title: Hepatocellular Carcinoma
text: HCC presents with liver mass in cirrhosis; diagnosis by arterial enhancement with venous washout on imaging; AFP adjunctive.

title: Cholangiocarcinoma
text: Cholangiocarcinoma causes painless jaundice and cholestasis; MRCP/ERCP and biopsy confirm; test for IDH1/FGFR2 alterations.

title: Non–Small Cell Lung Cancer
text: NSCLC presents with cough or weight loss; histology plus molecular testing (EGFR, ALK, ROS1, PD-L1) guide therapy.

title: Small Cell Lung Cancer
text: SCLC presents with central mass and paraneoplastic syndromes; diagnosis by biopsy; sensitive to chemo-radiation but relapses commonly.

title: ER+ Breast Cancer
text: ER+ breast cancer presents as mass or screening abnormality; ER/PR/HER2 IHC and genomic assays refine risk.

title: Triple-Negative Breast Cancer
text: TNBC lacks ER/PR/HER2; tends to be aggressive; consider BRCA testing and PD-L1 for immunotherapy eligibility.

title: Ovarian Epithelial Carcinoma
text: Ovarian cancer presents with bloating and pelvic mass; CA-125 and transvaginal ultrasound aid evaluation; test for BRCA/HRD.

title: Prostate Adenocarcinoma
text: Prostate cancer detected by elevated PSA or nodule; MRI-targeted biopsy improves detection; grade group/Gleason stratify risk.

title: Glioblastoma
text: GBM presents with new seizures or focal deficits; MRI with ring-enhancing lesion and MGMT methylation/IDH status inform prognosis.

title: Medulloblastoma
text: Medulloblastoma presents with ataxia and raised ICP; MRI posterior fossa mass and molecular subgrouping (WNT/SHH) guide therapy.

title: Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy
text: HCM presents with exertional dyspnea and syncope; echocardiography shows LVH with outflow tract gradient; genetic testing for sarcomeric genes.

title: Dilated Cardiomyopathy
text: DCM presents with heart failure and arrhythmias; echo shows LV dilation and reduced EF; evaluate for ischemic, genetic, and toxic causes.

title: Aortic Dissection
text: Aortic dissection presents with tearing chest/back pain and pulse deficits; CT angiography is diagnostic; manage urgently.

title: Pulmonary Embolism
text: PE presents with dyspnea and pleuritic chest pain; Wells score and D-dimer guide imaging; CTPA confirms.

title: Deep Vein Thrombosis
text: DVT presents with unilateral leg swelling and pain; compression ultrasonography confirms; evaluate for provoking factors.

title: Ischemic Stroke
text: Ischemic stroke presents with sudden focal deficits; non-contrast CT excludes hemorrhage; give thrombolysis if eligible within window.

title: Subarachnoid Hemorrhage
text: SAH presents with thunderclap headache; CT head then LP if CT negative; aneurysm evaluation with CTA/DSA.

title: Chronic Kidney Disease
text: CKD defined by eGFR <60 or kidney damage ≥3 months; albuminuria categories refine risk and guide ACEi/ARB therapy.

title: Acute Pancreatitis
text: Acute pancreatitis presents with epigastric pain radiating to back; diagnosis requires two of three: pain, elevated lipase/amylase, imaging findings.

title: Diabetic Ketoacidosis
text: DKA presents with polyuria, Kussmaul respirations, and abdominal pain; labs show hyperglycemia, ketosis, and anion-gap acidosis.

title: Hyperosmolar Hyperglycemic State
text: HHS features profound hyperglycemia and dehydration with minimal ketosis; management centers on fluids and insulin.

title: Preeclampsia Diagnosis
text: Preeclampsia presents after 20 weeks with hypertension and proteinuria or end-organ dysfunction; manage by severity and gestational age.

title: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome
text: PCOS presents with oligo-ovulation, hyperandrogenism, and polycystic ovaries; diagnose via Rotterdam criteria after excluding mimics.

title: Endometriosis Overview
text: Endometriosis presents with dysmenorrhea and infertility; laparoscopy with histology confirms; consider empirical therapy based on symptoms.

title: Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia
text: BPH presents with lower urinary tract symptoms; assess with IPSS and DRE; consider PSA to exclude cancer.

title: Nephrolithiasis
text: Kidney stones present with colicky flank pain and hematuria; non-contrast CT confirms; analyze stone for recurrence prevention.

title: COPD Exacerbation
text: COPD exacerbation presents with increased dyspnea and sputum; treat with bronchodilators, steroids, and antibiotics when indicated.

title: Asthma Exacerbation
text: Asthma exacerbation presents with wheeze and dyspnea; assess severity with PEF/SpO2 and treat with inhaled β2-agonists, steroids.

title: Obstructive Sleep Apnea
text: OSA presents with loud snoring and daytime sleepiness; polysomnography confirms elevated AHI.

title: Epilepsy Diagnosis
text: Epilepsy presents with recurrent unprovoked seizures; EEG and MRI help classify syndrome and guide therapy.

title: Behcet Disease
text: Behcet disease presents with recurrent oral/genital ulcers and uveitis; pathergy test may be positive; multisystem vasculitis pattern.

title: Sarcoidosis Statement
text: Sarcoidosis presents with cough, dyspnea, and bilateral hilar lymphadenopathy; noncaseating granulomas on biopsy confirm after excluding infections.

title: Secondary HLH in Infection
text: Secondary HLH presents with persistent fever, cytopenias, and ferritin >10,000 in infections/malignancy; HScore aids probability estimation.

title: Thyrotoxic Periodic Paralysis
text: TPP presents with acute flaccid paralysis and hypokalemia in hyperthyroidism; ECG may show U waves; correct potassium and thyrotoxicosis.

title: Autosomal Dominant Polycystic Kidney Disease
text: ADPKD presents with hypertension and enlarged kidneys with multiple cysts; ultrasound criteria by age and PKD1/PKD2 testing assist.

title: Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis
text: IPF presents with progressive dyspnea and dry cough; HRCT shows usual interstitial pneumonia pattern; exclude other causes of ILD.

title: Sarcomeric HCM Genotype-Phenotype
text: Sarcomeric hypertrophic cardiomyopathy shows asymmetric septal hypertrophy with systolic anterior motion; MYH7 and MYBPC3 variants common and inform family screening.

title: Cardiac Amyloidosis Diagnostic Pathway
text: Cardiac amyloidosis presents with heart failure with preserved ejection fraction and thickened walls; bone scintigraphy distinguishes ATTR from AL in absence of monoclonal protein.

title: Brucellosis Clinical Review
text: Brucellosis presents with undulating fever, sweats, and arthralgia; blood cultures and serology (SAT) confirm; risk from unpasteurized dairy.

title: Melioidosis Overview
text: Melioidosis causes pneumonia or abscesses in diabetics; diagnosis by culture of Burkholderia pseudomallei and characteristic bipolar staining; ceftazidime intensive therapy then eradication with TMP-SMX.

title: Tularemia Management
text: Tularemia presents with ulceroglandular disease and fever after tick or animal exposure; diagnosis by serology/culture in BSL-3; treat with streptomycin or gentamicin.

title: Plague Clinical Guidance
text: Plague presents with sudden fever and painful buboes; Yersinia pestis grows on culture and PCR detects; treat with streptomycin or doxycycline promptly.

title: Visceral Leishmaniasis
text: Visceral leishmaniasis causes fever, weight loss, and massive splenomegaly; rK39 rapid tests and tissue aspirate microscopy/culture confirm.

title: Amoebic Liver Abscess
text: Entamoeba histolytica liver abscess presents with fever and RUQ pain; serology is sensitive in endemic areas and ultrasound shows lesion; metronidazole treats.

title: MAC Pulmonary Disease
text: Mycobacterium avium complex lung disease presents with chronic cough and nodular-bronchiectatic changes; requires clinical, radiographic, and microbiologic criteria including multiple positive sputum cultures.

title: Leprosy Diagnosis & Classification
text: Leprosy presents with hypopigmented anesthetic patches or neuropathy; slit-skin smear and skin biopsy help classify multibacillary vs paucibacillary.

title: Anthrax Clinical Update
text: Cutaneous anthrax causes painless eschar with edema; inhalational form has mediastinal widening; PCR/culture confirm; treat with ciprofloxacin plus antitoxin for systemic disease.

title: Q Fever Overview
text: Q fever presents with fever, pneumonia or hepatitis; phase II IgM/IgG serology confirms acute infection; chronic infection involves endocarditis.

title: Psittacosis (Chlamydia psittaci)
text: Psittacosis presents with atypical pneumonia after bird exposure; PCR/serology assist; treat with doxycycline.

title: Hantavirus Pulmonary Syndrome
text: Hantavirus pulmonary syndrome presents with fever then rapid noncardiogenic pulmonary edema; serology/PCR confirm; supportive intensive care is mainstay.

title: Lassa Fever Clinical Guidance
text: Lassa fever presents with fever and pharyngitis; RT-PCR confirms; ribavirin early may improve outcomes; strict infection control required.

title: Ebola Virus Disease
text: EVD presents with fever, GI symptoms, and hemorrhage; RT-PCR confirms; aggressive supportive care and infection prevention are crucial.

title: Marburg Virus Disease
text: Marburg presents with abrupt fever and severe hemorrhagic manifestations; RT-PCR confirms; case management mirrors Ebola with supportive care.

title: Nipah Virus Infection
text: Nipah infection causes encephalitis and ARDS; diagnosis by RT-PCR/IgM; high mortality necessitates supportive care and contact tracing.

title: Variant CJD
text: Variant CJD presents with psychiatric symptoms and painful dysesthesias progressing to dementia; tonsillar PrP immunostaining and MRI pulvinar sign suggest diagnosis.

title: SARS Clinical Features
text: SARS presented with fever and atypical pneumonia; RT-PCR and serology confirmed; strict respiratory isolation controlled outbreaks.

title: MERS-CoV Infection
text: MERS causes severe pneumonia often with renal failure; RT-PCR confirms; infection prevention critical in healthcare settings.

title: Mpox (Monkeypox) Update
text: Mpox presents with vesiculopustular rash and lymphadenopathy; diagnosis by lesion PCR; consider sexual networks and travel history in 2022 outbreaks.

title: Strongyloidiasis in Immunosuppressed
text: Strongyloides stercoralis can cause hyperinfection with steroids; serology and multiple stool exams help; ivermectin is treatment of choice.

title: Schistosomiasis
text: Schistosomiasis presents with hematuria (haematobium) or hepatosplenic disease (mansoni/japonicum); eggs on urine/stool microscopy and serology aid diagnosis.

title: Echinococcosis (Hydatid Disease)
text: Cystic echinococcosis presents with liver cysts causing pain; ultrasound shows hydatid cyst; serology supportive; PAIR or surgery plus albendazole used.

title: Neurocysticercosis Review
text: Neurocysticercosis causes seizures; MRI shows ring-enhancing lesions; serology (EITB) supports; treat with albendazole and steroids as stage-appropriate.

title: Trichinellosis
text: Trichinellosis presents with myalgia, periorbital edema, and eosinophilia after undercooked pork; serology confirms; treat with albendazole and analgesia.

title: Diphyllobothriasis
text: Fish tapeworm infection may cause B12 deficiency with glossitis; ova in stool diagnose; treat with praziquantel.

title: Lymphatic Filariasis
text: Lymphatic filariasis presents with lymphedema and hydrocele; circulating antigen tests and nocturnal microfilaremia aid diagnosis; DEC/ivermectin plus albendazole used in MDA.

title: Onchocerciasis
text: Onchocerciasis causes pruritus and visual impairment; skin snips reveal microfilariae; ivermectin controls transmission.

title: Chagas Disease
text: Chagas presents chronically with cardiomyopathy or megaesophagus; serology with two different assays confirms; benznidazole treats acute/early infection.

title: Severe Pulmonary Leptospirosis
text: Severe leptospirosis can cause pulmonary hemorrhage and ARDS; early PCR and MAT assist; supportive critical care crucial.

title: Hand-Foot-Mouth Disease
text: HFMD presents with fever and oral ulcers with vesicles on hands/feet; typically due to enteroviruses; diagnosis clinical.

title: Scarlet Fever
text: Scarlet fever presents with sandpaper rash and strawberry tongue in streptococcal pharyngitis; rapid antigen test or culture confirms GAS.

title: Kawasaki Disease
text: Kawasaki disease is a vasculitis with fever ≥5 days plus mucocutaneous signs; echocardiography evaluates coronary aneurysms; treat with IVIG and aspirin.

title: MIS-C Related to COVID-19
text: MIS-C presents with fever, inflammation, and multisystem involvement weeks after SARS-CoV-2; elevated CRP/D-dimer common; treat with IVIG and steroids.

title: PIMS-TS Guidance
text: PIMS-TS presents with persistent fever and shock-like features after SARS-CoV-2 exposure; broad inflammatory labs; manage with IVIG/steroids and MDT care.

title: SARS-CoV-2 Testing Strategy
text: RT-PCR from nasopharyngeal swab remains diagnostic gold standard; antigen tests useful when viral load high; serology indicates past infection.

title: Post-Acute Sequelae of COVID-19
text: Long COVID includes fatigue, dyspnea, dysautonomia, and cognitive issues; diagnosis is clinical after excluding other causes; multidisciplinary rehabilitation recommended.

title: Hereditary Neuropathy with Liability to Pressure Palsies
text: HNPP presents with recurrent focal neuropathies after minor compression; PMP22 deletion confirms; nerve conduction shows conduction block.

title: SMARD1 Overview
text: Spinal muscular atrophy with respiratory distress type 1 presents in infancy with diaphragmatic paralysis; IGHMBP2 variants confirm.

title: Canavan Disease
text: Canavan disease presents with macrocephaly and severe developmental delay; elevated N-acetylaspartic acid in urine and ASPA mutations confirm.

title: GM1 Gangliosidosis
text: GM1 gangliosidosis presents with neurodegeneration and skeletal dysplasia; low β-galactosidase activity and GLB1 variants confirm.

title: Sandhoff Disease
text: Sandhoff presents with developmental regression and cherry-red spot; HEXB deficiency and mutations confirm.

title: Adult-Onset NPC Phenotype
text: Adult Niemann-Pick C may present with psychiatric symptoms and vertical gaze palsy; plasma lyso-SM-509/oxysterols and NPC1/NPC2 testing confirm.

title: X-linked Adrenoleukodystrophy
text: ALD presents with adrenal insufficiency and demyelinating disease in boys; elevated very long-chain fatty acids and ABCD1 mutations confirm.

title: Zellweger Spectrum Disorders
text: Zellweger spectrum disorders present with hypotonia, seizures, and craniofacial dysmorphism; abnormal very long-chain fatty acids and PEX gene variants confirm.

title: Salla Disease
text: Salla disease presents with hypotonia and developmental delay; elevated free sialic acid in urine and SLC17A5 variants confirm.

title: Alpha-Mannosidosis
text: Alpha-mannosidosis causes coarse facies, ataxia, and hearing loss; deficient alpha-mannosidase activity and MAN2B1 variants confirm.

title: Aspartylglucosaminuria
text: Aspartylglucosaminuria presents with developmental delay and coarse features; elevated aspartylglucosamine and AGA mutations confirm.

title: I-Cell Disease (ML II)
text: Mucolipidosis II shows early skeletal abnormalities and coarse facies; multiple lysosomal enzymes elevated in plasma; GNPTAB variants confirm.

title: Wolman Disease / LAL Deficiency
text: Lysosomal acid lipase deficiency in infants causes failure to thrive, hepatosplenomegaly, and adrenal calcifications; low LAL activity or LIPA variants confirm.

title: CLN3 Batten Disease
text: Juvenile neuronal ceroid lipofuscinosis presents with vision loss and seizures; CLN3 variants confirm; EEG shows occipital spikes.

title: Menkes Disease
text: Menkes disease presents with hypotonia and kinky hair in infancy; low serum copper/ceruloplasmin and ATP7A variants confirm.

title: X-Linked Retinitis Pigmentosa
text: X-linked retinitis pigmentosa presents with night blindness and field loss; ERG shows rod-cone dystrophy; RPGR mutations common.

title: Usher Syndrome
text: Usher syndrome causes retinitis pigmentosa with sensorineural hearing loss; MYO7A/USH2A variants frequent; audiology and ERG aid diagnosis.

title: Oculocutaneous Albinism
text: Oculocutaneous albinism shows hypopigmentation and nystagmus with foveal hypoplasia; TYR/OCA2/SLC45A2 mutations confirm.

title: Bloom Syndrome
text: Bloom syndrome presents with short stature, photosensitivity, and cancer predisposition; BLM helicase mutations confirm; increased sister chromatid exchange.

title: ATM Mutations & Cancer Risk
text: Heterozygous ATM pathogenic variants increase breast cancer risk; consider enhanced screening; in A-T, biallelic variants cause neurodegeneration and radiosensitivity.

title: Hermansky-Pudlak Syndrome
text: HPS presents with oculocutaneous albinism and bleeding diathesis due to platelet dense body deficiency; pulmonary fibrosis in some subtypes; HPS gene variants confirm.

title: Barth Syndrome
text: Barth syndrome causes cardiomyopathy, neutropenia, and growth delay in males; TAZ mutations and abnormal cardiolipin profile confirm.

title: MCAD Deficiency
text: MCAD deficiency presents with hypoketotic hypoglycemia; acylcarnitine profile shows elevated C8; ACADM variants confirm; avoid fasting.

title: VLCAD Deficiency
text: VLCAD deficiency presents with cardiomyopathy or rhabdomyolysis; acylcarnitine profile shows C14:1 elevation; ACADVL mutations confirm.

title: CPT II Deficiency
text: CPT II deficiency causes recurrent myoglobinuria after exercise or fasting; acylcarnitine testing and CPT2 variants confirm; avoid triggers.

title: Refsum Disease
text: Refsum disease presents with retinitis pigmentosa, anosmia, and neuropathy; elevated phytanic acid and PHYH/PEX7 variants confirm; dietary restriction lowers levels.

title: Rubinstein-Taybi Syndrome
text: Rubinstein-Taybi features broad thumbs, facial dysmorphism, and developmental delay; CREBBP/EP300 variants confirm.

title: Trisomy 13 (Patau)
text: Trisomy 13 presents with midline defects and polydactyly; karyotype/microarray confirm; prognosis poor.

title: Trisomy 18 (Edwards)
text: Trisomy 18 presents with clenched fists and rocker-bottom feet; prenatal screening and karyotype confirm; survival limited.

title: Turner Syndrome
text: Turner syndrome presents with short stature and gonadal dysgenesis in females; karyotype shows monosomy X; screen for coarctation and thyroid disease.

title: Klinefelter Syndrome
text: Klinefelter (47,XXY) presents with tall stature and hypogonadism; low testosterone with high LH/FSH; fertility counseling and testosterone therapy needed.

title: Fatal Familial Insomnia
text: Fatal familial insomnia presents with progressive insomnia, dysautonomia, and ataxia; PRNP D178N with methionine at codon 129; PET shows thalamic hypometabolism.

title: Variegate Porphyria
text: Variegate porphyria causes photosensitivity and acute neurovisceral attacks; plasma fluorescence emission at 626 nm and PPOX variants confirm.

title: Remethylation Disorders
text: Cobalamin C disease presents with methylmalonic acidemia and homocystinuria with neurologic signs; elevated MMA and homocysteine; MMACHC variants confirm; treat with hydroxocobalamin.

title: MPS III (Sanfilippo)
text: MPS III presents with developmental regression and behavioral problems; heparan sulfate accumulation and enzyme assays (SGSH, NAGLU) confirm.

title: MPS IV (Morquio)
text: Morquio presents with skeletal dysplasia and short trunk; keratan sulfate elevation and GALNS/GLB1 enzyme defects confirm.

title: MPS VI (Maroteaux-Lamy)
text: MPS VI features coarse facies and dysostosis multiplex; arylsulfatase B deficiency and ARSB mutations confirm.

title: 21-Hydroxylase CAH
text: Classic CAH presents with salt-wasting, ambiguous genitalia in females; elevated 17-hydroxyprogesterone and CYP21A2 variants confirm.

title: Androgen Insensitivity Syndrome
text: AIS presents with phenotypic female external genitalia in 46,XY; high testosterone with androgen receptor mutations; absent uterus on imaging.

title: Kallmann Syndrome
text: Kallmann presents with hypogonadotropic hypogonadism and anosmia; low GnRH-driven LH/FSH; mutations in KAL1/FGFR1, others; MRI olfactory bulbs hypoplastic.

title: Pheochromocytoma/Paraganglioma Workup
text: PPGL presents with headaches, palpitations, and sweats; plasma free metanephrines are sensitive; image with MRI/CT; genetic testing recommended.

title: Neuroendocrine (Carcinoid) Tumors
text: Small-bowel NETs may cause flushing and diarrhea with carcinoid syndrome; 5-HIAA levels and Ga-68 DOTATATE PET/CT for staging.

title: von Willebrand Disease
text: vWD presents with mucocutaneous bleeding; low vWF antigen/activity with abnormal ristocetin cofactor; subtype by multimer analysis.

title: Hemophilia A
text: Hemophilia A presents with hemarthrosis; low FVIII activity confirms; screen for inhibitors in patients with poor response to factor replacement.

title: Childhood ITP
text: Pediatric ITP presents with sudden bruising and petechiae after viral illness; platelets isolated low; most resolve spontaneously; observe unless bleeding.

title: Talaromycosis (Penicilliosis)
text: Talaromyces marneffei causes fever, weight loss, and skin papules in HIV; blood/skin culture confirm; treat with amphotericin then itraconazole.

title: MPS VII (Sly Syndrome)
text: MPS VII presents with coarse facial features, hepatosplenomegaly, and skeletal dysplasia; deficient beta-glucuronidase activity and GUSB variants confirm diagnosis.

title: Alpha-Mannosidosis Review
text: Alpha-mannosidosis causes intellectual disability, hearing loss, and skeletal abnormalities; reduced alpha-mannosidase activity and MAN2B1 mutations confirm.

title: MPS IX (Hyaluronidase Deficiency)
text: MPS IX presents with short stature and multiple soft tissue masses; reduced hyaluronidase activity and HYAL1 variants establish diagnosis.

title: McCune-Albright Syndrome
text: McCune-Albright syndrome presents with café-au-lait spots, precocious puberty, and fibrous dysplasia; somatic GNAS mutations cause constitutive Gs activation.

title: Carpenter Syndrome Review
text: Carpenter syndrome presents with craniosynostosis, polydactyly, and obesity; RAB23 mutations confirm diagnosis; evaluate cardiac and neurological status.

title: Myhre Syndrome Clinical Features
text: Myhre syndrome shows short stature, muscular build, and restricted joint mobility; SMAD4 variants confirm; monitor for cardiovascular complications.

title: Chédiak-Higashi Syndrome
text: Chédiak-Higashi syndrome presents with partial albinism, recurrent infections, and giant granules in leukocytes; LYST mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: Anti-MDA5 Dermatomyositis
text: Anti-MDA5 dermatomyositis features rapidly progressive ILD and characteristic skin ulcers; high ferritin and anti-MDA5 antibodies indicate poor prognosis.

title: SAPHO Syndrome Update
text: SAPHO syndrome presents with synovitis, acne, pustulosis, hyperostosis, and osteitis; whole-body MRI aids diagnosis and monitoring.

title: Late-Onset Pompe Disease
text: Late-onset Pompe disease presents with progressive proximal weakness and respiratory insufficiency; decreased GAA activity and GAA variants confirm diagnosis.

title: Anti-HMGCR Myopathy
text: Anti-HMGCR myopathy causes progressive proximal weakness with highly elevated CK; statin exposure common but not required; muscle biopsy shows necrotizing myopathy.

title: X-Linked Myopathy with Excessive Autophagy
text: XMEA causes slowly progressive proximal weakness in males; muscle biopsy shows autophagic vacuoles; VMA21 variants confirm diagnosis.

title: Nocardiosis
text: Nocardiosis presents with subacute pneumonia or brain abscess in immunocompromised; modified acid-fast branching filaments on stain; culture and speciation guide TMP-SMX therapy.

title: Cervicofacial Actinomycosis
text: Actinomycosis presents with chronic mandibular mass and draining sinuses; sulfur granules on histology; prolonged penicillin indicated.

title: Whipple Disease
text: Whipple disease causes weight loss, diarrhea, and arthralgia; PAS-positive macrophages in small bowel biopsy and Tropheryma whipplei PCR confirm.

title: Systemic Mastocytosis
text: Systemic mastocytosis presents with flushing and anaphylaxis; bone marrow mast cell aggregates and KIT D816V mutation confirm.

title: Congenital CMV
text: Congenital CMV presents with microcephaly and sensorineural hearing loss; PCR from saliva/urine within 3 weeks confirms; valganciclovir may improve hearing outcomes.

title: Parvovirus B19 Infection
text: Parvovirus B19 causes erythema infectiosum and aplastic crisis in hemolytic anemias; IgM or PCR confirms; hydrops fetalis risk in pregnancy.

title: BK Virus Nephropathy
text: BK virus nephropathy presents with rising creatinine in renal transplant; plasma/urine BK PCR high copy and biopsy with SV40 staining confirm.

title: Progressive Multifocal Leukoencephalopathy
text: PML causes subacute focal deficits in immunosuppressed; MRI multifocal white matter lesions and JCV DNA in CSF confirm.

title: Invasive Pulmonary Aspergillosis in Transplant
text: In transplant recipients, invasive aspergillosis presents with fever and pleuritic pain; serum galactomannan and CT halo sign aid early detection.

title: Scedosporium/Lomentospora Infection
text: Scedosporium causes invasive disease in immunocompromised; culture identifies; variable susceptibility necessitates voriconazole-based therapy.

title: Rhino-Orbital Mucormycosis
text: Mucormycosis presents with facial pain, black eschar, and cranial neuropathies in diabetics; urgent MRI/CT and biopsy show broad non-septate hyphae; prompt amphotericin and debridement needed.

title: Macrophage Activation Syndrome in Rheumatic Disease
text: MAS presents with fever, hepatosplenomegaly, cytopenias, and high ferritin in systemic JIA/SLE; low fibrinogen and high triglycerides support; treat with high-dose steroids.

title: Cryopyrin-Associated Periodic Syndromes
text: CAPS includes FCAS, MWS, and NOMID with urticaria-like rash and fever; NLRP3 variants; IL-1 blockade effective.

title: Familial Mediterranean Fever
text: FMF has recurrent fever and serositis; MEFV mutations; colchicine prevents attacks and amyloidosis.

title: TRAPS Syndrome
text: TNF receptor-associated periodic syndrome causes prolonged febrile episodes with myalgia and migratory rash; TNFRSF1A variants; responds to IL-1 inhibitors.

title: Mevalonate Kinase Deficiency (HIDS)
text: HIDS presents with recurrent fever, lymphadenopathy, and elevated IgD; MVK variants; treat with IL-1 blockade in severe cases.

title: Overlap: Behçet & Axial Spondyloarthritis
text: Some patients show overlapping features of Behçet disease and axSpA with uveitis and inflammatory back pain; HLA-B27/HLA-B51 patterns vary; MRI sacroiliitis assists.

title: PANS/PANDAS Evidence Summary
text: PANS/PANDAS characterized by abrupt-onset OCD/tics temporally related to infections; diagnosis clinical after exclusion; evidence for immunotherapy limited and evolving.

title: Autoimmune Gastrointestinal Dysmotility
text: Autoimmune GI dysmotility presents with severe gastroparesis and autonomic symptoms; neuronal AChR or anti-Hu antibodies may be present; autonomic testing supports.

title: Refractory Celiac Disease
text: Refractory celiac disease persists despite gluten-free diet; evaluate for type 2 with aberrant intraepithelial lymphocytes and risk of EATL; capsule endoscopy may detect complications.

title: Eosinophilic Esophagitis
text: EoE presents with dysphagia and food impaction; endoscopic rings/furrows and ≥15 eosinophils/HPF on biopsy; PPI therapy and topical steroids effective.

title: Microscopic Colitis
text: Microscopic colitis presents with chronic watery diarrhea; colonoscopy normal but biopsies show lymphocytic or collagenous patterns; treat with budesonide.

title: PSC-IBD Phenotype
text: PSC with IBD shows right-sided colitis and rectal sparing; increased colorectal cancer risk; colonoscopic surveillance intensified.

title: Autoimmune Pancreatitis
text: Autoimmune pancreatitis presents with painless jaundice and pancreatic swelling; elevated IgG4 and imaging suggest; steroid-responsive after malignancy exclusion.

title: Small Intestinal Bacterial Overgrowth
text: SIBO causes bloating and diarrhea; diagnosis via breath testing or jejunal aspirate culture; treat with targeted antibiotics and address motility disorders.

title: Irritable Bowel Syndrome
text: IBS presents with recurrent abdominal pain related to defecation and change in stool form; Rome criteria diagnose after exclusion of alarm features.

title: Methane-Positive SIBO (IMO)
text: Intestinal methanogen overgrowth correlates with constipation; methane breath test positive; rifaximin plus neomycin more effective than rifaximin alone.

title: Dermatitis Herpetiformis
text: Dermatitis herpetiformis presents with pruritic grouped vesicles on extensor surfaces; granular IgA at dermal papillae on DIF; gluten-free diet and dapsone help.

title: Pyoderma Gangrenosum
text: Pyoderma gangrenosum presents with rapidly progressive painful ulcers with undermined borders, often with IBD; diagnosis of exclusion; treat with steroids or cyclosporine.

title: Hidradenitis Suppurativa
text: Hidradenitis causes recurrent painful nodules and sinus tracts in apocrine areas; staging by Hurley; antibiotics, biologics (anti-TNF) for severe disease.

title: Lupus Nephritis Update
text: Lupus nephritis presents with proteinuria/hematuria; biopsy classifies (ISN/RPS) and guides therapy; anti-dsDNA/complement track activity.

title: IL-6 Inhibition in RA
text: In rheumatoid arthritis refractory to methotrexate, IL-6 receptor blockade improves disease activity; monitor for neutropenia and LFT elevation.

title: Non-Radiographic Axial SpA
text: nr-axSpA presents with inflammatory back pain without radiographic sacroiliitis; MRI STIR bone marrow edema and HLA-B27 support diagnosis; anti-TNF/IL-17 effective.

title: Polymyalgia Rheumatica
text: PMR presents with shoulder and hip girdle aching and elevated ESR/CRP in older adults; rapid response to low-dose steroids supports diagnosis; screen for GCA symptoms.

title: Systemic Sclerosis-Associated ILD
text: SSc-ILD presents with dyspnea and bibasilar crackles; HRCT shows NSIP or UIP patterns; PFTs monitor; immunosuppression or antifibrotics considered.

title: Sine Scleroderma
text: Sine scleroderma is systemic sclerosis without skin thickening; internal organ involvement (ILD, PAH) may occur; ANA centromere or Scl-70 patterns assist.

title: PAH in Connective Tissue Disease
text: Pulmonary arterial hypertension complicates SSc/SLE/MCTD; screen with echocardiography and NT-proBNP; right heart catheterization confirms.

title: Antisynthetase Syndrome
text: Antisynthetase syndrome features myositis, ILD, arthritis, and mechanic’s hands; anti-Jo-1 antibodies common; HRCT and CK guide treatment.

title: Limb-Girdle Muscular Dystrophy 2A
text: LGMD2A (calpainopathy) presents with proximal weakness and scapular winging; CAPN3 variants confirm; CK elevated.

title: Paraneoplastic LEMS
text: Paraneoplastic Lambert-Eaton is associated with small cell lung cancer; P/Q-type VGCC antibodies and incremental RNS response; cancer screening indicated.

title: Miller Fisher Syndrome
text: Miller Fisher variant of GBS presents with ophthalmoplegia, ataxia, and areflexia; anti-GQ1b antibodies are typical.

title: CIDP and Mimics
text: CIDP mimics include hereditary neuropathies and POEMS; careful review of NCS/EMG, CSF, and paraprotein studies helps avoid misdiagnosis.

title: POEMS Syndrome
text: POEMS presents with polyneuropathy, organomegaly, endocrinopathy, monoclonal protein, and skin changes; VEGF elevated; treat plasma cell clone.

title: LRP4-Positive Myasthenia Gravis
text: A subset of seronegative MG has LRP4 antibodies; presents similarly with fatigable weakness; single-fiber EMG helpful.

title: Stiff-Limb Syndrome
text: Focal variant of stiff-person spectrum manifests rigidity/spasms in one limb; anti-GAD or glycine receptor antibodies may be present; EMG shows continuous activity.

title: Non-Dystrophic Myotonias (CLCN1/SCN4A)
text: Non-dystrophic myotonias present with muscle stiffness improved by exercise; EMG myotonic discharges; CLCN1 (Thomsen/Becker) and SCN4A variants confirm.

title: Hypokalemic Periodic Paralysis
text: HypoPP causes episodic weakness triggered by rest after exercise or high carbs; low K+ during attacks; CACNA1S/SCN4A mutations.

title: Myotonic Dystrophy Type 1
text: DM1 presents with myotonia, distal weakness, cataracts, and conduction defects; DMPK CTG repeat expansion confirms; anticipate multi-system care.

title: LRRK2-Associated Parkinson Disease
text: LRRK2 variants (G2019S) cause autosomal dominant Parkinson with typical features; DAT-SPECT supports; penetrance age-dependent.

title: Psychiatric Presentations of Wilson Disease
text: Wilson disease may present with personality changes or depression; low ceruloplasmin and KF rings; chelation improves neuropsychiatric symptoms.

title: LGI1 Encephalitis
text: LGI1 encephalitis presents with faciobrachial dystonic seizures and hyponatremia; serum LGI1-IgG diagnostic; responds to immunotherapy.

title: CASPR2-Associated Morvan Syndrome
text: Morvan syndrome features peripheral nerve hyperexcitability, dysautonomia, and insomnia; CASPR2 antibodies confirm; screen for thymoma.

title: GABA-B Receptor Encephalitis
text: GABA-B encephalitis presents with severe seizures and limbic encephalitis; anti–GABA-B antibodies; often associated with small cell lung cancer.

title: Anti-Hu Sensory Neuronopathy
text: Paraneoplastic anti-Hu causes painful sensory neuronopathy with ataxia; search for small cell lung cancer; antibodies in serum/CSF.

title: Isaacs Syndrome (Neuromyotonia)
text: Isaacs syndrome presents with muscle stiffness and myokymia; EMG shows neuromyotonic discharges; CASPR2/LGI1 antibodies in some cases.

title: Sturge-Weber Syndrome
text: Sturge-Weber presents with facial port-wine stain and leptomeningeal angiomatosis; seizures common; GNAQ somatic variants.

title: Dermatologic Signs in TSC
text: TSC shows hypomelanotic macules, angiofibromas, and shagreen patches; Wood’s lamp helps detection; genetic testing TSC1/TSC2.

title: NF1-Associated Optic Pathway Gliomas
text: Children with NF1 may develop optic pathway gliomas presenting with visual decline; MRI for surveillance; many observed unless progressive.

title: HAE with Normal C1-INH
text: Some HAE patients have normal C1-INH levels/function due to F12 or other variants; estrogen sensitivity noted; treat with bradykinin-pathway agents.

title: Mast Cell Activation Syndrome
text: MCAS presents with episodic anaphylaxis-like symptoms; elevated tryptase during attacks and response to mediator blockade support diagnosis.

title: Viral vs Bacterial URTI
text: Most upper respiratory infections are viral; purulent nasal discharge alone does not predict bacterial disease; avoid unnecessary antibiotics.

title: Acute Bacterial Rhinosinusitis
text: ABRS likely when symptoms persist >10 days, severe fever/purulence for 3–4 days, or double-worsening; amoxicillin-clavulanate first-line.

title: Acute Otitis Media
text: AOM presents with ear pain and bulging tympanic membrane; watchful waiting reasonable in select cases; high-dose amoxicillin commonly used.

title: Streptococcal Pharyngitis
text: Group A strep pharyngitis presents with sore throat and fever without cough; RADT/culture confirm; penicillin or amoxicillin recommended.

title: Community-Acquired Pneumonia in Adults
text: CAP presents with cough, fever, and infiltrate on chest radiograph; severity scores (PSI/CURB-65) guide site of care; macrolide resistance informs empiric therapy.

title: Hospital & Ventilator-Associated Pneumonia
text: HAP/VAP risk MDR pathogens; diagnosis by new infiltrate plus clinical signs; use unit-specific antibiograms for empiric coverage and de-escalate based on cultures.

title: VTE in Pregnancy
text: In pregnancy, suspected PE evaluated with compression ultrasound for DVT and V/Q scan or CTPA if needed; LMWH is treatment of choice.

title: Obstetric APS
text: Obstetric antiphospholipid syndrome causes recurrent pregnancy loss or preeclampsia; persistent aPL positivity required; manage with low-dose aspirin and heparin.

title: Malignancy-Associated HLH
text: Malignancy-associated HLH presents with fever, cytopenias, and ferritin elevation; treat underlying cancer plus HLH-directed therapy (etoposide/steroids).

title: Atypical HUS
text: aHUS presents with MAHA, thrombocytopenia, and renal failure due to complement dysregulation; ADAMTS13 not severely reduced; treat with eculizumab.

title: Catastrophic Antiphospholipid Syndrome
text: CAPS involves rapid small-vessel thrombosis in multiple organs; aPL positive; treat with anticoagulation, high-dose steroids, plasma exchange/IVIG.

title: IgA Nephropathy
text: IgA nephropathy presents with hematuria and variable proteinuria; biopsy with IgA-dominant deposits; risk stratify by proteinuria and eGFR.

title: Membranous Nephropathy
text: Primary membranous features nephrotic syndrome with PLA2R antibodies in majority; biopsy with subepithelial deposits; anti-PLA2R titers track activity.

title: Focal Segmental Glomerulosclerosis
text: FSGS presents with proteinuria and edema; biopsy pattern with podocyte injury; secondary causes include obesity and HIV; consider genetic testing in children.

title: Anti-GBM Disease
source: Clinical Journal of the American Society of Nephrology
text: Anti-GBM disease presents with rapidly progressive glomerulonephritis ± pulmonary hemorrhage; anti-GBM antibodies confirm; treat with plasmapheresis, steroids, cyclophosphamide.

title: C3 Glomerulopathy
text: C3G features predominant C3 deposition on biopsy due to alternative pathway dysregulation; evaluate for C3 nephritic factor and complement gene variants.

title: IgA Vasculitis (Henoch-Schönlein)
text: IgA vasculitis presents with palpable purpura, arthralgia, abdominal pain, and renal involvement; biopsy shows IgA deposition; supportive care for most.

title: Mixed Cryoglobulinemia
text: Mixed cryoglobulinemia presents with purpura, arthralgia, and neuropathy; often HCV-related; low complement; treat underlying HCV plus immunosuppression if severe.

title: Stroke in SLE/APS
text: Young stroke with SLE/APS may reflect arterial thrombosis; test for aCL, β2-GPI, and LAC; anticoagulation indicated in thrombosis.

title: Neurosarcoidosis
text: Neurosarcoidosis presents with cranial neuropathies or myelopathy; MRI/CSF suggest; biopsy from systemic sites when feasible; treat with steroids and immunosuppression.

title: Neuro-Behçet
text: Neuro-Behçet presents with meningoencephalitis or brainstem syndrome; MRI lesions in deep gray/brainstem; CSF neutrophilic; immunosuppression indicated.

title: Approach to Fever of Unknown Origin
text: Fever of unknown origin requires structured evaluation for infection, inflammation, and malignancy; timeline, cultures, imaging, and directed serologies guide diagnosis.

title: Immune Checkpoint Inhibitor-Associated Myocarditis
text: ICI-associated myocarditis can present with chest pain, heart failure, or arrhythmia; troponin, ECG, and cardiac MRI aid diagnosis; prompt high-dose steroids recommended.

title: Post-COVID Interstitial Lung Disease
text: Post-COVID pneumonitis causes persistent dyspnea and fibrosis-like changes on HRCT; PFTs and multidisciplinary review guide immunosuppression versus antifibrotic therapy.

title: Vaccine-Associated Hepatitis Case Review
text: Acute hepatitis temporally following vaccination should prompt workup for common causes and immune-mediated injury; autoimmune markers and biopsy when indicated.

title: Rapid Multiplex Testing for Bacteremia
text: Rapid molecular panels shorten time to organism ID from blood cultures enabling earlier targeted therapy; interpret in clinical context and confirm with culture when needed.

title: Drug-Induced Lupus Erythematosus
text: DIL presents with arthralgia, serositis, and positive antihistone antibodies after exposure to certain drugs; stopping the culprit often leads to resolution.

title: Management of Achalasia
text: Achalasia presents with progressive dysphagia and regurgitation; timed barium swallow, manometry confirm diagnosis; pneumatic dilation or Heller myotomy are definitive therapies.

title: Multidrug-Resistant Tuberculosis
text: MDR-TB requires molecular DST and prolonged combination therapy with second-line agents; adherence support and monitoring for toxicity are critical.

title: Preventing and Managing Delirium in Older Adults
text: Delirium is common in hospitalized elders and multifactorial; identify precipitants, ensure reorientation and hydration, and avoid deliriogenic medications.

title: PSA Screening: Benefits and Harms
text: PSA screening reduces prostate cancer mortality in select cohorts but has risks of overdiagnosis; shared decision-making and risk stratification recommended.

title: Biologic Therapies for Severe Asthma
text: Anti-IgE, anti-IL5, and anti-IL4R biologics reduce exacerbations in selected severe asthma phenotypes; choose based on biomarkers and comorbidities.

title: Necrotizing Soft Tissue Infections
text: High suspicion, rapid imaging, broad-spectrum antibiotics, and urgent surgical debridement determine outcomes in necrotizing fasciitis; early source control is lifesaving.

title: Vaccination Strategies in Solid Organ Transplant Recipients
text: Pre-transplant immunization and post-transplant schedules aim to maximize protection; live vaccines contraindicated after immunosuppression.

title: Hepatitis B Reactivation with Immunosuppression
text: HBV reactivation can occur during chemo or biologics; screen HBsAg/anti-HBc and provide prophylactic antivirals for at-risk patients.

title: Wound Botulism Recognition and Management
text: Wound botulism presents with cranial nerve palsies and descending flaccid paralysis after wound contamination; antitoxin and supportive care including ventilation when needed.

title: Acute Rheumatic Fever Diagnosis
text: ARF follows untreated GAS pharyngitis with migratory arthritis, carditis, and chorea; Jones criteria guide diagnosis and secondary prophylaxis with penicillin.

title: Tuberculous Pleural Effusion
text: TB pleural effusion typically causes exudative lymphocyte-predominant fluid with high ADA; pleural biopsy/culture confirm when needed.

title: Iatrogenic Hypothyroidism After Thyroidectomy
text: Replace levothyroxine guided by TSH; monitor symptoms and adjust dose for weight changes, pregnancy, or interacting medications.

title: Etiology and Early Management of Acute Pancreatitis
text: Gallstones and alcohol are leading causes; early aggressive fluid resuscitation, pain control, and ruling out necrosis guide management.

title: Peripartum Cardiomyopathy Recognition
text: Peripartum cardiomyopathy presents with heart failure near term or postpartum; echo shows reduced EF; treatment includes standard HF therapy and bromocriptine in select cases.

title: Approach to Cryptogenic Stroke and PFO
text: Workup for cryptogenic stroke includes prolonged cardiac monitoring and consideration of PFO closure in selected patients after multidisciplinary review.

title: Management of Diabetic Foot Infections
text: Assess depth and vascular supply; debridement and culture-directed antibiotics plus offloading and glycemic control reduce amputations.

title: HIT Diagnosis and Management
text: Suspect HIT with platelet drop 5–10 days after heparin; stop heparin, start non-heparin anticoagulant, and test for PF4 antibodies.

title: Post-Stroke Depression Screening
text: Screen stroke survivors for depression to improve rehabilitation outcomes; psychotherapy and SSRIs are effective with attention to interactions and bleeding risk.

title: Anemia Management in Chronic Kidney Disease
text: Treat iron deficiency and consider ESAs for symptomatic anemia after evaluating risks; monitor hemoglobin and iron indices regularly.

title: Antibiotic Stewardship in Hospitals
text: Stewardship programs reduce unnecessary antibiotic use and resistance through guideline-based empiric therapy, de-escalation, and audit-feedback.

title: Acute Postinfectious Glomerulonephritis
text: PIGN presents with hematuria, edema, and hypertension after streptococcal infection; supportive care and BP control are mainstays; immunosuppression rarely needed.

title: Mantle Cell Lymphoma Overview
text: MCL presents with lymphadenopathy and splenomegaly; cyclin D1/IGH-CCND1 translocation confirms; treatment depends on stage and fitness.

title: PJP in Immunocompromised Hosts
text: Pneumocystis causes progressive dyspnea and hypoxia; high-dose TMP-SMX and adjunctive steroids for severe disease; diagnosis by PCR or microscopy on respiratory samples.

title: Acute Otitis Externa Treatment
text: Topical antibiotics with corticosteroid reduce symptoms in AOE; consider culture for chronic or refractory cases and address cerumen or canal trauma.

title: Colorectal Cancer Surveillance in IBD
text: Patients with long-standing colonic IBD need earlier and more frequent colonoscopic surveillance due to increased CRC risk; chromoendoscopy improves dysplasia detection.

title: NSAIDs and Symptom Control in Osteoarthritis
text: NSAIDs relieve OA pain but carry GI and CV risks; use lowest effective dose and consider topical agents for localized disease.

title: Sepsis Bundles in Children
text: Early recognition, timely antibiotics, and fluid resuscitation within sepsis bundles reduce mortality in pediatric sepsis; tailor fluids to age and cardiac status.

title: Acute Migraine Management
text: Triptans, NSAIDs, and gepants are effective for acute migraine; treat early and consider antiemetics for associated nausea.

title: Preventing Visual Loss in GCA
text: Immediate high-dose steroids prevent irreversible vision loss in GCA with acute visual symptoms; temporal artery ultrasound (halo sign) aids early diagnosis.

title: Takayasu in Young Women
text: Takayasu arteritis affects young women with limb claudication and BP discrepancies; MRA shows large-vessel stenosis; monitor with imaging and acute phase reactants.

title: SLE/APS Pregnancy Management
text: SLE/APS pregnancies need low-dose aspirin; add prophylactic LMWH for prior obstetric APS; hydroxychloroquine lowers flare risk and improves outcomes.

title: Acute Rheumatic Fever
text: ARF follows untreated strep pharyngitis with migratory polyarthritis and carditis; Jones criteria diagnose; secondary penicillin prophylaxis prevents recurrence.

title: Infective Endocarditis
text: IE presents with fever and new murmur; Duke criteria employ blood cultures and echocardiography; early surgery for heart failure or uncontrolled infection.

title: Myocarditis
text: Myocarditis presents with chest pain and troponin elevation; CMR shows edema and late enhancement; exclude ischemia; biopsy in select cases.

title: Acute Pericarditis
text: Acute pericarditis presents with chest pain relieved by leaning forward and pericardial rub; ECG shows diffuse ST elevation; NSAIDs and colchicine reduce recurrences.

title: HFpEF Diagnostic Algorithm
text: HFpEF presents with exertional dyspnea and preserved EF; H2FPEF or HFA-PEFF scores assist; echocardiography and natriuretic peptides support diagnosis.

title: Fever-Triggered Brugada
text: In Brugada syndrome, fever unmasks ECG changes and increases arrhythmic risk; aggressive antipyresis recommended.

title: Drug-Induced Long QT
text: Many medications prolong QT and predispose to torsades; correct electrolytes and discontinue offending agents; utilize CredibleMeds lists.

title: Wolff-Parkinson-White & AVRT
text: WPW presents with palpitations; ECG delta wave; catheter ablation of accessory pathway cures symptomatic AVRT.

title: Sudden Cardiac Death in Athletes
text: SCD in athletes due to HCM, ARVC, or channelopathies; preparticipation screening focuses on history and ECG in some programs.

title: CKD-MBD Management
text: CKD-MBD includes secondary hyperparathyroidism and bone disease; monitor calcium, phosphate, PTH; phosphate binders and vitamin D analogs used.

title: AKI Definition & Staging
text: AKI defined by rise in serum creatinine or low urine output; stages 1–3 guide prognosis; evaluate prerenal, intrinsic, postrenal causes.

title: Ultra-Low ADAMTS13 in TTP
text: Severe ADAMTS13 activity <10% supports TTP; caplacizumab with plasma exchange and immunosuppression shortens platelet recovery and reduces recurrences.

title: Iron Deficiency Anemia
text: Iron deficiency presents with microcytosis and low ferritin; evaluate for GI blood loss; IV iron for intolerance or severe deficiency.

title: Vitamin B12 Deficiency
text: B12 deficiency causes macrocytosis and neuropathy; low B12 with elevated MMA and homocysteine; treat with parenteral B12 in severe cases.

title: Folate Deficiency
text: Folate deficiency causes macrocytic anemia without neurologic deficits; low folate levels with normal B12; address dietary causes or malabsorption.

title: Thalassemia Trait vs Iron Deficiency
text: Thalassemia trait shows microcytosis with normal ferritin and elevated RBC count; hemoglobin electrophoresis reveals HbA2 elevation in β-thal trait.

title: Cystic Fibrosis Guidelines
text: Cystic fibrosis presents with chronic productive cough, bronchiectasis, and pancreatic insufficiency; diagnosis by sweat chloride ≥60 mmol/L or CFTR variants.

title: Non-CF Bronchiectasis Review
text: Non-CF bronchiectasis presents with chronic cough and purulent sputum; HRCT shows airway dilatation; evaluate for underlying causes like immunodeficiency or ABPA.

title: Allergic Bronchopulmonary Aspergillosis
text: ABPA presents with asthma, fleeting infiltrates, and elevated total IgE; Aspergillus-specific IgE/IgG and central bronchiectasis support diagnosis.

title: Ewing Sarcoma Overview
text: Ewing sarcoma presents with painful bone mass in children; biopsy shows small round blue cells with EWSR1-FLI1 translocation; MRI evaluates extent.

title: Osteosarcoma Review
text: Osteosarcoma presents with pain and swelling around metaphyseal long bones; X-ray shows sunburst pattern; biopsy confirms.

title: Retinoblastoma
text: Retinoblastoma presents with leukocoria and strabismus; diagnosis by ocular exam and imaging; test for RB1 germline mutations.

title: Wilms Tumor
text: Wilms tumor presents with asymptomatic abdominal mass in children; ultrasound and CT abdomen confirm; test for WT1 variants in syndromic cases.

title: Neuroblastoma
text: Neuroblastoma presents with abdominal mass and catecholamine excess; urine VMA/HVA elevated; MIBG scan evaluates metastases.

title: Pheochromocytoma Review
text: Pheochromocytoma presents with episodic headache, sweating, and hypertension; plasma metanephrines highly sensitive; screen for RET/VHL/SDHx mutations.

title: Achondroplasia Summary
text: Achondroplasia presents with disproportionate short stature and frontal bossing; FGFR3 pathogenic variants confirm.

title: Osteogenesis Imperfecta
text: OI presents with recurrent fractures and blue sclerae; COL1A1/COL1A2 mutations confirm; differentiate from non-accidental injury in children.

title: X-linked Hypophosphatemic Rickets
text: XLH presents with bowing of legs and growth delay; low phosphate with high FGF23 and PHEX variants confirm.

title: Severe Combined Immunodeficiency
text: SCID presents in infants with severe infections and failure to thrive; very low T cells and poor lymphocyte proliferation confirm; screen with TREC.

title: Hyperlipoproteinemia Type III
text: Type III hyperlipoproteinemia presents with palmar xanthomas and premature atherosclerosis; APOE2/E2 genotype common.

title: Variant CJD
text: Variant CJD presents with psychiatric symptoms then dementia; linked to BSE; MRI pulvinar sign and tonsil biopsy prion protein detection help diagnosis.

title: Moyamoya Disease
