text: Moyamoya presents with TIA or stroke in children/young adults; cerebral angiography shows progressive stenosis with collateral network.

title: Pyruvate Kinase Deficiency
text: PK deficiency presents with chronic hemolytic anemia and jaundice; low PK activity in RBCs and PKLR variants confirm.

title: Cornelia de Lange Syndrome
text: CdLS presents with distinctive facial features, growth retardation, and limb anomalies; NIPBL variants most common.

title: Smith-Lemli-Opitz Syndrome
text: SLOS presents with microcephaly, syndactyly, and developmental delay; low cholesterol with elevated 7-dehydrocholesterol and DHCR7 variants confirm.

title: Coats Disease
text: Coats disease presents with unilateral retinal telangiectasia and exudation in boys; fluorescein angiography confirms; differentiate from retinoblastoma.

title: Huntington Disease
text: Huntington disease presents with chorea, psychiatric symptoms, and cognitive decline; CAG repeat expansion in HTT confirms.

title: Parkinson Disease
text: Parkinson disease presents with bradykinesia and rest tremor; diagnosis is clinical; consider DaTscan in uncertain cases.

title: Multiple System Atrophy
text: MSA presents with parkinsonism and autonomic failure; MRI shows hot-cross-bun sign in pons; diagnosis is clinical.

title: Progressive Supranuclear Palsy
text: PSP presents with vertical gaze palsy and early falls; MRI midbrain atrophy (hummingbird sign) supports diagnosis.

title: Corticobasal Degeneration
text: CBD presents with asymmetric rigidity/apraxia and cortical sensory loss; diagnosis is clinical; consider tau PET in research.

title: Frontotemporal Dementia
text: FTD presents with behavioral changes and language impairment before memory loss; MRI shows frontal/temporal atrophy; C9orf72 testing in familial cases.

title: Myasthenic Crisis Management
text: Myasthenic crisis presents with respiratory failure in MG; prompt intubation and IVIG/plasmapheresis recommended; treat precipitating factors.

title: Botulism Clinical Review
text: Botulism presents with descending paralysis and blurred vision; diagnosis by mouse bioassay or PCR; administer antitoxin early.

title: Hypocalcemic Tetany
text: Hypocalcemic tetany presents with carpopedal spasm and paresthesias; low ionized calcium with high phosphate; check PTH to differentiate causes.

title: Refsum Disease
text: Refsum disease presents with retinitis pigmentosa, anosmia, and neuropathy; elevated phytanic acid confirms; treat with dietary restriction.

title: X-linked Adrenoleukodystrophy
text: X-ALD presents with behavioral regression and adrenal insufficiency; elevated VLCFA and ABCD1 variants confirm.

title: Canavan Disease
text: Canavan disease presents with macrocephaly and severe developmental delay; elevated NAA on MR spectroscopy and ASPA mutations confirm.

title: Alexander Disease
text: Alexander disease presents with megalencephaly and seizures; MRI shows frontal white matter changes; GFAP mutations confirm.

title: Neurodegeneration with Brain Iron Accumulation
text: NBIA presents with dystonia and parkinsonism; MRI shows basal ganglia iron deposition; PANK2 variants in PKAN subtype.

title: Paroxysmal Kinesigenic Dyskinesia
text: PKD presents with brief attacks of dyskinesia triggered by sudden movement; PRRT2 variants confirm; responds to carbamazepine.

title: Lennox-Gastaut Syndrome
text: LGS presents with multiple seizure types and slow spike-wave EEG; often drug-resistant; consider ketogenic diet and surgery.

title: Dravet Syndrome
text: Dravet presents with prolonged febrile seizures in infancy; SCN1A variants confirm; avoid sodium-channel blockers.

title: Infantile Spasms (West Syndrome)
text: West syndrome presents with epileptic spasms and hypsarrhythmia on EEG; urgent ACTH therapy recommended.

title: Myoclonic-Astatic Epilepsy (Doose)
text: Doose syndrome presents with myoclonic-astatic seizures in childhood; EEG shows generalized spike-wave; some respond to ketogenic diet.

title: Intestinal Angiodysplasia
text: Intestinal angiodysplasia causes recurrent GI bleeding in elders; colonoscopy shows vascular ectasias; treat with endoscopic coagulation or octreotide.

title: Niemann-Pick Type C Review
text: Niemann-Pick disease type C is a rare lysosomal storage disorder presenting with progressive neurological deterioration, hepatosplenomegaly, and vertical supranuclear gaze palsy; diagnosis involves filipin staining of fibroblasts or genetic testing for NPC1/NPC2 mutations.

title: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus Guideline
text: Systemic lupus erythematosus often manifests with malar rash, photosensitivity, oral ulcers, and joint pain; antinuclear antibody (ANA) test is highly sensitive but not specific, with further confirmation via anti-dsDNA or anti-Smith antibodies.

title: Dengue Fever Guideline
text: Dengue fever typically presents with sudden high fever, severe headache, retro-orbital pain, myalgia, and arthralgia; diagnostic tests include NS1 antigen detection and IgM/IgG serology, with thrombocytopenia as a common finding.

title: Gaucher Disease Review
text: Gaucher disease, a lysosomal storage disorder, commonly features hepatosplenomegaly, bone pain, anemia, and thrombocytopenia; enzyme assay for glucocerebrosidase activity or genetic testing confirms diagnosis.

title: Fabry Disease Study
text: Fabry disease presents with angiokeratomas, acroparesthesias, hypohidrosis, and progressive renal failure; alpha-galactosidase A enzyme deficiency is diagnosed via enzyme assay or GLA gene mutation analysis.

title: Pompe Disease Guideline
text: Pompe disease, or glycogen storage disease type II, manifests as hypotonia, cardiomegaly, and respiratory failure in infants; acid alpha-glucosidase deficiency is confirmed by enzyme activity testing or GAA gene sequencing.

title: Rheumatoid Arthritis Review
text: Rheumatoid arthritis typically involves symmetric polyarthritis, morning stiffness, and fatigue; rheumatoid factor and anti-CCP antibodies aid diagnosis, with imaging showing joint erosions.

title: Multiple Sclerosis Guideline
text: Multiple sclerosis presents with optic neuritis, sensory disturbances, weakness, and fatigue; MRI shows demyelinating lesions, and CSF oligoclonal bands support diagnosis.

title: Type 1 Diabetes Review
text: Type 1 diabetes mellitus features polyuria, polydipsia, weight loss, and hyperglycemia; autoantibodies like anti-GAD and islet cell antibodies confirm autoimmune etiology.

title: Psoriasis Study
text: Psoriasis vulgaris presents with erythematous plaques with silvery scales, often on elbows and knees; diagnosis is clinical, supported by biopsy showing epidermal hyperplasia.

title: Breast Cancer Review
text: Breast cancer may present with a palpable lump, nipple discharge, or skin changes; mammography and biopsy are key diagnostic tools, with hormone receptor testing guiding therapy.

title: Lung Cancer Guideline
text: Lung cancer often manifests as persistent cough, hemoptysis, dyspnea, and weight loss; CT scan and bronchoscopy with biopsy confirm diagnosis.

title: Prostate Cancer Review
text: Prostate cancer can present with urinary frequency, nocturia, and hematuria; PSA testing and prostate biopsy are standard for diagnosis.

title: Colorectal Cancer Study
text: Colorectal cancer symptoms include rectal bleeding, altered bowel habits, and abdominal pain; colonoscopy with biopsy is diagnostic.

title: Smith-Magenis Syndrome Review
text: Smith-Magenis syndrome features intellectual disability, sleep disturbances, self-injurious behavior, and facial dysmorphisms; chromosomal microarray detects 17p11.2 deletion.

title: Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome Guideline
text: Ehlers-Danlos syndrome presents with joint hypermobility, skin hyperextensibility, and easy bruising; genetic testing for collagen gene mutations confirms diagnosis.

title: Cystic Fibrosis Review
text: Cystic fibrosis involves chronic respiratory infections, pancreatic insufficiency, and salty sweat; sweat chloride test and CFTR gene analysis are diagnostic.

title: Sickle Cell Disease Study
text: Sickle cell disease causes vaso-occlusive crises, anemia, and infections; hemoglobin electrophoresis detects HbS.

title: Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy Guideline
text: Duchenne muscular dystrophy presents with progressive muscle weakness, calf hypertrophy, and elevated CK; dystrophin gene testing confirms.

title: Ebola Virus Disease Review
text: Ebola virus disease manifests with fever, diarrhea, vomiting, and hemorrhagic symptoms; RT-PCR detects viral RNA for diagnosis.

title: Zika Virus Infection Guideline
text: Zika virus infection presents with mild fever, rash, conjunctivitis, and arthralgia; serology and PCR confirm infection, with risks for microcephaly in fetuses.

title: Tuberculosis Review
text: Tuberculosis typically involves chronic cough, hemoptysis, night sweats, and weight loss; sputum AFB smear and culture diagnose active disease.

title: Malaria Guideline
text: Malaria presents with cyclic fever, chills, headache, and anemia; blood smear identifies Plasmodium parasites.

title: HIV Infection Review
text: HIV infection may present with flu-like symptoms initially, progressing to opportunistic infections; ELISA and Western blot confirm, with CD4 count monitoring.

title: COVID-19 Guideline
text: COVID-19 presents with fever, dry cough, dyspnea, and loss of taste/smell; RT-PCR from nasopharyngeal swab diagnoses infection.

title: Hepatitis C Review
text: Hepatitis C often asymptomatic but can cause fatigue, jaundice, and liver cirrhosis; anti-HCV antibody and HCV RNA testing confirm.

title: Lyme Disease Study
text: Lyme disease features erythema migrans rash, arthralgia, and neurological symptoms; ELISA followed by Western blot serology diagnoses.

title: Krabbe Disease Review
text: Krabbe disease, a sphingolipidosis, presents with irritability, spasticity, and demyelination; galactocerebrosidase enzyme assay confirms.

title: Mucopolysaccharidosis Type I Guideline
text: Hurler syndrome (MPS I) involves coarse facial features, skeletal deformities, and corneal clouding; iduronidase deficiency diagnosed by enzyme assay.

title: Sanfilippo Syndrome Review
text: Sanfilippo syndrome (MPS III) presents with behavioral problems, developmental delay, and mild skeletal changes; heparan sulfamidase deficiency via enzyme testing.

title: Tay-Sachs Disease Study
text: Tay-Sachs disease features cherry-red spot on macula, hypotonia, and seizures; hexosaminidase A deficiency confirmed by enzyme assay.

title: Metachromatic Leukodystrophy Guideline
text: Metachromatic leukodystrophy presents with gait disturbance, spasticity, and cognitive decline; arylsulfatase A deficiency diagnosed by enzyme activity.

title: Crohn's Disease Review
text: Crohn's disease involves abdominal pain, diarrhea, weight loss, and fatigue; colonoscopy with biopsy shows transmural inflammation.

title: Ulcerative Colitis Guideline
text: Ulcerative colitis presents with bloody diarrhea, urgency, and abdominal cramps; sigmoidoscopy reveals mucosal ulceration.

title: Graves' Disease Review
text: Graves' disease features hyperthyroidism with goiter, exophthalmos, and tachycardia; TSH receptor antibodies and low TSH confirm.

title: Sjogren's Syndrome Study
text: Sjogren's syndrome presents with dry eyes, dry mouth, and parotid swelling; anti-SSA/SSB antibodies and lip biopsy aid diagnosis.

title: Scleroderma Guideline
text: Scleroderma involves skin thickening, Raynaud's phenomenon, and internal organ fibrosis; anti-centromere or anti-Scl70 antibodies support diagnosis.

title: Vasculitis Review
text: Vasculitis presents with fever, fatigue, purpura, and organ involvement; ANCA testing and biopsy confirm specific types.

title: Myositis Study
text: Dermatomyositis features heliotrope rash, Gottron's papules, and muscle weakness; CK elevation and muscle biopsy diagnose.

title: Skin Cancer Review
text: Non-melanoma skin cancer presents as changing moles or non-healing sores; biopsy confirms basal or squamous cell carcinoma.

title: Melanoma Guideline
text: Melanoma features asymmetric moles with irregular borders and color variation; dermoscopy and excision biopsy diagnose.

title: Leukemia Review
text: Acute myeloid leukemia presents with fatigue, bruising, infections, and anemia; bone marrow biopsy shows blasts.

title: Lymphoma Study
text: Hodgkin lymphoma involves painless lymphadenopathy, night sweats, and fever; Reed-Sternberg cells on lymph node biopsy.

title: Pancreatic Cancer Guideline
text: Pancreatic cancer presents with jaundice, abdominal pain, and weight loss; CT scan and CA19-9 marker aid diagnosis.

title: Ovarian Cancer Review
text: Ovarian cancer may present with bloating, pelvic pain, and ascites; transvaginal ultrasound and CA-125 testing screen.

title: Brain Tumor Study
text: Brain tumors present with headaches, seizures, and neurological deficits; MRI and biopsy confirm type.

title: Alpha-1 Antitrypsin Deficiency Review
text: Alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency causes emphysema, liver cirrhosis, and dyspnea; serum AAT level and genotyping diagnose.

title: Tyrosinemia Guideline
text: Tyrosinemia type I presents with liver failure, rickets, and neurological crises; succinylacetone in urine confirms.

title: Wilson's Disease Review
text: Wilson's disease features Kayser-Fleischer rings, hepatic dysfunction, and neuropsychiatric symptoms; low ceruloplasmin and genetic testing diagnose.

title: Alzheimer's Disease Study
text: Alzheimer's disease presents with memory loss, confusion, and behavioral changes; PET scan shows amyloid plaques.

title: Parkinson's Disease Guideline
text: Parkinson's disease involves tremor, bradykinesia, rigidity, and postural instability; DaTscan aids diagnosis.

title: Niemann-Pick Type C Update
text: Niemann-Pick type C may have adult-onset with psychiatric symptoms, ataxia, and dystonia; oxysterol levels in plasma are elevated for screening.

title: SLE Diagnostic Criteria
text: Systemic lupus erythematosus diagnostic criteria include photosensitivity, discoid rash, and renal disorder; complement levels like C3/C4 are often low.

title: Severe Dengue Review
text: Severe dengue involves plasma leakage, severe bleeding, and organ impairment; monitoring hematocrit and platelet count is crucial.

title: Gaucher Disease Type 1
text: Gaucher disease type 1 presents without neurological involvement but with splenomegaly and bone crises; chitotriosidase levels are elevated.

title: Fabry Disease Cardiac Variant
text: Cardiac variant of Fabry disease features left ventricular hypertrophy and arrhythmias; lyso-Gb3 biomarker aids diagnosis.

title: Late-Onset Pompe Disease
text: Late-onset Pompe disease presents with progressive limb-girdle weakness and respiratory insufficiency; dried blood spot GAA activity test screens.

title: Rheumatoid Arthritis Early Diagnosis
text: Early rheumatoid arthritis may have swollen tender joints and elevated CRP/ESR; ultrasound detects synovitis.

title: Relapsing-Remitting MS Review
text: Relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis involves episodes of new symptoms followed by recovery; evoked potentials test nerve function.

title: Type 1 Diabetes Autoantibodies
text: Type 1 diabetes autoantibodies include anti-insulin and anti-IA2; random blood glucose over 200 mg/dL with symptoms diagnoses.

title: Psoriatic Arthritis Complication
text: Psoriatic arthritis presents with dactylitis, enthesitis, and nail pitting; X-ray shows pencil-in-cup deformity.

title: HER2-Positive Breast Cancer
text: HER2-positive breast cancer may be aggressive; IHC or FISH testing for HER2 status guides targeted therapy.

title: Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
text: Non-small cell lung cancer presents with chest pain and hoarseness; PET-CT staging and molecular testing for EGFR mutations.

title: Prostate Cancer Screening
text: Prostate cancer screening with PSA may detect indolent disease; digital rectal exam and MRI-targeted biopsy improve accuracy.

title: Colorectal Cancer Genetics
text: Familial adenomatous polyposis increases colorectal cancer risk; genetic testing for APC mutations.

title: Smith-Magenis Syndrome Behavioral
text: Smith-Magenis syndrome behavioral issues include self-hugging and polyembolokoilamania; sleep study reveals inverted melatonin rhythm.

title: Vascular Ehlers-Danlos
text: Vascular Ehlers-Danlos syndrome risks arterial rupture; COL3A1 gene testing confirms.

title: Cystic Fibrosis Newborn Screening
text: Cystic fibrosis newborn screening measures immunoreactive trypsinogen; confirmatory sweat test.

title: Sickle Cell Trait
text: Sickle cell trait is asymptomatic but risks under hypoxia; hemoglobin solubility test distinguishes.

title: Duchenne Carrier Testing
text: Duchenne muscular dystrophy carriers may have mild symptoms; MLPA detects deletions/duplications in dystrophin gene.

title: Ebola Outbreak Response
text: Ebola requires contact tracing and isolation; antigen detection tests for rapid diagnosis.

title: Zika Pregnancy Risks
text: Zika in pregnancy causes congenital anomalies; amniocentesis for Zika RNA testing.

title: Multidrug-Resistant TB
text: MDR-TB requires second-line drugs; GeneXpert MTB/RIF detects resistance.

title: Plasmodium Falciparum Malaria
text: Falciparum malaria risks cerebral involvement; rapid diagnostic tests for antigens.

title: HIV PrEP Guidelines
text: HIV prevention with PrEP for high-risk; fourth-generation antigen/antibody test screens.

title: COVID-19 Variants
text: COVID-19 variants may evade immunity; sequencing identifies mutations.

title: Hepatitis C Direct-Acting Antivirals
text: HCV treatment with DAAs cures most; fibrosis assessment by FibroScan.

title: Chronic Lyme Disease Debate
text: Post-treatment Lyme syndrome features persistent fatigue; no evidence for chronic infection.

title: Krabbe Newborn Screening
text: Krabbe disease screening measures GALC activity; confirmatory genetic testing.

title: MPS I Enzyme Replacement
text: MPS I treatment with laronidase; urinary GAG levels monitor response.

title: Sanfilippo Gene Therapy Trials
text: Sanfilippo syndrome trials with AAV vectors; CSF heparan sulfate measures efficacy.

title: Tay-Sachs Carrier Screening
text: Tay-Sachs carrier screening in Ashkenazi Jews; HEXA enzyme assay.

title: MLD Stem Cell Transplant
text: Metachromatic leukodystrophy treatment with HSCT; ARSA gene therapy emerging.

title: Crohn's Biologic Therapy
text: Crohn's disease managed with anti-TNF; fecal calprotectin monitors inflammation.

title: Ulcerative Colitis Colectomy Indications
text: Refractory ulcerative colitis may require surgery; endoscopic scoring assesses severity.

title: Graves' Ophthalmopathy
text: Graves' ophthalmopathy features proptosis and diplopia; CT orbit shows muscle enlargement.

title: Sjogren's Lymphoma Risk
text: Sjogren's increases lymphoma risk; Schirmer's test measures tear production.

title: Limited Scleroderma
text: Limited scleroderma with CREST syndrome; nailfold capillaroscopy shows abnormalities.

title: ANCA-Associated Vasculitis
text: ANCA vasculitis involves glomerulonephritis; PR3/MPO antibodies specify.

title: Inclusion Body Myositis
text: Inclusion body myositis presents with finger flexor weakness; EMG shows myopathic changes.

title: Basal Cell Carcinoma
text: Basal cell carcinoma as pearly nodule; Mohs surgery for high-risk.

title: Melanoma Staging
text: Melanoma staging uses Breslow thickness; sentinel node biopsy for intermediate.

title: Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
text: CLL presents with lymphocytosis; flow cytometry detects CD5+ B cells.

title: Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma
text: NHL subtypes include DLBCL; PET-CT for staging.

title: Pancreatic Adenocarcinoma
text: Pancreatic cancer with back pain; EUS-FNA for biopsy.

title: Ovarian Cancer BRCA
text: BRCA mutations increase ovarian cancer risk; PARP inhibitors for treatment.

title: Glioblastoma Multiforme
text: GBM with contrast-enhancing mass on MRI; IDH mutation testing.

title: Alpha-1 Lung Disease
text: Alpha-1 causes early-onset COPD; phenotype testing PiZZ.

title: Tyrosinemia Treatment NTBC
text: Tyrosinemia treated with nitisinone; alpha-fetoprotein monitors liver cancer risk.

title: Wilson's Disease Penicillamine
text: Wilson's disease chelation with penicillamine; 24-hour urine copper measures.

title: Alzheimer's Biomarkers
text: Alzheimer's CSF tau and amyloid beta; APOE genotyping risks.

title: Parkinson's Levodopa Therapy
text: Parkinson's response to levodopa; alpha-synuclein in Lewy bodies.

title: Niemann-Pick Type C Review
text: Niemann-Pick Type C presents with hepatosplenomegaly, vertical supranuclear gaze palsy, and progressive neurodegeneration. Filipin staining and NPC1/NPC2 genetic testing confirm diagnosis.

title: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus Diagnostic Guidelines
text: Systemic lupus erythematosus commonly presents with malar rash, arthritis, and renal involvement. ANA testing shows sensitivity >95% but requires specific autoantibody confirmation.

title: Gaucher Disease Clinical Review
text: Gaucher disease type I presents with splenomegaly, thrombocytopenia, and bone pain. Glucocerebrosidase enzyme activity and GBA gene mutations provide definitive diagnosis.

title: Marfan Syndrome Diagnostic Criteria
text: Marfan syndrome features aortic root dilatation, lens dislocation, and tall stature with arachnodactyly. Echocardiography and FBN1 genetic testing aid diagnosis.

title: Fabry Disease Review
text: Fabry disease presents with acroparesthesias, angiokeratoma, and progressive renal dysfunction. Alpha-galactosidase A enzyme assay and GLA gene analysis confirm diagnosis.

title: Dengue Fever Diagnostic Guidelines
text: Dengue fever presents with high fever, severe headache, and thrombocytopenia. NS1 antigen, IgM/IgG serology, and RT-PCR provide diagnostic confirmation.

title: Tay-Sachs Disease Clinical Features
text: Tay-Sachs disease shows progressive neurodegeneration, cherry-red spot on fundoscopy, and developmental regression. Hexosaminidase A enzyme deficiency confirms diagnosis.

title: Rheumatoid Arthritis Guidelines
text: Rheumatoid arthritis presents with symmetric polyarthritis, morning stiffness, and joint erosions. RF and anti-CCP antibodies with elevated ESR support diagnosis.

title: Pompe Disease Review
text: Pompe disease causes progressive muscle weakness, cardiomyopathy in infantile form, and respiratory insufficiency. Acid maltase enzyme assay and GAA gene testing confirm diagnosis.

title: Malaria Diagnostic Standards
text: Malaria presents with fever, chills, and splenomegaly with potential cerebral involvement. Thick and thin blood smears with rapid diagnostic tests enable diagnosis.

title: Hunter Syndrome Clinical Review
text: Hunter syndrome shows coarse facial features, hepatosplenomegaly, and joint stiffness without corneal clouding. Iduronate-2-sulfatase enzyme assay confirms diagnosis.

title: Sjögren Syndrome Diagnostic Criteria
text: Sjögren syndrome presents with dry eyes, dry mouth, and parotid gland swelling. Anti-Ro/SSA and Anti-La/SSB antibodies with Schirmer test support diagnosis.

title: Wilson Disease Guidelines
text: Wilson disease presents with hepatic dysfunction, neuropsychiatric symptoms, and Kayser-Fleischer rings. Low serum ceruloplasmin and elevated urinary copper confirm diagnosis.

title: Tuberculosis Diagnostic Guidelines
text: Tuberculosis presents with chronic cough, night sweats, and weight loss with hemoptysis. Sputum AFB smear, culture, and GeneXpert MTB/RIF provide diagnosis.

title: Hurler Syndrome Review
text: Hurler syndrome shows coarse facial features, corneal clouding, and developmental delay with hepatosplenomegaly. Alpha-L-iduronidase enzyme deficiency confirms diagnosis.

title: Multiple Sclerosis Diagnostic Criteria
text: Multiple sclerosis presents with neurological symptoms disseminated in time and space including optic neuritis. MRI brain/spine and CSF oligoclonal bands aid diagnosis.

title: Krabbe Disease Clinical Features
text: Krabbe disease shows progressive neurodegeneration, peripheral neuropathy, and optic atrophy. Galactocerebrosidase enzyme deficiency and GALC gene mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: Typhoid Fever Guidelines
text: Typhoid fever presents with sustained fever, rose spots, and relative bradycardia with splenomegaly. Blood culture and Widal test support diagnosis.

title: Sanfilippo Syndrome Review
text: Sanfilippo syndrome presents with severe behavioral problems, developmental regression, and coarse hair without significant somatic features. Heparan sulfate enzyme assays confirm subtypes.

title: Antiphospholipid Syndrome Guidelines
text: Antiphospholipid syndrome presents with recurrent thrombosis, pregnancy morbidity, and thrombocytopenia. Lupus anticoagulant, anticardiolipin, and anti-β2GP1 antibodies confirm diagnosis.

title: Metachromatic Leukodystrophy Review
text: Metachromatic leukodystrophy shows progressive neurodegeneration, peripheral neuropathy, and white matter changes on MRI. Arylsulfatase A deficiency confirms diagnosis.

title: Hepatitis B Diagnostic Standards
text: Chronic hepatitis B presents with fatigue, hepatomegaly, and elevated ALT with potential cirrhosis. HBsAg, HBeAg, and HBV DNA quantification guide management.

title: MPS VI Clinical Review
text: Mucopolysaccharidosis VI presents with short stature, corneal clouding, and joint stiffness with preserved intelligence. Arylsulfatase B enzyme deficiency confirms diagnosis.

title: Inflammatory Bowel Disease Guidelines
text: Inflammatory bowel disease presents with chronic diarrhea, abdominal pain, and weight loss with extraintestinal manifestations. Colonoscopy with biopsy and inflammatory markers aid diagnosis.

title: X-linked Adrenoleukodystrophy Review
text: X-linked adrenoleukodystrophy presents with behavioral changes, adrenal insufficiency, and cerebral demyelination. Elevated very long chain fatty acids and ABCD1 mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: Yellow Fever Clinical Guidelines
text: Yellow fever presents with acute onset fever, jaundice, and hemorrhagic manifestations in severe cases. IgM serology and RT-PCR provide diagnostic confirmation.

title: Glycogen Storage Disease Type I
text: Glycogen storage disease type I presents with hepatomegaly, hypoglycemia, and growth retardation with lactic acidosis. G6PC enzyme assay confirms diagnosis.

title: Celiac Disease Diagnostic Guidelines
text: Celiac disease presents with chronic diarrhea, weight loss, and abdominal distension with dermatitis herpetiformis. Tissue transglutaminase antibodies and duodenal biopsy confirm diagnosis.

title: Leigh Syndrome Review
text: Leigh syndrome presents with psychomotor regression, feeding difficulties, and characteristic brainstem lesions on MRI. Respiratory chain enzyme defects and mitochondrial DNA mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: Zika Virus Infection Guidelines
text: Zika virus presents with mild fever, rash, and arthralgia with conjunctivitis in endemic areas. RT-PCR and IgM serology provide diagnostic confirmation.

title: Cystic Fibrosis Clinical Review
text: Cystic fibrosis presents with recurrent pulmonary infections, pancreatic insufficiency, and elevated sweat chloride. CFTR gene mutations and sweat test confirm diagnosis.

title: Myasthenia Gravis Guidelines
text: Myasthenia gravis presents with fluctuating muscle weakness, ptosis, and diplopia worsening with activity. Acetylcholine receptor antibodies and edrophonium test support diagnosis.

title: Neurofibromatosis Type 1 Review
text: Neurofibromatosis type 1 presents with café-au-lait macules, neurofibromas, and iris hamartomas with learning disabilities. Clinical criteria and NF1 gene testing confirm diagnosis.

title: Chikungunya Fever Guidelines
text: Chikungunya fever presents with acute onset high fever, severe arthralgia, and maculopapular rash. RT-PCR and IgM/IgG serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Alkaptonuria Clinical Features
text: Alkaptonuria presents with dark urine, ochronosis, and arthropathy with cardiac valve involvement. Elevated urinary homogentisic acid and HGD gene mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: Psoriasis Diagnostic Guidelines
text: Psoriasis presents with well-demarcated erythematous plaques with silvery scales and nail pitting. Clinical diagnosis supported by histopathology when atypical.

title: Phenylketonuria Review
text: Phenylketonuria presents with intellectual disability, seizures, and musty odor if untreated. Elevated phenylalanine levels and PAH gene mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: Ebola Virus Disease Guidelines
text: Ebola virus disease presents with acute onset fever, myalgia, and hemorrhagic manifestations with high mortality. RT-PCR and antigen detection provide rapid diagnosis.

title: Systemic Sclerosis Guidelines
text: Systemic sclerosis presents with skin thickening, Raynaud phenomenon, and digital ulcers with pulmonary involvement. Anti-Scl-70 and anticentromere antibodies aid diagnosis.

title: Lesch-Nyhan Syndrome Review
text: Lesch-Nyhan syndrome presents with self-mutilating behavior, choreoathetosis, and intellectual disability in males. HPRT1 enzyme deficiency and elevated uric acid confirm diagnosis.

title: Lassa Fever Clinical Guidelines
text: Lassa fever presents with gradual onset fever, weakness, and hemorrhagic manifestations in West Africa. RT-PCR and antigen ELISA provide diagnostic confirmation.

title: MPS I Clinical Spectrum
text: Mucopolysaccharidosis I presents with coarse facial features, hepatosplenomegaly, and corneal clouding with variable severity. Alpha-L-iduronidase enzyme deficiency confirms diagnosis.

title: Type 1 Diabetes Guidelines
text: Type 1 diabetes presents with polyuria, polydipsia, and weight loss with ketoacidosis risk. Elevated glucose, positive autoantibodies, and low C-peptide confirm diagnosis.

title: Prader-Willi Syndrome Review
text: Prader-Willi syndrome presents with neonatal hypotonia, feeding difficulties, and later hyperphagia with obesity. Methylation analysis of chromosome 15q11-q13 confirms diagnosis.

title: HIV Infection Guidelines
text: HIV infection presents with acute retroviral syndrome, opportunistic infections, and CD4+ T cell depletion. Fourth-generation ELISA and viral load quantification guide management.

title: Angelman Syndrome Clinical Features
text: Angelman syndrome presents with severe intellectual disability, seizures, and characteristic happy demeanor with ataxic gait. UBE3A gene mutations and methylation analysis confirm diagnosis.

title: Influenza Diagnostic Guidelines
text: Influenza presents with acute onset fever, myalgia, and respiratory symptoms during epidemic periods. Rapid antigen tests and RT-PCR provide diagnostic confirmation.

title: Rett Syndrome Review
text: Rett syndrome presents with developmental regression, stereotypic hand movements, and loss of purposeful hand use in females. MECP2 gene mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: Bacterial Meningitis Guidelines
text: Bacterial meningitis presents with fever, neck stiffness, and altered mental status with photophobia. CSF analysis showing elevated WBC and low glucose confirms diagnosis.

title: Smith-Lemli-Opitz Syndrome
text: Smith-Lemli-Opitz syndrome presents with growth retardation, intellectual disability, and characteristic facial features with genital abnormalities. Elevated 7-dehydrocholesterol and DHCR7 mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: Graves Disease Guidelines
text: Graves disease presents with hyperthyroidism, goiter, and ophthalmopathy with pretibial myxedema. TSH receptor antibodies and radioiodine uptake confirm diagnosis.

title: Fragile X Syndrome Review
text: Fragile X syndrome presents with intellectual disability, macroorchidism, and characteristic facial features with autism spectrum behaviors. FMR1 CGG repeat expansion confirms diagnosis.

title: Community-Acquired Pneumonia Guidelines
text: Community-acquired pneumonia presents with fever, productive cough, and pleuritic chest pain with dyspnea. Chest X-ray and sputum culture guide diagnosis and treatment.

title: Williams Syndrome Clinical Features
text: Williams syndrome presents with intellectual disability, characteristic elfin facies, and supravalvular aortic stenosis with hypercalcemia. ELN gene deletion confirms diagnosis.

title: Hashimoto Thyroiditis Guidelines
text: Hashimoto thyroiditis presents with hypothyroidism, goiter, and fatigue with cold intolerance. Elevated TSH, anti-TPO antibodies, and thyroid ultrasound support diagnosis.

title: Beckwith-Wiedemann Syndrome
text: Beckwith-Wiedemann syndrome presents with macroglossia, omphalocele, and hemihypertrophy with increased tumor risk. Methylation analysis of 11p15 region confirms diagnosis.

title: Sepsis Diagnostic Criteria
text: Sepsis presents with systemic inflammatory response, organ dysfunction, and altered mental status. Blood cultures, lactate levels, and qSOFA score guide diagnosis.

title: Cornelia de Lange Syndrome
text: Cornelia de Lange syndrome presents with growth retardation, characteristic facial features, and limb defects with intellectual disability. NIPBL gene mutations confirm majority of cases.

title: Addison Disease Guidelines
text: Addison disease presents with fatigue, hyperpigmentation, and salt craving with hypotension. Low cortisol, elevated ACTH, and adrenal antibodies confirm diagnosis.

title: Rubinstein-Taybi Syndrome Review
text: Rubinstein-Taybi syndrome presents with intellectual disability, broad thumbs and toes, and characteristic facial features. CREBBP or EP300 gene mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: Pertussis Diagnostic Guidelines
text: Pertussis presents with paroxysmal cough, inspiratory whoop, and post-tussive vomiting especially in infants. PCR and culture of nasopharyngeal specimens confirm diagnosis.

title: Noonan Syndrome Clinical Features
text: Noonan syndrome presents with short stature, webbed neck, and congenital heart defects with bleeding tendency. Clinical criteria and RAS/MAPK pathway gene mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: ANCA-Associated Vasculitis Guidelines
text: ANCA-associated vasculitis presents with multi-system involvement, glomerulonephritis, and pulmonary hemorrhage. c-ANCA/PR3 or p-ANCA/MPO antibodies support diagnosis.

title: CHARGE Syndrome Review
text: CHARGE syndrome presents with coloboma, heart defects, and choanal atresia with growth retardation. CHD7 gene mutations confirm majority of cases.

title: Streptococcal Pharyngitis Guidelines
text: Streptococcal pharyngitis presents with sore throat, fever, and tonsillar exudate with cervical lymphadenopathy. Rapid antigen test and throat culture confirm diagnosis.

title: 22q11.2 Deletion Syndrome
text: 22q11.2 deletion syndrome presents with congenital heart defects, palatal abnormalities, and characteristic facial features with immunodeficiency. FISH or microarray analysis confirms deletion.

title: Dermatomyositis Guidelines
text: Dermatomyositis presents with proximal muscle weakness, characteristic skin rash, and elevated muscle enzymes. Anti-Jo1 and other myositis-specific antibodies aid diagnosis.

title: Wolf-Hirschhorn Syndrome Review
text: Wolf-Hirschhorn syndrome presents with growth retardation, intellectual disability, and characteristic Greek helmet facies with seizures. 4p16.3 deletion confirms diagnosis.

title: Lyme Disease Diagnostic Guidelines
text: Lyme disease presents with erythema migrans, arthritis, and neurological symptoms in endemic areas. Two-tier ELISA and Western blot serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Cri-du-Chat Syndrome Clinical Features
text: Cri-du-chat syndrome presents with high-pitched cry, intellectual disability, and characteristic facial features with microcephaly. 5p deletion confirms diagnosis.

title: Giant Cell Arteritis Guidelines
text: Giant cell arteritis presents with headache, jaw claudication, and visual symptoms with elevated ESR. Temporal artery biopsy remains gold standard for diagnosis.

title: Jacobsen Syndrome Review
text: Jacobsen syndrome presents with growth retardation, intellectual disability, and bleeding tendency with characteristic facial features. 11q terminal deletion confirms diagnosis.

title: Respiratory Syncytial Virus Guidelines
text: RSV presents with bronchiolitis, wheezing, and respiratory distress especially in infants and elderly. Rapid antigen test and RT-PCR provide diagnostic confirmation.

title: Miller-Dieker Syndrome Clinical Features
text: Miller-Dieker syndrome presents with lissencephaly, severe intellectual disability, and characteristic facial features with seizures. 17p13.3 deletion including LIS1 gene confirms diagnosis.

title: Polymyalgia Rheumatica Guidelines
text: Polymyalgia rheumatica presents with bilateral shoulder and hip girdle pain and stiffness with elevated ESR in elderly. Dramatic response to corticosteroids supports diagnosis.

title: Alagille Syndrome Review
text: Alagille syndrome presents with cholestasis, characteristic facial features, and vertebral abnormalities with pulmonary stenosis. JAG1 or NOTCH2 gene mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: RMSF Diagnostic Guidelines
text: Rocky Mountain spotted fever presents with fever, headache, and petechial rash starting at wrists and ankles. Indirect fluorescent antibody and PCR confirm diagnosis.

title: Sotos Syndrome Clinical Features
text: Sotos syndrome presents with overgrowth, macrocephaly, and characteristic facial features with learning disabilities. NSD1 gene mutations or deletions confirm diagnosis.

title: Fibromyalgia Diagnostic Criteria
text: Fibromyalgia presents with widespread pain, fatigue, and tender points with sleep disturbances. Clinical criteria including widespread pain index and symptom severity score guide diagnosis.

title: Koolen-de Vries Syndrome
text: Koolen-de Vries syndrome presents with intellectual disability, hypotonia, and characteristic facial features with epilepsy. 17q21.31 deletion or KANSL1 mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: Q Fever Diagnostic Guidelines
text: Q fever presents with acute febrile illness, pneumonia, and hepatitis with potential chronic endocarditis. Phase I and II antibodies against Coxiella burnetii confirm diagnosis.

title: Pitt-Hopkins Syndrome Review
text: Pitt-Hopkins syndrome presents with severe intellectual disability, distinctive facial features, and breathing abnormalities with seizures. TCF4 gene mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: Temporal Arteritis Guidelines
text: Temporal arteritis presents with unilateral headache, scalp tenderness, and visual loss with jaw claudication. Elevated ESR, CRP, and temporal artery biopsy confirm diagnosis.

title: Mowat-Wilson Syndrome Clinical Features
text: Mowat-Wilson syndrome presents with intellectual disability, distinctive facial features, and Hirschsprung disease with seizures. ZEB2 gene mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: Brucellosis Diagnostic Guidelines
text: Brucellosis presents with undulant fever, arthralgia, and hepatosplenomegaly with night sweats. Rose Bengal test and Brucella agglutination titers confirm diagnosis.

title: Kabuki Syndrome Review
text: Kabuki syndrome presents with characteristic facial features, intellectual disability, and short stature with congenital heart defects. KMT2D or KDM6A gene mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: Behçet Disease Guidelines
text: Behçet disease presents with recurrent oral ulcers, genital ulcers, and ocular involvement with skin lesions. Clinical criteria based on major and minor symptoms guide diagnosis.

title: Kleefstra Syndrome Clinical Features
text: Kleefstra syndrome presents with intellectual disability, hypotonia, and characteristic facial features with behavioral problems. 9q34.3 deletion or EHMT1 mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: Tularemia Diagnostic Guidelines
text: Tularemia presents with ulceroglandular lesions, fever, and regional lymphadenopathy after animal exposure. Francisella tularensis PCR and serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Coffin-Siris Syndrome Review
text: Coffin-Siris syndrome presents with intellectual disability, hypoplastic fifth fingernails, and coarse facial features with sparse scalp hair. SWI/SNF complex gene mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: Takayasu Arteritis Guidelines
text: Takayasu arteritis presents with claudication, blood pressure discrepancies, and arterial bruits in young women. CT/MR angiography and elevated inflammatory markers support diagnosis.

title: Alpha Thalassemia Clinical Review
text: Alpha thalassemia presents with microcytic hypochromic anemia, splenomegaly, and variable severity from carrier to hydrops fetalis. Alpha globin gene analysis confirms diagnosis.

title: Psittacosis Diagnostic Guidelines
text: Psittacosis presents with atypical pneumonia, fever, and headache with bird exposure history. Chlamydia psittaci PCR and complement fixation test confirm diagnosis.

title: Beta Thalassemia Major Review
text: Beta thalassemia major presents with severe anemia, hepatosplenomegaly, and growth retardation requiring transfusions. Beta globin gene mutations and hemoglobin electrophoresis confirm diagnosis.

title: Kawasaki Disease Guidelines
text: Kawasaki disease presents with prolonged fever, conjunctivitis, and polymorphous rash with strawberry tongue in children. Clinical criteria and echocardiography guide diagnosis and management.

title: Sickle Cell Disease Review
text: Sickle cell disease presents with vaso-occlusive crises, chronic hemolytic anemia, and organ damage. Hemoglobin electrophoresis and genetic testing confirm diagnosis.

title: Glanders Diagnostic Guidelines
text: Glanders presents with pulmonary infection, skin nodules, and lymphangitis with potential septicemia. Burkholderia mallei culture and PCR confirm diagnosis.

title: Hemophilia A Clinical Review
text: Hemophilia A presents with spontaneous bleeding, hemarthroses, and prolonged bleeding after trauma in males. Factor VIII activity levels and genetic testing confirm diagnosis.

title: Melioidosis Diagnostic Guidelines
text: Melioidosis presents with pneumonia, skin abscesses, and septicemia in endemic tropical areas. Burkholderia pseudomallei culture and PCR confirm diagnosis.

title: Hemophilia B Clinical Features
text: Hemophilia B presents with bleeding episodes, hemarthroses, and muscle hematomas similar to hemophilia A. Factor IX activity levels and genetic testing confirm diagnosis.

title: Plague Diagnostic Guidelines
text: Plague presents with bubonic lymphadenopathy, pneumonic form with hemoptysis, or septicemic shock. Yersinia pestis culture, antigen detection, and PCR confirm diagnosis.

title: von Willebrand Disease Review
text: von Willebrand disease presents with mucocutaneous bleeding, menorrhagia, and prolonged bleeding after surgery. von Willebrand factor studies and platelet aggregation confirm diagnosis.

title: Anthrax Diagnostic Guidelines
text: Anthrax presents as cutaneous ulcers with black eschar, inhalational pneumonia, or gastrointestinal symptoms. Bacillus anthracis culture, PCR, and toxin detection confirm diagnosis.

title: Hereditary Hemochromatosis Guidelines
text: Hereditary hemochromatosis presents with fatigue, arthralgia, and hepatomegaly with diabetes and skin pigmentation. Elevated transferrin saturation, ferritin, and HFE gene mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: Smallpox Clinical Recognition
text: Smallpox presents with prodromal fever followed by characteristic vesiculopustular rash progressing synchronously. Variola virus PCR and electron microscopy confirm diagnosis in suspected cases.

title: Acute Intermittent Porphyria Review
text: Acute intermittent porphyria presents with abdominal pain, neuropsychiatric symptoms, and hyponatremia during attacks. Elevated urinary porphobilinogen and HMBS gene mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: Botulism Diagnostic Guidelines
text: Botulism presents with descending flaccid paralysis, diplopia, and dysphagia without fever. Botulinum toxin detection and Clostridium botulinum culture confirm diagnosis.

title: G6PD Deficiency Clinical Review
text: G6PD deficiency presents with acute hemolytic anemia after oxidant exposure, neonatal jaundice, and chronic hemolysis. G6PD enzyme activity and genetic testing confirm diagnosis.

title: Cholera Diagnostic Guidelines
text: Cholera presents with profuse watery diarrhea, vomiting, and rapid dehydration in endemic areas. Vibrio cholerae culture and rapid diagnostic tests confirm diagnosis.

title: Pyruvate Kinase Deficiency Review
text: Pyruvate kinase deficiency presents with chronic hemolytic anemia, splenomegaly, and gallstones with variable severity. PK enzyme activity and PKLR gene mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: Epidemic Typhus Guidelines
text: Epidemic typhus presents with high fever, headache, and maculopapular rash spreading centrifugally. Rickettsia prowazekii serology and PCR confirm diagnosis.

title: Hereditary Spherocytosis Clinical Features
text: Hereditary spherocytosis presents with hemolytic anemia, splenomegaly, and jaundice with gallstones. Osmotic fragility test and spectrin gene mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: Rift Valley Fever Guidelines
text: Rift Valley fever presents with acute febrile illness, retinal vasculitis, and potential hemorrhagic fever in endemic areas. RT-PCR and IgM serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Hereditary Elliptocytosis Review
text: Hereditary elliptocytosis presents with mild hemolytic anemia, splenomegaly, and elliptical red blood cells on smear. Blood smear morphology and spectrin gene mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: Crimean-Congo Hemorrhagic Fever
text: Crimean-Congo hemorrhagic fever presents with acute onset fever, myalgia, and hemorrhagic manifestations after tick bite. RT-PCR and antigen ELISA confirm diagnosis.

title: Paroxysmal Nocturnal Hemoglobinuria
text: Paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria presents with hemolytic anemia, thrombosis, and pancytopenia with dark urine episodes. Flow cytometry for CD55/CD59 deficiency and genetic testing confirm diagnosis.

title: Marburg Virus Disease Guidelines
text: Marburg virus disease presents with acute onset fever, myalgia, and hemorrhagic manifestations with high mortality. RT-PCR and antigen capture ELISA confirm diagnosis.

title: Bernard-Soulier Syndrome Review
text: Bernard-Soulier syndrome presents with giant platelets, severe bleeding tendency, and thrombocytopenia from birth. Platelet aggregation studies and GP1BA gene mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: Leptospirosis Diagnostic Guidelines
text: Leptospirosis presents with biphasic fever, myalgia, and conjunctival suffusion with potential Weil disease. Microscopic agglutination test and PCR confirm diagnosis.

title: Glanzmann Thrombasthenia Clinical Features
text: Glanzmann thrombasthenia presents with mucocutaneous bleeding, normal platelet count, and absent platelet aggregation. Platelet function studies and ITGA2B/ITGB3 mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: Hantavirus Pulmonary Syndrome
text: Hantavirus pulmonary syndrome presents with prodromal fever followed by rapid onset pulmonary edema and shock. Hantavirus IgM serology and RT-PCR confirm diagnosis.

title: Factor V Leiden Thrombophilia
text: Factor V Leiden presents with recurrent venous thromboembolism, pregnancy complications, and family history of clots. Activated protein C resistance and F5 gene mutation confirm diagnosis.

title: Venezuelan Equine Encephalitis
text: Venezuelan equine encephalitis presents with acute febrile illness, severe headache, and potential encephalitis in endemic areas. RT-PCR and IgM serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Protein C Deficiency Review
text: Protein C deficiency presents with recurrent venous thrombosis, warfarin-induced skin necrosis, and neonatal purpura fulminans. Protein C activity levels and PROC gene mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: Eastern Equine Encephalitis Guidelines
text: Eastern equine encephalitis presents with acute onset fever, headache, and rapid progression to coma with high mortality. RT-PCR and IgM serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Protein S Deficiency Clinical Features
text: Protein S deficiency presents with venous thromboembolism, pregnancy complications, and family history of clotting disorders. Free protein S levels and PROS1 gene mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: West Nile Virus Guidelines
text: West Nile virus presents with fever, headache, and potential neuroinvasive disease with flaccid paralysis. IgM serology and RT-PCR confirm diagnosis.

title: Antithrombin Deficiency Review
text: Antithrombin deficiency presents with recurrent venous thrombosis, heparin resistance, and family history of clots. Antithrombin activity levels and SERPINC1 mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: La Crosse Encephalitis Guidelines
text: La Crosse encephalitis presents with fever, headache, and seizures in children during summer months. IgM serology and RT-PCR confirm diagnosis.

title: May-Hegglin Anomaly Clinical Features
text: May-Hegglin anomaly presents with giant platelets, thrombocytopenia, and Döhle body-like inclusions in neutrophils. Platelet morphology and MYH9 gene mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: St. Louis Encephalitis Guidelines
text: St. Louis encephalitis presents with fever, headache, and altered mental status in elderly patients. IgM serology and RT-PCR confirm diagnosis.

title: Gray Platelet Syndrome Review
text: Gray platelet syndrome presents with bleeding tendency, thrombocytopenia, and characteristic gray appearance of platelets on smear. Electron microscopy and NBEAL2 mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: Japanese Encephalitis Guidelines
text: Japanese encephalitis presents with acute encephalitis, parkinsonian features, and flaccid paralysis in endemic areas. IgM serology and RT-PCR confirm diagnosis.

title: Wiskott-Aldrich Syndrome Review
text: Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome presents with thrombocytopenia, small platelets, eczema, and immunodeficiency in males. Flow cytometry for WASP protein and WAS gene mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: Tick-Borne Encephalitis Guidelines
text: Tick-borne encephalitis presents with biphasic illness, fever, and neurological symptoms after tick exposure in endemic areas. IgM serology and RT-PCR confirm diagnosis.

title: Platelet Storage Pool Deficiency
text: Platelet storage pool deficiency presents with mucocutaneous bleeding, absent second wave aggregation, and reduced dense granules. Platelet aggregometry and electron microscopy confirm diagnosis.

title: Powassan Virus Encephalitis
text: Powassan virus encephalitis presents with tick-borne encephalitis, fever, and neurological deterioration with high mortality. RT-PCR and IgM serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Cyclic Thrombocytopenia Review
text: Cyclic thrombocytopenia presents with periodic thrombocytopenia, bleeding episodes, and regular cycling pattern every 3-6 weeks. Platelet counts over time and MYH9 gene analysis aid diagnosis.

title: Chikungunya Arthritis Guidelines
text: Chikungunya arthritis presents with symmetric polyarthritis, morning stiffness, and joint swelling following acute infection. Clinical criteria and persistent joint symptoms guide diagnosis.

title: Quebec Platelet Disorder Clinical Features
text: Quebec platelet disorder presents with delayed-onset bleeding, normal platelet aggregation, and urokinase plasminogen activator overexpression. Platelet studies and PLAU gene duplication confirm diagnosis.

title: Ross River Virus Guidelines
text: Ross River virus presents with polyarthritis, fever, and maculopapular rash in Australia and Pacific islands. IgM serology and RT-PCR confirm diagnosis.

title: Immune Thrombocytopenic Purpura
text: Immune thrombocytopenic purpura presents with isolated thrombocytopenia, petechiae, and bleeding without splenomegaly. Platelet-associated antibodies and bone marrow biopsy aid diagnosis.

title: Oropouche Fever Guidelines
text: Oropouche fever presents with sudden onset fever, headache, and arthralgia in South America. RT-PCR and IgM serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Thrombotic Thrombocytopenic Purpura
text: Thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura presents with thrombocytopenia, microangiopathic hemolytic anemia, and neurological symptoms. ADAMTS13 activity deficiency and inhibitor presence confirm diagnosis.

title: Mayaro Virus Guidelines
text: Mayaro virus presents with acute febrile illness, severe arthralgia, and maculopapular rash in tropical Americas. RT-PCR and IgM serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Hemolytic Uremic Syndrome Review
text: Hemolytic uremic syndrome presents with microangiopathic hemolytic anemia, thrombocytopenia, and acute kidney injury. Schistocytes on blood smear and Shiga toxin detection aid diagnosis.

title: Sindbis Virus Guidelines
text: Sindbis virus presents with polyarthritis, fever, and maculopapular rash in Scandinavia and Africa. IgM serology and RT-PCR confirm diagnosis.

title: Disseminated Intravascular Coagulation
text: Disseminated intravascular coagulation presents with bleeding, thrombosis, and organ dysfunction with consumption of clotting factors. Elevated D-dimer, low fibrinogen, and prolonged PT/PTT support diagnosis.

title: Barmah Forest Virus Guidelines
text: Barmah Forest virus presents with polyarthritis, fever, and fatigue in Australia. IgM serology and RT-PCR confirm diagnosis.

title: Aplastic Anemia Guidelines
text: Aplastic anemia presents with pancytopenia, bleeding, infections, and fatigue with hypocellular bone marrow. Bone marrow biopsy and PNH clone testing aid diagnosis.

title: O'nyong-nyong Fever Guidelines
text: O'nyong-nyong fever presents with sudden onset fever, severe arthralgia, and lymphadenopathy in Africa. RT-PCR and IgM serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Primary Myelofibrosis Review
text: Primary myelofibrosis presents with splenomegaly, anemia, and constitutional symptoms with teardrop cells. Bone marrow fibrosis and JAK2/CALR/MPL mutations aid diagnosis.

title: Semliki Forest Virus Guidelines
text: Semliki Forest virus presents with encephalitis, fever, and neurological symptoms in Africa. RT-PCR and IgM serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Polycythemia Vera Guidelines
text: Polycythemia vera presents with elevated hematocrit, thrombosis, and pruritus with splenomegaly. JAK2 V617F mutation and low erythropoietin levels confirm diagnosis.

title: Getah Virus Guidelines
text: Getah virus presents with fever, rash, and arthralgia in Asia-Pacific region with equine involvement. RT-PCR and IgM serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Essential Thrombocythemia Review
text: Essential thrombocythemia presents with elevated platelet count, thrombosis, and hemorrhage with normal red cell mass. JAK2, CALR, or MPL mutations aid diagnosis.

title: Una Virus Guidelines
text: Una virus presents with fever, headache, and myalgia in South America. RT-PCR and IgM serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia Guidelines
text: Chronic lymphocytic leukemia presents with lymphocytosis, lymphadenopathy, and recurrent infections with monoclonal B cells. Flow cytometry and FISH analysis aid diagnosis.

title: Mucambo Virus Guidelines
text: Mucambo virus presents with fever, headache, and arthralgia in South America. RT-PCR and IgM serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia Review
text: Acute lymphoblastic leukemia presents with pancytopenia, bleeding, infections, and bone pain with lymphoblasts. Bone marrow biopsy, flow cytometry, and cytogenetics confirm diagnosis.

title: Pixuna Virus Guidelines
text: Pixuna virus presents with fever, myalgia, and headache in Brazil. RT-PCR and IgM serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Acute Myeloid Leukemia Guidelines
text: Acute myeloid leukemia presents with pancytopenia, bleeding, infections, and fatigue with myeloblasts. Bone marrow biopsy, flow cytometry, and molecular genetics confirm diagnosis.

title: Tonate Virus Guidelines
text: Tonate virus presents with fever, headache, and myalgia in Central America. RT-PCR and IgM serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Chronic Myeloid Leukemia Review
text: Chronic myeloid leukemia presents with leukocytosis, splenomegaly, and left shift with Philadelphia chromosome. BCR-ABL fusion gene and cytogenetics confirm diagnosis.

title: Fort Sherman Virus Guidelines
text: Fort Sherman virus presents with fever, headache, and myalgia in Panama. RT-PCR and IgM serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Hairy Cell Leukemia Clinical Features
text: Hairy cell leukemia presents with splenomegaly, pancytopenia, and characteristic hairy cells with monocytopenia. Flow cytometry and BRAF V600E mutation confirm diagnosis.

title: Cabassou Virus Guidelines
text: Cabassou virus presents with fever, arthralgia, and rash in French Guiana. RT-PCR and IgM serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Multiple Myeloma Guidelines
text: Multiple myeloma presents with bone pain, hypercalcemia, and renal insufficiency with anemia. Serum protein electrophoresis, bone marrow biopsy, and imaging confirm diagnosis.

title: Uruma Virus Guidelines
text: Uruma virus presents with fever, headache, and myalgia in Okinawa. RT-PCR and IgM serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Waldenström Macroglobulinemia Review
text: Waldenström macroglobulinemia presents with lymphoplasmacytic infiltration, IgM monoclonal protein, and hyperviscosity syndrome. Bone marrow biopsy and MYD88 L265P mutation aid diagnosis.

title: Highlands J Virus Guidelines
text: Highlands J virus presents with encephalitis, fever, and neurological symptoms in North America. RT-PCR and IgM serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Monoclonal Gammopathy Guidelines
text: Monoclonal gammopathy of undetermined significance presents with asymptomatic M protein without end-organ damage. Serum protein electrophoresis and bone marrow biopsy aid evaluation.

title: Bagaza Virus Guidelines
text: Bagaza virus presents with neurological symptoms, fever, and encephalitis in birds and humans. RT-PCR and IgM serology confirm diagnosis.

title: AL Amyloidosis Guidelines
text: AL amyloidosis presents with heart failure, proteinuria, and organ dysfunction with monoclonal light chains. Congo red staining, mass spectrometry, and serum free light chains confirm diagnosis.

title: Israel Turkey Meningoencephalitis Virus
text: Israel Turkey meningoencephalitis virus presents with encephalitis, fever, and neurological symptoms in poultry and humans. RT-PCR and IgM serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Light Chain Deposition Disease
text: Light chain deposition disease presents with renal insufficiency, proteinuria, and nodular glomerulosclerosis. Kidney biopsy and immunofluorescence confirm monoclonal light chain deposits.

title: Wesselsbron Virus Guidelines
text: Wesselsbron virus presents with fever, headache, and myalgia in Africa. RT-PCR and IgM serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Heavy Chain Disease Review
text: Heavy chain disease presents with lymphadenopathy, hepatosplenomegaly, and recurrent infections with truncated heavy chains. Serum protein electrophoresis and bone marrow biopsy aid diagnosis.

title: Tembusu Virus Guidelines
text: Tembusu virus presents with neurological symptoms, fever, and encephalitis in ducks and humans. RT-PCR and IgM serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Mixed Cryoglobulinemia Guidelines
text: Mixed cryoglobulinemia presents with purpura, arthralgia, and glomerulonephritis with cold-precipitable immunoglobulins. Cryoglobulin detection and complement levels aid diagnosis.

title: Ntaya Virus Guidelines
text: Ntaya virus presents with fever, headache, and myalgia in Africa. RT-PCR and IgM serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Cold Agglutinin Disease Review
text: Cold agglutinin disease presents with hemolytic anemia, acrocyanosis, and Raynaud-like symptoms triggered by cold. Direct antiglobulin test and cold agglutinin titers confirm diagnosis.

title: Usutu Virus Guidelines
text: Usutu virus presents with neuroinvasive disease, fever, and encephalitis in Europe. RT-PCR and IgM serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Warm Autoimmune Hemolytic Anemia
text: Warm autoimmune hemolytic anemia presents with hemolytic anemia, splenomegaly, and positive direct antiglobulin test. Warm-reactive IgG antibodies and spherocytes confirm diagnosis.

title: Koutango Virus Guidelines
text: Koutango virus presents with fever, headache, and myalgia in Africa. RT-PCR and IgM serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Paroxysmal Cold Hemoglobinuria
text: Paroxysmal cold hemoglobinuria presents with acute hemolytic episodes, hemoglobinuria, and cold exposure triggers. Donath-Landsteiner test and biphasic hemolysin confirm diagnosis.

title: Entebbe Bat Virus Guidelines
text: Entebbe bat virus presents with fever, headache, and myalgia with bat exposure. RT-PCR and IgM serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Glucose-6-Phosphatase Deficiency
text: Glucose-6-phosphatase deficiency presents with hepatomegaly, hypoglycemia, and growth retardation with lactic acidosis. G6PC enzyme assay and genetic testing confirm diagnosis.

title: Congenital Zika Syndrome Guidelines
text: Congenital Zika syndrome presents with microcephaly, brain calcifications, and ophthalmologic abnormalities. Maternal Zika serology and infant testing confirm diagnosis.

title: Debranching Enzyme Deficiency
text: Debranching enzyme deficiency presents with hepatomegaly, hypoglycemia, and myopathy with normal lactate. AGL enzyme assay and genetic testing confirm diagnosis.

title: Congenital Cytomegalovirus Guidelines
text: Congenital cytomegalovirus presents with intrauterine growth restriction, hearing loss, and developmental delay. CMV PCR in urine and serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Phosphorylase Kinase Deficiency
text: Phosphorylase kinase deficiency presents with hepatomegaly, growth retardation, and exercise intolerance. Phosphorylase kinase enzyme assay and genetic testing confirm diagnosis.

title: Congenital Rubella Syndrome
text: Congenital rubella syndrome presents with cataracts, heart defects, and sensorineural hearing loss with growth retardation. Rubella IgM and viral culture confirm diagnosis.

title: Glycogen Synthase Deficiency
text: Glycogen synthase deficiency presents with postprandial hypoglycemia, ketosis, and growth retardation without hepatomegaly. GYS2 enzyme assay and genetic testing confirm diagnosis.

title: Congenital Toxoplasmosis Guidelines
text: Congenital toxoplasmosis presents with chorioretinitis, intracranial calcifications, and hydrocephalus. Toxoplasma IgM, PCR, and maternal serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Branching Enzyme Deficiency
text: Branching enzyme deficiency presents with hepatosplenomegaly, failure to thrive, and progressive liver cirrhosis. GBE1 enzyme assay and genetic testing confirm diagnosis.

title: Congenital Syphilis Guidelines
text: Congenital syphilis presents with rash, hepatosplenomegaly, and osteochondritis with rhinitis. Maternal and infant serology with FTA-ABS confirm diagnosis.

title: Phosphofructokinase Deficiency
text: Phosphofructokinase deficiency presents with exercise intolerance, myalgia, and hemolytic anemia with normal lactate response. PFKM enzyme assay and genetic testing confirm diagnosis.

title: Congenital Herpes Simplex Guidelines
text: Congenital herpes simplex presents with vesicular rash, encephalitis, and disseminated disease with high mortality. HSV PCR, culture, and serology confirm diagnosis.

title: Aldolase A Deficiency Review
text: Aldolase A deficiency presents with hemolytic anemia, myopathy, and exercise intolerance with elevated muscle enzymes. ALDOA enzyme assay and genetic testing confirm diagnosis.

title: Hereditary Lipoprotein Lipase Deficiency
text: LPL deficiency presents with recurrent pancreatitis and eruptive xanthomas in childhood; fasting triglycerides are markedly elevated and biallelic LPL variants confirm.

title: Familial Hypercholesterolemia Guideline
text: Heterozygous FH causes very high LDL-C and premature ASCVD; diagnosis uses clinical criteria (Dutch Lipid Network) and LDLR/APOB/PCSK9 variants when available.

title: Hermansky-Pudlak Syndrome Review
text: Hermansky-Pudlak syndrome presents with oculocutaneous albinism and bleeding diathesis; platelet dense granules are absent and HPS gene variants confirm.

title: X-linked Myotubular Myopathy
text: XLMTM presents with severe neonatal hypotonia and respiratory failure in boys; muscle biopsy shows centrally located nuclei and MTM1 variants confirm.

title: Myotonic Dystrophy Type 1
text: DM1 features distal weakness, myotonia, cataracts, and conduction defects; CTG repeat expansion in DMPK confirms.

title: Myotonic Dystrophy Type 2
text: DM2 presents with proximal myopathy and myotonia; CCTG expansion in CNBP (ZNF9) confirms; often milder than DM1.

title: Stevens-Johnson Syndrome/TEN
text: SJS/TEN presents with fever and mucocutaneous necrosis after drugs; diagnosis is clinical with skin biopsy; SCORTEN predicts mortality.

title: DRESS Syndrome Overview
text: DRESS manifests with fever, rash, eosinophilia, and organ involvement weeks after drug exposure; RegiSCAR criteria assist diagnosis.

title: Hereditary Leiomyomatosis and RCC
text: HLRCC causes cutaneous and uterine leiomyomas and aggressive renal cell carcinoma; FH pathogenic variants confirm; screen kidneys annually.

title: Beckwith-Wiedemann Syndrome
text: BWS presents with macroglossia, omphalocele, and overgrowth; molecular testing shows 11p15 imprinting defects; tumor surveillance recommended.

title: Russell-Silver Syndrome
text: Russell-Silver syndrome presents with intrauterine growth restriction and body asymmetry; 11p15 hypomethylation or maternal UPD7 support diagnosis.

title: Pelizaeus-Merzbacher Disease
text: PMD presents with nystagmus, hypotonia, and later spasticity; PLP1 duplications are common; MRI shows hypomyelination.

title: Canavan-Leukoencephalopathy Diagnostic Points
text: Canavan leukodystrophy features macrocephaly and developmental arrest; MRS shows elevated NAA; ASPA sequencing confirms.

title: Sanfilippo (MPS III) Overview
text: MPS III presents with developmental delay, behavioral issues, and mild somatic signs; elevated urinary GAGs and defects in heparan sulfate enzymes confirm subtype.

title: Morquio (MPS IV) Review
text: MPS IV causes skeletal dysplasia with short trunk and gait abnormalities; enzyme assays (GALNS or GLB1) and gene testing confirm.

title: Maroteaux-Lamy (MPS VI)
text: MPS VI presents with coarse facies, joint contractures, and cardiopulmonary disease; arylsulfatase B enzyme deficiency confirms.

title: Atypical Hemolytic Uremic Syndrome
text: aHUS presents with MAHA, thrombocytopenia, and AKI; complement pathway mutations or anti–factor H antibodies may be present; exclude Shiga toxin HUS.

title: IgA Nephropathy (Berger Disease)
text: IgA nephropathy presents with episodic gross hematuria post-URI; biopsy shows mesangial IgA deposition; risk stratify by proteinuria and eGFR.

title: Membranous Nephropathy
text: Primary membranous nephropathy causes nephrotic syndrome; anti-PLA2R antibodies are highly specific; biopsy with subepithelial deposits confirms.

title: C3 Glomerulopathy/MPGN
text: C3 glomerulopathy presents with hematuria and proteinuria; biopsy shows C3-dominant deposits; evaluate for complement dysregulation and C3 nephritic factor.

title: X-linked Alport Detailed Update
text: X-linked Alport syndrome manifests with hematuria and progressive CKD plus sensorineural hearing loss; COL4A5 sequencing and kidney biopsy guide diagnosis and counseling.

title: Bartter Syndrome Review
text: Bartter syndrome presents with hypokalemic metabolic alkalosis and polyuria; variants in NKCC2, ROMK, or CLC-Kb pathways confirm subtype.

title: Gitelman Syndrome
text: Gitelman syndrome causes hypokalemia, hypomagnesemia, and metabolic alkalosis; SLC12A3 mutations confirm; often presents in adolescence/adulthood.

title: Liddle Syndrome
text: Liddle syndrome presents with early-onset hypertension and hypokalemia; gain-of-function mutations in ENaC subunits (SCNN1B/SCNN1G) confirm.

title: Primary Aldosteronism Guideline
text: Primary aldosteronism presents with resistant hypertension and hypokalemia; screen with PAC/PRA ratio and confirm with suppression tests; CT/adrenal vein sampling localize.

title: Paraganglioma Syndromic Screening
text: Paragangliomas present with catecholamine-mediated symptoms or incidental masses; plasma metanephrines diagnose; SDHB mutations predict aggressive disease.

title: Autoimmune Oophoritis
text: Autoimmune oophoritis presents with primary ovarian insufficiency and adrenal autoimmunity; anti-ovarian antibodies may be present after excluding genetic and iatrogenic causes.

title: POMC Deficiency
text: POMC deficiency causes early-onset obesity, adrenal insufficiency, and red hair; ACTH deficiency evident; POMC variants confirm.

title: Congenital Leptin Deficiency
text: Congenital leptin deficiency presents with severe early obesity and infections; very low leptin levels and LEP mutations confirm; responds to metreleptin.

title: Hyperphagia in Prader-Willi: Endocrine Aspects
text: PWS hyperphagia relates to hypothalamic dysfunction with ghrelin elevations; management combines environmental control and hormonal therapies.

title: Vascular Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome
text: vEDS presents with arterial/organ rupture and translucent skin; COL3A1 variants confirm; counsel for risk reduction and surveillance.

title: Loeys-Dietz Syndrome
text: Loeys-Dietz features arterial aneurysms/dissections and craniofacial anomalies; TGFBR1/2, SMAD2/3, TGFB2/3 variants confirm; early aortic repair considered.

title: Classical Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome
text: Classical EDS presents with hyperextensible skin and atrophic scars; COL5A1/COL5A2 variants support diagnosis; rule out vascular subtype.

title: Hypermobile EDS and HSD
text: hEDS/HSD present with joint hypermobility, pain, and dysautonomia; diagnosis is clinical based on updated criteria after excluding other causes.

title: Kyphoscoliotic EDS
text: kEDS presents with congenital hypotonia and progressive kyphoscoliosis; PLOD1 variants or FKBP14 in some cases; vascular fragility possible.

title: Arthrochalasia EDS
text: aEDS features congenital bilateral hip dislocation and severe skin hyperextensibility; COL1A1/COL1A2 N-propeptide variants confirm.

title: Persistent Pulmonary Hypertension of the Newborn
text: PPHN presents with hypoxemia unresponsive to oxygen; echocardiography shows right-to-left shunting; inhaled nitric oxide improves oxygenation.

title: Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension Guideline
text: PAH presents with progressive dyspnea and syncope; diagnosis requires RHC showing pre-capillary PH; risk stratify with BNP/NT-proBNP and 6MWD.

title: Chronic Thromboembolic Pulmonary Hypertension
text: CTEPH presents with exertional dyspnea months after PE; V/Q scan is screening test; evaluate for PEA or BPA and lifelong anticoagulation.

title: Cardiac Sarcoidosis Statement
text: Cardiac sarcoidosis presents with AV block or ventricular arrhythmias; FDG-PET/MRI support diagnosis; consider steroids and ICD in high risk.

title: ATTR vs AL Cardiac Amyloidosis
text: Cardiac amyloidosis causes HFpEF and thickened walls with low voltage; bone scintigraphy differentiates ATTR from AL; serum/urine studies exclude monoclonal protein.

title: Fever-Induced Brugada Phenotype
text: Fever can unmask Brugada type 1 ECG in susceptible individuals; aggressive antipyresis and ECG monitoring recommended.

title: Wolff-Parkinson-White Syndrome
text: WPW presents with palpitations and delta wave on ECG; risk stratify for sudden death; catheter ablation cures most symptomatic cases.

title: Hypertrophic Obstructive Cardiomyopathy
text: HOCM presents with exertional dyspnea and systolic murmur; echo shows dynamic LVOT obstruction; consider beta-blockers, septal reduction in refractory cases.

title: Takotsubo (Stress) Cardiomyopathy
text: Takotsubo presents with chest pain and troponin rise mimicking MI after stress; angiography shows no obstructive CAD; echo displays apical ballooning.

title: Myocarditis/Pericarditis Diagnosis
text: Acute myocarditis presents with chest pain and elevated troponin; cardiac MRI (Lake Louise criteria) supports; evaluate for infectious and autoimmune causes.

title: Infective Endocarditis Guideline
text: Endocarditis presents with fever and new murmur; Duke criteria incorporate blood cultures and echocardiography; early surgery in complications.

title: Rheumatic Heart Disease Prevention
text: Rheumatic heart disease follows untreated streptococcal pharyngitis; secondary prophylaxis with penicillin prevents recurrences and valvular damage.

title: Genetics of HCM
text: Sarcomeric gene variants (MYH7, MYBPC3) underlie most familial HCM; genetic testing informs family screening and risk stratification.

title: AL Amyloidosis with Neuropathy
text: AL amyloidosis may present with length-dependent axonal neuropathy and autonomic failure; serum free light chains and tissue biopsy with Congo red confirm.

title: ACE Inhibitor–Induced Angioedema
text: ACEi angioedema presents with tongue/lip swelling without urticaria; bradykinin-mediated, not responsive to antihistamines; discontinue ACEi and secure airway.

title: Scombroid Poisoning
text: Scombroid presents with flushing, headache, and palpitations after fish ingestion; due to histamine; treat with antihistamines and supportive care.

title: Ciguatera Fish Poisoning
text: Ciguatera causes GI symptoms and cold allodynia after reef fish ingestion; neurologic paresthesias common; management is supportive.

title: Tetrodotoxin (Pufferfish) Poisoning
text: Tetrodotoxin blocks sodium channels causing perioral numbness and paralysis; rapid airway support is critical; no specific antidote.

title: Organophosphate Poisoning
text: OP poisoning presents with cholinergic toxidrome (miosis, bronchorrhea, bradycardia); treat with atropine, pralidoxime, and decontamination.

title: Methemoglobinemia
text: Methemoglobinemia presents with cyanosis unresponsive to oxygen; pulse ox ~85% with chocolate-brown blood; treat with methylene blue unless G6PD deficient.

title: Cyanide Toxicity
text: Cyanide poisoning presents with sudden collapse and lactic acidosis; treat with hydroxocobalamin; consider smoke inhalation exposure.

title: Carbon Monoxide Poisoning
text: CO poisoning presents with headache and dizziness; carboxyhemoglobin levels confirm; treat with 100% oxygen or hyperbaric therapy when indicated.

title: Hantavirus Pulmonary Syndrome
text: Hantavirus presents with febrile prodrome followed by rapid noncardiogenic pulmonary edema; PCR/serology confirm; supportive critical care required.

title: Nipah Virus Infection
text: Nipah causes acute encephalitis and respiratory illness with high mortality; RT-PCR confirms; strict infection prevention is essential.

title: MERS-CoV Clinical Features
text: MERS-CoV presents with fever, cough, and pneumonia often progressing to ARDS; RT-PCR from lower respiratory tract confirms; source control critical.

title: Ebola Virus Disease
text: EVD presents with fever, GI symptoms, and hemorrhage; RT-PCR confirms; aggressive fluid resuscitation and isolation are key.

title: Marburg Virus Disease
text: Marburg causes severe hemorrhagic fever with high case fatality; RT-PCR and ELISA confirm; supportive care and infection control vital.

title: Lassa Fever
text: Lassa fever presents with fever, pharyngitis, and retrosternal pain; RT-PCR confirms; ribavirin early may improve outcomes.

title: Yellow Fever
text: Yellow fever causes abrupt fever, jaundice, and hemorrhage; RT-PCR/serology confirm; live vaccine highly effective for prevention.

title: Plague (Yersinia pestis)
text: Plague presents as bubonic with painful lymphadenitis or pneumonic with severe pneumonia; culture/PCR confirm; treat promptly with aminoglycosides.

title: Tularemia
text: Tularemia presents with ulceroglandular disease after tick/rabbit exposure; serology or PCR confirms; treat with streptomycin or doxycycline.

title: Anaplasmosis
text: Anaplasmosis presents with fever, leukopenia, and thrombocytopenia; PCR early and morulae on smear may be seen; treat with doxycycline.

title: Ehrlichiosis
text: Ehrlichiosis presents with fever and cytopenias; PCR confirms early; empiric doxycycline recommended when suspected.

title: Rocky Mountain Spotted Fever
text: RMSF presents with fever and petechial rash on wrists/ankles spreading centrally; serology confirms later; treat immediately with doxycycline.

title: Q Fever
text: Q fever presents with fever, hepatitis, or pneumonia after animal exposure; serology (phase II IgG) and PCR diagnose; treat with doxycycline.

title: Brucellosis
text: Brucellosis causes undulant fever and arthralgia after unpasteurized dairy/animal contact; blood culture and serology confirm; treat with doxycycline plus rifampin.

title: Melioidosis
text: Melioidosis presents with pneumonia or abscesses in diabetics; culture of Burkholderia pseudomallei confirms; intensive-phase ceftazidime then eradication therapy.

title: Visceral Leishmaniasis
text: Kala-azar presents with prolonged fever, weight loss, and splenomegaly; rK39 rapid test/serology and tissue aspirate microscopy confirm.

title: Cutaneous Leishmaniasis
text: Cutaneous leishmaniasis causes painless ulcer with indurated border; diagnosis by smear/culture/PCR from lesion; treat depends on species/site.

title: Amebic Liver Abscess
text: Amebic liver abscess presents with fever and RUQ pain; serology positive in most and imaging shows hypoechoic lesion; treat with metronidazole plus luminal agent.

title: Strongyloidiasis
text: Strongyloides causes GI symptoms and eosinophilia; serology is sensitive; hyperinfection occurs with steroids; ivermectin is treatment of choice.

title: Schistosomiasis
text: Schistosomiasis presents with hematuria (S. haematobium) or portal hypertension (S. mansoni); serology and ova detection diagnose; praziquantel treats.

title: Echinococcosis (Hydatid Disease)
text: Hydatid disease presents with hepatic cysts; imaging shows daughter cysts; serology supports; management includes albendazole and PAIR or surgery.

title: Neurocysticercosis
text: Neurocysticercosis presents with seizures in endemic areas; MRI/CT shows cysts with scolex; EITB serology supports; treat with albendazole and steroids.

title: Diphyllobothrium (Fish Tapeworm)
text: Fish tapeworm infection may cause B12 deficiency with megaloblastic anemia; stool O&P shows broad tapeworm segments; treat with praziquantel.

title: Ascariasis
text: Ascariasis may present with cough (Löffler syndrome) and later intestinal obstruction; stool O&P confirms; albendazole treats.

title: Toxocariasis (Visceral Larva Migrans)
text: Toxocariasis presents with fever, hepatomegaly, and eosinophilia in children; ELISA serology supports; treat with albendazole.

title: Trichinellosis
text: Trichinella infection presents with myalgia, periorbital edema, and eosinophilia after undercooked pork; serology and muscle biopsy help diagnose.

title: Lymphatic Filariasis
text: Lymphatic filariasis causes limb lymphedema and hydrocele; nocturnal blood smear or antigen tests confirm; DEC and vector control reduce transmission.

title: Onchocerciasis
text: Onchocerciasis presents with pruritic dermatitis and visual impairment (river blindness); skin snip microscopy and serology diagnose; ivermectin mass treatment.

title: Leprosy (Hansen Disease)
text: Leprosy presents with hypoesthetic skin lesions and peripheral neuropathy; slit-skin smear and biopsy confirm; MDT therapy recommended.

title: Psittacosis
text: Psittacosis causes atypical pneumonia after bird exposure; PCR or serology confirms; treat with doxycycline.

title: Legionnaires’ Disease
