text: Legionella pneumonia presents with fever, hyponatremia, and GI symptoms; urinary antigen for L. pneumophila serogroup 1 detects most cases; macrolide or fluoroquinolone therapy.

title: Staphylococcal Toxic Shock Syndrome
text: TSS presents with fever, hypotension, and diffuse rash with desquamation; clinical criteria guide diagnosis; treat with source control and anti-toxin antibiotics.

title: Streptococcal Toxic Shock Syndrome
text: Strep TSS presents with shock and multiorgan failure often with necrotizing fasciitis; treat with clindamycin plus beta-lactam and surgical debridement.

title: Necrotizing Fasciitis
text: Necrotizing fasciitis presents with severe pain out of proportion and systemic toxicity; urgent surgical exploration and broad-spectrum antibiotics are lifesaving.

title: Helicobacter pylori Infection
text: H. pylori causes dyspepsia and peptic ulcer disease; urea breath test or stool antigen diagnose; use susceptibility-guided or bismuth quadruple therapy.

title: Clostridioides difficile Infection
text: CDI presents with watery diarrhea after antibiotics; NAAT plus toxin EIA algorithms diagnose; fidaxomicin preferred for initial episodes.

title: Sepsis and Septic Shock (Sepsis-3)
text: Sepsis defined as life-threatening organ dysfunction from infection; qSOFA/SOFA scores assess risk; early antibiotics and fluids improve outcomes.

title: Hemophilia A/B Management
text: Hemophilia presents with hemarthroses and bleeding; factor VIII/IX assays confirm; consider inhibitors and use prophylactic factor or emicizumab (A).

title: Von Willebrand Disease
text: VWD presents with mucocutaneous bleeding; VWF antigen/activity and factor VIII levels aid typing; DDAVP responsive in many type 1 cases.

title: Glanzmann Thrombasthenia
text: Glanzmann thrombasthenia causes mucocutaneous bleeding with normal platelet count; absent platelet aggregation to all agonists; ITGA2B/ITGB3 variants confirm.

title: Bernard-Soulier Syndrome
text: Bernard-Soulier presents with macrothrombocytopenia and bleeding; platelet GP Ib/IX/V deficiency diagnosed by flow cytometry; GP1BA/B/IX variants confirm.

title: Calcineurin Inhibitor Neurotoxicity
text: Tacrolimus toxicity presents with tremor, headache, or PRES; MRI shows posterior white matter edema; reduce dose and control blood pressure.

title: Graft-versus-Host Disease
text: GVHD presents with rash, diarrhea, and liver dysfunction after allogeneic transplant; biopsy confirms; prophylaxis with calcineurin inhibitor plus methotrexate or post-Cy.

title: Hemophagocytic Syndrome Triggers
text: HLH may be triggered by EBV, malignancy, or rheumatologic disease; ferritin often >10,000 ng/mL; start immunochemotherapy promptly when criteria met.

title: KATP Neonatal Diabetes
text: KATP neonatal diabetes presents with hyperglycemia in infancy; KCNJ11/ABCC8 mutations confirm; many respond to high-dose sulfonylureas.

title: GCK-MODY (MODY2)
text: GCK-MODY causes mild stable fasting hyperglycemia; HbA1c slightly elevated; GCK mutations confirm; usually no pharmacotherapy needed.

title: HNF1A-MODY (MODY3)
text: HNF1A-MODY presents with progressive hyperglycemia and low renal threshold for glucose; sensitive to low-dose sulfonylureas; HNF1A variants confirm.

title: Adrenal Crisis Recognition
text: Adrenal crisis presents with hypotension, abdominal pain, and hyponatremia; treat immediately with IV hydrocortisone and fluids; do not delay for labs.

title: Prolactinoma
text: Prolactinoma presents with galactorrhea and amenorrhea or hypogonadism; elevated prolactin and MRI pituitary adenoma; dopamine agonists are first-line.

title: Acromegaly Diagnosis
text: Acromegaly presents with acral enlargement and headaches; elevated IGF-1 and failure of GH suppression on oral glucose test; pituitary MRI localizes.

title: Cushing Syndrome Workup
text: Cushing syndrome presents with central obesity, striae, and hypertension; screen with late-night salivary cortisol, 1 mg DST, or UFC; ACTH distinguishes etiology.

title: Pheochromocytoma Crisis
text: Pheochromocytoma crisis features severe hypertension, tachyarrhythmias, and cardiomyopathy; alpha-blockade precedes beta-blockade; ICU care required.

title: Thyroid Storm
text: Thyroid storm presents with fever, tachycardia, and delirium; treat with beta-blockers, thionamides, iodide, and steroids; consider precipitating triggers.

title: Myxedema Coma
text: Myxedema coma presents with hypothermia, bradycardia, and altered mental status; treat with IV levothyroxine and hydrocortisone; supportive warming.

title: Chylothorax in Lymphatic Disorders
text: Chylothorax presents with milky pleural fluid high in triglycerides; etiologies include trauma and lymphatic malformations; manage with drainage, diet, and interventions.

title: Hepatoblastoma
text: Hepatoblastoma presents with abdominal mass and elevated AFP in children; imaging plus biopsy confirm; resection and chemotherapy are mainstays.

title: Neurologic Wilson Disease
text: Neurologic Wilson presents with dystonia and dysarthria; MRI shows basal ganglia changes; low ceruloplasmin and elevated urinary copper support; ATP7B testing confirms.

title: Seronegative NMOSD Features
text: AQP4-IgG–negative NMOSD may present similarly with longitudinal myelitis or optic neuritis; cell-based assays for MOG-IgG aid differentiation.

title: Idiopathic Transverse Myelitis
text: Transverse myelitis presents with acute bilateral sensory and motor deficits with a sensory level; MRI spinal cord lesion spans <3 segments; evaluate autoimmune/infectious causes.

title: Acute Disseminated Encephalomyelitis
text: ADEM presents with multifocal neurologic deficits and encephalopathy post-infection; MRI shows widespread demyelination; typically monophasic.

title: Progressive Multifocal Leukoencephalopathy
text: PML presents with subacute focal deficits in immunosuppressed; JC virus PCR in CSF and MRI with non-enhancing lesions confirm; reduce immunosuppression.

title: Ocular Ischemia in GCA
text: GCA can cause arteritic anterior ischemic optic neuropathy with sudden vision loss; prompt high-dose steroids before biopsy preserve vision.

title: Behçet Panuveitis
text: Behçet disease causes recurrent panuveitis with hypopyon; HLA-B51 associated; treat with corticosteroids and immunomodulators (e.g., anti-TNF).

title: Vogt–Koyanagi–Harada Disease
text: VKHD presents with bilateral granulomatous uveitis, serous retinal detachments, and meningismus; treat promptly with high-dose steroids and immunosuppression.

title: Ocular Sarcoidosis
text: Ocular sarcoidosis presents with uveitis and periphlebitis; diagnosis supported by chest imaging, serum ACE, and biopsy of accessible tissue.

title: Miller Fisher Variant of GBS
text: Miller Fisher syndrome presents with ophthalmoplegia, ataxia, and areflexia; anti-GQ1b antibodies support; prognosis generally favorable.

title: CIDP Variants
text: CIDP variants include MADSAM and DADS with multifocal or distal patterns; nerve conduction shows demyelination; response to IVIG or steroids guides management.

title: Late-Onset Pompe Disease
text: Late-onset Pompe presents with limb-girdle weakness and respiratory insufficiency; GAA enzyme assay and GAA sequencing confirm; ERT available.

title: Calpainopathy (LGMD R1)
text: Calpainopathy presents with proximal weakness and scapular winging; CAPN3 variants confirm; CK elevated and dystrophic biopsy.

title: Dysferlinopathy (LGMD R2/Miyoshi)
text: Dysferlinopathy presents with distal calf weakness or limb-girdle pattern; DYSF variants confirm; absent dysferlin on immunoblot/IF.

title: FKRP-Related Dystroglycanopathy
text: FKRP dystroglycanopathy ranges from CMD to adult LGMD with elevated CK; FKRP variants confirm; brain MRI abnormalities may occur.

title: Sarcoglycanopathies
text: Sarcoglycan defects (SGCA/SGCB/SGCG/SGCD) cause LGMD with proximal weakness and cardiomyopathy risk; immunostaining shows loss of sarcoglycans.

title: Nemaline Myopathy
text: Nemaline myopathy presents with hypotonia and weakness; muscle biopsy shows nemaline rods; NEB or ACTA1 variants common.

title: Centronuclear Myopathies
text: Centronuclear myopathies show centrally placed nuclei on biopsy with variable weakness; MTM1, DNM2, BIN1 variants define subtypes.

title: Congenital Myasthenic Syndromes
text: CMS presents with fatigable weakness from birth/childhood; decrement on RNS; genetic defects across synaptic proteins (CHRNE, RAPSN, DOK7) guide therapy selection.

title: Sturge–Weber Syndrome
text: SWS presents with facial port-wine stain (V1), leptomeningeal angiomas, and seizures; GNAQ somatic variants identified; MRI with contrast detects leptomeningeal involvement.

title: Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia (Update)
text: HHT manifests with epistaxis and telangiectasias; screen for pulmonary AVMs to prevent paradoxical emboli; ENG/ACVRL1/SMAD4 testing supports.

title: GLUT1 Deficiency Syndrome Review
text: GLUT1 deficiency presents with infantile-onset seizures, developmental delay, and movement disorder; low CSF glucose with normal serum glucose and SLC2A1 mutations confirm; ketogenic diet is mainstay therapy.

title: AADC Deficiency Clinical Summary
text: Aromatic L-amino acid decarboxylase deficiency presents with hypotonia, oculogyric crises, and autonomic dysfunction; low CSF neurotransmitter metabolites and DDC gene mutations confirm diagnosis.

title: PMM2-CDG (CDG-Ia) Overview
text: PMM2-CDG presents with developmental delay, cerebellar hypoplasia, and coagulopathy; transferrin isoform analysis and PMM2 gene sequencing confirm diagnosis.

title: Alpers-Huttenlocher Syndrome
text: Alpers syndrome presents with refractory epilepsy, psychomotor regression, and progressive liver dysfunction; POLG mutations and characteristic MRI signal abnormalities aid diagnosis.

title: SLC13A5 Epileptic Encephalopathy
text: SLC13A5-related epilepsy presents with neonatal seizures, developmental delay, and tooth hypoplasia; SLC13A5 pathogenic variants and refractory seizures on EEG support diagnosis.

title: Narcolepsy Type 1 (Hypocretin-deficient)
text: Narcolepsy type 1 presents with excessive daytime sleepiness and cataplexy; low CSF hypocretin-1 and characteristic MSLT findings confirm diagnosis with autoimmune association (HLA-DQB1*06:02).

title: Leigh Syndrome (Subacute Necrotizing Encephalomyelopathy)
text: Leigh syndrome presents in infancy with psychomotor regression, lactic acidosis, and focal brainstem or basal ganglia lesions on MRI; mitochondrial or nuclear gene defects affecting oxidative phosphorylation confirm diagnosis.

title: HHT Genetics and Screening
text: Hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia presents with recurrent epistaxis and mucocutaneous telangiectasias; pathogenic variants in ENG/ACVRL1/SMAD4 and contrast echocardiography/CT for AVM screening guide management.

title: Early-Onset Bipolar Disorder Clinical Features
text: Juvenile bipolar disorder presents with mood lability, manic episodes with decreased need for sleep, and functional impairment; diagnosis is clinical and comorbidity with ADHD and anxiety is common.

title: Crimean-Congo Hemorrhagic Fever Summary
text: CCHF presents with fever, myalgia, and progressive hemorrhage; RT-PCR and ELISA for IgM/IgG confirm; high case fatality and tick exposure history are key epidemiologic clues.

title: Chronic Q Fever Endocarditis
text: Chronic Q fever commonly manifests as culture-negative endocarditis with weight loss and prolonged fever; phase I IgG titers and PCR on tissue assist diagnosis and prolonged doxycycline-hydroxychloroquine therapy is recommended.

title: Cutaneous NTM Infections
source: Journal of the American Academy of Dermatology
text: Cutaneous non-tuberculous mycobacterial infections present with chronic nodules or ulcers after trauma or procedure; culture with prolonged incubation and molecular speciation guide prolonged antibiotic therapy.

title: Spotted Fever Group Rickettsioses
text: Spotted fever rickettsioses present with fever, rash, and eschar in some species; PCR, serology (IFA) and clinical epidemiology guide diagnosis; doxycycline is first-line therapy.

title: HIV in Older Adults: Presentation and Management
text: Older adults with HIV may present with atypical symptoms and multimorbidity; screening and management must consider polypharmacy and immunosenescence; viral load and CD4 remain diagnostic and monitoring cornerstones.

title: Post-Infectious Guillain-Barré Variants
text: Post-infectious GBS variants (e.g., Miller Fisher) follow infections like C. jejuni and present with cranial neuropathies or ataxia; antiganglioside antibodies and NCS support subtype diagnosis.

title: Anti-LGI1 Autoimmune Encephalitis
text: Anti-LGI1 encephalitis presents with faciobrachial dystonic seizures, cognitive decline, and hyponatremia; serum/CSF LGI1 antibodies and MRI/EEG findings support diagnosis and immunotherapy is effective.

title: IgA Vasculitis in Adults
text: IgA vasculitis in adults more frequently involves severe renal disease compared to children; palpable purpura, arthralgia, and renal biopsy demonstrating IgA-dominant deposits guide management.

title: Autoimmune Pancreatitis Type 1
text: Type 1 autoimmune pancreatitis presents with painless jaundice, pancreatic enlargement, and elevated IgG4; steroid responsiveness and imaging features (sausage-shaped pancreas) aid diagnosis and differentiate from malignancy.

title: Mucous Membrane Pemphigoid
text: Mucous membrane pemphigoid causes scarring bullous disease of conjunctivae and oral mucosa; linear IgG/IgA and complement along basement membrane on DIF and antibody testing guide diagnosis and early treatment to prevent morbidity.

title: Cytokine Release Syndrome after Cellular Therapies
text: CRS presents with fever, hypotension, and hypoxia after CAR-T therapy; grading based on clinical parameters directs tocilizumab and supportive care; IL-6 blockade is cornerstone therapy.

title: ICI-Associated Myocarditis
text: Immune checkpoint inhibitor myocarditis presents with chest pain, arrhythmia, and troponin elevation; ECG/CMR/biopsy help diagnosis and high-dose steroids plus immunosuppression recommended early.

title: SDHx-Related Paraganglioma Syndromes
text: Germline SDHx mutations predispose to paragangliomas/pheochromocytomas often with catecholamine excess; plasma metanephrines and imaging, plus genetic testing, guide surveillance and family screening.

title: Li–Fraumeni Syndrome Surveillance
text: Li–Fraumeni syndrome due to TP53 mutations confers high lifetime cancer risk including sarcomas and breast cancer; intensive surveillance with whole-body MRI and early screening protocols recommended.

title: Paraneoplastic Neurologic Syndromes Summary
text: Paraneoplastic neurologic syndromes present with subacute neurological deficits; onconeural antibodies and systemic cancer search (CT/PET) guide diagnosis though antibodies are absent in many cases.

title: BRCA-Associated Ovarian Cancer Risk
text: Germline BRCA1/2 pathogenic variants markedly increase ovarian and breast cancer risk; risk-reducing salpingo-oophorectomy and intensified screening options discussed in carriers.

title: Vascular Ehlers–Danlos Syndrome
text: Vascular EDS (COL3A1) presents with arterial rupture, thin translucent skin, and easy bruising; diagnosis by COL3A1 variants influences surveillance and surgical planning.

title: Genotype-Phenotype in HCM (TNNT2)
text: TNNT2 variants associate with variable hypertrophic cardiomyopathy phenotypes often with arrhythmic risk; family screening and ECG/echo surveillance recommended.

title: Hereditary ATTR Amyloidosis: Clinical Spectrum
text: Hereditary ATTR causes progressive peripheral neuropathy and restrictive cardiomyopathy; TTR sequencing, tissue biopsy with Congo red, and technetium bone scintigraphy help subtype and guide TTR-stabilizing therapies.

title: HFE-Related Hemochromatosis
text: HFE hemochromatosis presents with fatigue, arthralgia, and elevated transferrin saturation/ferritin; HFE C282Y homozygosity common and phlebotomy is mainstay treatment to prevent cirrhosis and cardiomyopathy.

title: Hereditary Spherocytosis Diagnosis
text: Hereditary spherocytosis presents with hemolytic anemia, jaundice, and splenomegaly; spherocytes on peripheral smear, increased MCHC, and membrane protein gene testing confirm.

title: Bartter Syndrome Clinical Variants
text: Bartter syndrome presents with hypokalemia, metabolic alkalosis, and polyuria; urinary salt wasting and genetic subtypes (SLC12A1, KCNJ1) inform prognosis and therapy.

title: Gitelman Syndrome Summary
text: Gitelman presents with hypomagnesemia, hypokalemia, and hypocalciuria often in adolescence; SLC12A3 mutations confirm and guide electrolyte replacement strategies.

title: Primary Hyperoxaluria Type 1
text: Primary hyperoxaluria presents with recurrent nephrolithiasis and progressive renal failure; markedly elevated urinary oxalate and AGXT mutations confirm; pyridoxine helps some patients.

title: Mitral Valve Prolapse and Arrhythmic Risk
text: Classic mitral valve prolapse may present with palpitations and mitral regurgitation; bileaflet MVP with ventricular arrhythmias carries higher risk and requires Holter/echo surveillance.

title: Biochemical Workup for Pheochromocytoma
text: Pheochromocytoma often causes paroxysmal hypertension, headaches, and diaphoresis; plasma free metanephrines have high sensitivity and clonidine suppression or repeated sampling clarifies equivocal results.

title: Surgical Management in Hidradenitis Suppurativa
text: Surgical excision is indicated for Hurley stage II–III HS with sinus tracts; wide excision reduces recurrence and should be combined with medical optimization including biologic therapy when appropriate.

title: Microbiome-Based Approaches to Recurrent Oxalate Stones
text: Therapies targeting Oxalobacter formigenes aim to reduce urinary oxalate and recurrence of calcium oxalate stones; trials of probiotic and enzyme-based approaches show variable efficacy to date.

title: Cardiac AL Amyloidosis: Early Detection
text: Cardiac AL amyloidosis presents with heart failure, low-voltage ECG, and disproportionate wall thickening; serum free light chains, immunofixation, and biopsy are diagnostic and prompt hematologic therapy improves outcomes.

title: Pseudoxanthoma Elasticum Clinical Features
text: PXE features skin papules, angioid streaks in the retina, and vascular calcification; ABCC6 mutations confirm and ophthalmology/cardiovascular monitoring is recommended.

title: Wernicke Encephalopathy Recognition and Treatment
text: Wernicke encephalopathy presents with ophthalmoplegia, ataxia, and confusion in the context of thiamine deficiency; prompt IV thiamine is lifesaving and MRI may show mammillary body changes.

title: Endometriosis and Chronic Pelvic Pain
text: Endometriosis commonly causes chronic pelvic pain, dysmenorrhea, and infertility; laparoscopy with histologic confirmation is diagnostic though empirical therapy is often trialed first.

title: C9orf72-Associated ALS/FTD
text: C9orf72 hexanucleotide expansions cause ALS with variable frontotemporal dementia; family history, genetic testing, and anticipation of cognitive features inform management and counselling.

title: Myalgic Encephalomyelitis/Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
text: ME/CFS presents with debilitating post-exertional malaise, unrefreshing sleep, and cognitive dysfunction; diagnosis is clinical after exclusion and management focuses on symptom-directed support and pacing.

title: PTLD after Solid-Organ Transplant
text: PTLD presents with fever, lymphadenopathy, or organ dysfunction post-transplant and often associates with EBV; reduction of immunosuppression and targeted therapy (rituximab) are mainstays.

title: PIMS/MIS-C: Cardiac Manifestations
text: MIS-C presents with fever, shock, and myocarditis several weeks after SARS-CoV-2 exposure; elevated inflammatory markers and echocardiographic dysfunction are common and IVIG/steroids constitute first-line therapy.

title: Exertional Rhabdomyolysis: Evaluation and Management
text: Exertional rhabdomyolysis presents with muscle pain, dark urine, and elevated CK; aggressive fluid resuscitation and monitoring for AKI and electrolyte abnormalities are essential.

title: TRALI Recognition and Prevention
text: TRALI presents acutely during or within 6 hours of transfusion with hypoxemia and noncardiogenic pulmonary edema; supportive care and donor screening mitigate risk.

title: HIT Diagnosis and Management
text: HIT presents with thrombocytopenia 5–14 days after heparin exposure and new thrombosis; 4Ts score, PF4/heparin ELISA, and functional assays guide diagnosis and non-heparin anticoagulation.

title: Drug-Induced Acute Interstitial Nephritis
text: AIN presents with AKI, eosinophilia, and urinary WBC casts after exposure to drugs (NSAIDs, PPIs, antibiotics); drug withdrawal and steroids often lead to recovery.

title: Nelson Syndrome After Bilateral Adrenalectomy
text: Nelson syndrome features ACTH-secreting pituitary tumor growth with hyperpigmentation after bilateral adrenalectomy for Cushing disease; serial MRI and ACTH monitoring guide management and pituitary-directed therapy.

title: Chronic Graft-vs-Host Disease
text: Chronic GVHD after allogeneic stem cell transplant presents with skin sclerosis, sicca, and pulmonary decline; NIH criteria, biopsy, and immunosuppressive regimens guide therapy and morbidity mitigation.

title: Dystrophic Epidermolysis Bullosa Clinical Features
text: Dystrophic EB presents with fragile skin, blistering, and scarring leading to pseudosyndactyly; COL7A1 mutations confirm diagnosis and wound care plus multidisciplinary support are key.

title: Dyskeratosis Congenita and Telomere Biology
text: DC presents with mucocutaneous triad, bone marrow failure, and pulmonary fibrosis; short telomeres on flow-FISH and mutations in DKC1/TERC/TERT support diagnosis and hematologic surveillance.

title: Goltz Syndrome (Focal Dermal Hypoplasia)
text: Goltz syndrome presents with skin hypoplasia, skeletal defects, and ocular abnormalities often due to PORCN mutations; clinical diagnosis supported by genetic testing and multidisciplinary care.

title: CADASIL: Cerebral Autosomal Dominant Arteriopathy
text: CADASIL presents with migraine, subcortical ischemic strokes, and progressive cognitive decline; NOTCH3 cysteine-altering variants and MRI with white matter changes in anterior temporal poles support diagnosis.

title: Reye Syndrome Historical Overview
text: Reye syndrome is an acute encephalopathy with hepatic dysfunction after viral illness and aspirin exposure in children; microvesicular steatosis on liver pathology and rapid supportive care are central.

title: Opsoclonus-Myoclonus Syndrome
text: OMS presents with chaotic eye movements, myoclonus, and ataxia; often paraneoplastic in adults or neuroblastoma-associated in children; immune therapy and tumor search required.

title: Campylobacter-Associated Guillain-Barré
text: C. jejuni infection predisposes to axonal GBS variants presenting with rapidly progressive weakness; antiganglioside antibodies (GM1) and history of antecedent gastroenteritis are supportive clues.

title: Ecthyma Gangrenosum from Pseudomonas
text: Ecthyma gangrenosum presents as necrotic skin lesions in immunocompromised patients with Pseudomonas bacteremia; prompt blood cultures and anti-pseudomonal therapy are essential.

title: Coronary Aneurysm after Kawasaki Disease
text: Untreated Kawasaki disease can cause coronary artery aneurysms detectable by echocardiography; IVIG within 10 days reduces aneurysm risk and long-term cardiology follow-up is advised.

title: SSPE after Measles Infection
text: SSPE is a progressive fatal encephalopathy years after measles, presenting with cognitive decline and myoclonus; elevated measles antibody titers in CSF and EEG periodic complexes support diagnosis.

title: Achalasia: Diagnostic and Therapeutic Options
text: Achalasia presents with progressive dysphagia and regurgitation; high-resolution manometry classifies subtypes and guides therapy including pneumatic dilation, Heller myotomy, or POEM.

title: EGPA (Churg–Strauss) Clinical Features
text: EGPA features adult-onset asthma, eosinophilia, and systemic vasculitis with neuropathy; p-ANCA/MPO positive in subset and glucocorticoids with immunosuppression are mainstays.

title: Primary Hyperparathyroidism Presentation
text: Primary hyperparathyroidism presents with hypercalcemia, nephrolithiasis, and bone loss; elevated PTH with hypercalcemia and sestamibi imaging/localization guide parathyroidectomy.

title: Hereditary PPGL Syndromes
text: Hereditary pheochromocytoma/paraganglioma syndromes include SDHx, VHL, RET mutations; biochemical testing with plasma-free metanephrines and tailored imaging guide diagnosis and familial testing.

title: Autoimmune Hepatitis in Children
text: Pediatric AIH presents with elevated transaminases, hepatosplenomegaly, and interface hepatitis; ANA/SMA/anti-LKM antibodies help subtyping and immunosuppression leads to remission in many cases.

title: Multicentric Castleman Disease
text: MCD presents with systemic inflammatory symptoms, lymphadenopathy, and cytopenias; HHV-8-associated or idiopathic subtypes detected by histology and viral studies guide IL-6-directed therapy.

title: Eisenmenger Syndrome Clinical Course
text: Eisenmenger syndrome from uncorrected congenital shunt leads to pulmonary vascular disease and cyanosis; manage with pulmonary vasodilators cautiously and consider transplantation in advanced disease.

title: Central Retinal Vein Occlusion
text: CRVO presents with sudden painless vision loss and dilated tortuous veins with retinal hemorrhages; OCT and fluorescein angiography assess macular edema and guide intravitreal anti-VEGF therapy.

title: Polyorchidism: Rare Testicular Anomaly
text: Polyorchidism presents as supernumerary testis often found incidentally or with inguinal pathology; ultrasound and MRI characterize anatomy and management individualized.

title: Acute Toxic Leukoencephalopathy Patterns
text: Acute toxic leukoencephalopathy presents with rapid cognitive decline and diffuse white matter changes on MRI often after chemotherapy or toxins; supportive care and toxin removal guide outcomes.

title: Norovirus: Clinical and Public Health Aspects
text: Norovirus causes acute-onset vomiting and watery diarrhea with short incubation; RT-PCR on stool confirms; strict hygiene and outbreak control measures needed in closed settings.

title: EBV-Associated Hemophagocytic Lymphohistiocytosis
text: EBV-HLH presents with fever, cytopenias, and hyperferritinemia often in young patients; EBV PCR, bone marrow hemophagocytosis, and HLH-2004 criteria guide urgent immunochemotherapy.

title: Peripartum Cardiomyopathy
text: Peripartum cardiomyopathy presents in late pregnancy or early postpartum with heart failure symptoms and reduced LVEF; echocardiography diagnostic and guideline-directed heart failure therapy plus bromocriptine considered in select patients.

title: Cholesteatoma Presentation and Management
text: Cholesteatoma presents with chronic otorrhea, hearing loss, and cholesteatoma on otoscopy; CT temporal bone and surgical excision with mastoidectomy prevent complications.

title: Uveitis in Spondyloarthritis
text: Anterior uveitis is a common extra-articular manifestation of spondyloarthritis presenting with pain and photophobia; prompt ophthalmology referral and systemic control of axSpA reduce recurrences.

title: PNES: Diagnosis and Multidisciplinary Care
text: PNES present with seizure-like events without epileptiform EEG changes; video-EEG is diagnostic and psychological therapies are first-line treatment after neurologic exclusion.

title: Hyperemesis Gravidarum Management
text: Hyperemesis gravidarum causes severe nausea/vomiting in pregnancy leading to dehydration and weight loss; antiemetics, IV fluids, and nutritional support are key interventions.

title: Optic Neuritis and Multiple Sclerosis Risk
text: Acute optic neuritis presents with unilateral painful vision loss and afferent pupillary defect; MRI brain with demyelinating lesions increases MS risk and high-dose IV steroids hasten recovery of vision.

title: IIH Diagnosis and Visual Risk
text: IIH presents with headache and papilledema in young obese women; elevated opening pressure on LP with normal neuroimaging; weight loss and acetazolamide reduce ICP and preserve vision.

title: Lichenoid Drug Eruptions
text: Lichenoid drug reactions present with pruritic violaceous papules resembling lichen planus following medications (e.g., antimalarials, ACE inhibitors); biopsy and drug history guide withdrawal and topical steroids.

title: Staphylococcal Infective Endocarditis
text: Staphylococcus aureus endocarditis often causes acute virulent infection on native or prosthetic valves with high embolic risk; multiple blood cultures, TEE, and prolonged IV therapy are required.

title: Erythema Nodosum: Etiologies and Workup
text: Erythema nodosum presents with tender red nodules on shins and is associated with infections, sarcoidosis, IBD, and drugs; workup targets underlying cause and NSAIDs plus rest manage symptoms.

title: Eosinophilic Pleural Effusion Causes
text: Pleural effusions with eosinophilia may arise from pneumothorax, drug reactions, parasitic infections, or malignancy; pleural fluid analysis and targeted tests identify etiology.

title: SUDEP Risk and Prevention
text: SUDEP risk increases with uncontrolled generalized tonic–clonic seizures; risk reduction focuses on seizure control, nighttime supervision, and addressing modifiable factors.

title: Lennox–Gastaut Syndrome Overview
text: Lennox–Gastaut presents in childhood with multiple seizure types, intellectual disability, and slow spike-wave EEG; multi-drug therapy and ketogenic diet may reduce seizures.

title: Hematospermia: Evaluation in Urology
text: Hematospermia is usually benign but warrants evaluation for infection, malignancy, or coagulopathy in persistent or high-risk cases; urinalysis, PSA, and imaging as indicated.

title: Febrile Neutropenia Management in Oncology
text: Febrile neutropenia presents with fever and neutropenia after chemotherapy; prompt empiric broad-spectrum IV antibiotics and risk stratification (MASCC) guide outpatient vs inpatient care.

title: Neuroleptic Malignant Syndrome Recognition
text: NMS presents with hyperthermia, rigidity, autonomic instability, and elevated CK after antipsychotic exposure; immediate cessation of offending drug, supportive care, and dantrolene/bromocriptine in severe cases.

title: Factitious Disorder (Munchausen) Clinical Pattern
text: Factitious disorder involves intentional production of symptoms for psychological reasons without external incentives; diagnosis requires meticulous history, collateral information, and psychiatric input for management.

title: Ochratoxin A and Nephropathy
text: Ochratoxin exposure has been implicated in endemic nephropathies presenting with chronic kidney disease in some regions; exposure history and renal function monitoring are relevant in suspect cases.

title: Legionnaires' Disease Diagnosis and Treatment
text: Legionnaires' disease presents with severe pneumonia, hyponatremia, and gastrointestinal symptoms; urinary antigen for L. pneumophila serogroup 1 and respiratory culture/PCR confirm; macrolide or fluoroquinolone therapy indicated.

title: Acute Myocarditis After SARS-CoV-2 Infection
text: Acute myocarditis can occur after COVID-19 with chest pain and troponin elevation; CMR demonstrates myocardial inflammation and supportive care with guideline therapy advised.

title: Persistent Symptoms After Mild Traumatic Brain Injury
text: Post-concussive syndrome includes headache, cognitive dysfunction, and sleep disturbance lasting weeks to months after mTBI; graded return-to-activity and multidisciplinary rehabilitation help recovery.

title: Adult-Onset Still Disease Clinical Criteria
text: AOSD presents with high spiking fevers, evanescent salmon-colored rash, and arthralgia; markedly elevated ferritin and exclusion of infection/malignancy support diagnosis and IL-1/IL-6 inhibitors help refractory disease.

title: Malignant Hyperthermia Recognition and Management
text: MH presents intraoperatively with hypercarbia, muscle rigidity, and hyperthermia after succinylcholine or volatile agents; dantrolene administration and cooling are lifesaving; RYR1 variants predispose.

title: Bile Acid Diarrhea Diagnosis and Treatment
text: Bile acid diarrhea causes chronic watery diarrhea due to bile acid malabsorption; SeHCAT retention testing or empirical bile acid sequestrant trial (cholestyramine) assists diagnosis and therapy.

title: IgG4-Related Sclerosing Cholangitis
text: IgG4-related sclerosing cholangitis presents with obstructive jaundice and biliary strictures; elevated serum IgG4 and response to steroids differentiate from primary sclerosing cholangitis.

title: Paracetamol-Induced Acute Liver Failure
text: Acetaminophen overdose causes dose-dependent acute liver failure with elevated transaminases and coagulopathy; prompt N-acetylcysteine reduces hepatotoxicity and improves survival.

title: Nail–Patella Syndrome Clinical Spectrum
text: Nail–patella syndrome features nail dysplasia, absent/hypoplastic patellae, and nephropathy; LMX1B mutations confirm and monitoring for proteinuria recommended.

title: Pilonidal Disease and Surgical Options
text: Pilonidal disease presents with painful midline natal cleft abscesses and sinuses; management ranges from incision and drainage to wide excision with flap reconstruction for recurrent disease.

title: Fusobacterium necrophorum Pharyngitis and Lemierre-like Illness
text: F. necrophorum can cause severe pharyngitis with risk of septic thrombophlebitis of the internal jugular vein; blood cultures and CT neck identify septic thrombosis, and prolonged antibiotics with anticoagulation considered case-by-case.

title: Parenchymal Neurocysticercosis Management
text: Parenchymal neurocysticercosis commonly causes seizures; MRI staging guides antiparasitic therapy with albendazole plus corticosteroids to mitigate inflammatory response.

title: Adenoviral Conjunctivitis Clinical Notes
text: Adenoviral conjunctivitis presents with follicular conjunctivitis, watery discharge, and preauricular nodes; diagnosis is clinical and supportive care is mainstay, with attention to infection control.

title: Steroid-Refractory Graft-versus-Host Disease
text: Steroid-refractory acute GVHD carries high morbidity; ruxolitinib and extracorporeal photopheresis are options after confirming diagnosis and excluding infection.

title: Hypervirulent Klebsiella Liver Abscess
text: Hypervirulent K. pneumoniae may cause community-acquired liver abscess with metastatic complications; culture-guided therapy and drainage when accessible are recommended.

title: Post-Infectious GN After Group A Streptococcus
text: Post-infectious glomerulonephritis typically presents with hematuria and edema after streptococcal infection; supportive care and monitoring of renal function are essential.

title: Yersinia Enterocolitica Extraintestinal Disease
text: Yersinia can cause mesenteric adenitis, reactive arthritis, or bacteremia in iron-overloaded hosts; culture or PCR from stool or blood assists diagnosis and directs therapy.

title: Pediatric Macrophage Activation Syndrome
text: MAS presents with fever, cytopenias, hyperferritinemia and organ dysfunction in systemic JIA and other rheumatic diseases; early recognition and high-dose immunosuppression improve outcomes.

title: Giant Cell Tumor of Bone Management
text: Giant cell tumor often causes localized pain and lytic lesions; curettage with adjuvant or en bloc resection based on location reduces recurrence risk.

title: Hypersensitivity Pneumonitis from Occupational Exposures
text: Hypersensitivity pneumonitis presents with dyspnea, cough, and restrictive physiology related to inhaled antigens; antigen avoidance and corticosteroids are mainstays.

title: Complex Hidradenitis Suppurativa Management
text: Severe HS can form tunnels and sinus tracts with high morbidity; combined medical (antibiotics, biologics) and surgical approaches tailored by Hurley stage improve outcomes.

title: Post-COVID-19 Pulmonary Fibrosis Sequelae
text: A subset of patients develop persistent radiographic fibrotic changes after severe COVID-19 requiring follow-up with PFTs and HRCT; consider pulmonary rehab and trial of antifibrotics in select cases.

title: Intrahepatic Cholestasis of Pregnancy
text: ICP presents with pruritus and elevated bile acids in pregnancy; ursodeoxycholic acid may improve symptoms and reduce fetal risk when bile acids are high.

title: Isocyanate-Induced Occupational Asthma
text: Isocyanates cause sensitizer-induced asthma with work-related symptoms; spirometry and peak flow monitoring support diagnosis; exposure reduction is crucial.

title: Infectious Mimics of Kawasaki Disease
text: Several viral and bacterial infections can mimic Kawasaki disease; careful cardiac evaluation and consideration of IVIG indicated when criteria met to prevent coronary complications.

title: Chronic Q Fever Endocarditis
text: Chronic Coxiella burnetii infection classically causes culture-negative endocarditis; phase I antibodies are diagnostic and long-term doxycycline-hydroxychloroquine therapy recommended.

title: Postinfectious Reactive Arthritis after Campylobacter
text: Reactive arthritis follows enteric infections like Campylobacter with asymmetric oligoarthritis; NSAIDs and supportive care are first-line, and HLA-B27 influences course.

title: Acute Myocarditis after Vaccination (rare)
text: Rare cases of acute myocarditis have been reported after certain vaccinations, typically with chest pain and troponin elevation; most cases are mild and resolve with supportive care.

title: Cetuximab-Induced Hypersensitivity and Preexisting IgE
text: Immediate hypersensitivity to cetuximab may be related to preexisting IgE against alpha-gal; identify via history and manage with desensitization or alternative therapy.

title: Screening for Primary Aldosteronism
text: Primary aldosteronism presents with hypertension and hypokalemia; aldosterone-renin ratio screens and confirmatory suppression testing localizes disease for surgical cure when unilateral.

title: Hydralazine-Associated Drug-Induced Lupus
text: Hydralazine can cause a drug-induced lupus phenotype with arthralgia and positive antihistone antibodies; withdrawal leads to improvement.

title: Ki-67 Proliferation Index in Breast Cancer
text: Ki-67 assists prognostication in breast cancer but lacks standardized thresholds; use alongside histology and receptor status to guide adjuvant therapy decisions.

title: Sheehan Syndrome and Pituitary Apoplexy Postpartum
text: Severe postpartum hemorrhage may precipitate pituitary ischemia/apoplexy leading to hypopituitarism; prompt endocrine assessment and hormone replacement are essential.

title: Disseminated Lyme Disease Manifestations
text: Disseminated Lyme can cause multiple erythema migrans, meningitis, or carditis; clinical context with serology guides therapy with doxycycline or IV ceftriaxone when neurologic/cardiac involvement present.

title: Anti-Müllerian Hormone for Ovarian Reserve
text: AMH correlates with ovarian reserve and can help counsel on fertility potential and ART planning but is not a direct predictor of live birth.

title: Brucella Endocarditis Clinical Considerations
text: Brucella may rarely cause endocarditis with culture challenges; prolonged targeted combination therapy and surgical consultation often required.

title: Management of Severe Hyperemesis Gravidarum
text: Severe hyperemesis gravidarum leads to dehydration, electrolyte disturbance, and weight loss; rehydration, antiemetics, thiamine, and nutritional support are key.

title: Epidermolysis Bullosa: Wound Care and Genetics
text: EB causes skin fragility with blistering; specialized wound care, avoidance of trauma, and genetic counseling based on COL7A1, KRT, or other gene variants guide management.

title: Hereditary Sensory and Autonomic Neuropathies
text: HSAN subtypes cause insensitivity to pain, ulcers, and autonomic dysfunction; diagnosis via genetic testing and symptomatic management to prevent injuries.

title: Severe Cerebral Malaria in Endemic Areas
text: Cerebral malaria presents with coma and seizures; prompt parenteral artesunate and supportive ICU care reduce mortality and neurological sequelae.

title: Acute Postoperative Endophthalmitis
text: Acute endophthalmitis presents with pain, decreased vision, and hypopyon after intraocular surgery; immediate intravitreal antibiotics and vitreous sampling are indicated.

title: Occult Hepatic Metastases in Colorectal Cancer
text: Small hepatic metastases may be occult on imaging; intraoperative ultrasound and careful pathological staging guide adjuvant therapy decisions.

title: Uveitis Screening in Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis
text: Asymptomatic uveitis can occur in JIA; regular ophthalmologic screening detects inflammation early and prevents visual loss with topical/systemic therapy.

title: Immune-Related Adverse Events with CTLA-4 Blockade
text: Ipilimumab can cause colitis, hepatitis, endocrinopathies, and dermatitis due to immune activation; early recognition and corticosteroids are cornerstone of management.

title: Inclusion Body Myositis Diagnosis and Course
text: IBM presents with slowly progressive distal and quadriceps weakness in older adults; biopsy shows rimmed vacuoles and inflammatory infiltrates; limited response to immunosuppression.

title: Cavernous Sinus Thrombosis from Facial Infections
text: Cavernous sinus thrombosis presents with severe headache, ophthalmoplegia, and cranial nerve deficits; urgent imaging and IV antibiotics ± anticoagulation indicated.

title: Disseminated Blastomycosis: Multisystem Disease
text: Disseminated blastomycosis can affect lungs, skin, bone and CNS; culture or histopathology confirm and prolonged antifungal therapy is required.

title: Streptococcal Toxic Shock Syndrome Recognition
text: STSS presents with fever, hypotension, and multiorgan failure due to invasive Group A Streptococcus; rapid source control, IV antibiotics including clindamycin, and supportive care are essential.

title: Pulmonary AVMs in HHT: Screening and Management
text: Pulmonary AVMs in HHT risk paradoxical emboli and hypoxemia; CT and bubble echo screen; embolization indicated for feeding vessel size thresholds.

title: PFIC: Genetic Cholestatic Disorders
text: PFIC presents in childhood with cholestasis and pruritus; genetic subtyping (ATP8B1, ABCB11, ABCB4) guides prognosis and transplantation considerations.

title: Adult ITP Management Strategies
text: First-line ITP in adults includes corticosteroids and IVIG for severe bleeding; thrombopoietin receptor agonists and splenectomy for chronic refractory cases considered.

title: Extensively Drug-Resistant Tuberculosis Challenges
text: XDR-TB resists first- and second-line drugs leading to limited therapeutic options; individualized regimens guided by DST and new agents like bedaquiline improve outcomes.

title: HSV Encephalitis Rapid Management
text: HSV encephalitis presents with fever, focal deficits and altered consciousness; prompt IV acyclovir and CSF PCR testing reduce morbidity and mortality.

title: Gastrointestinal Manifestations of AL Amyloidosis
text: AL amyloidosis can produce malabsorption, bleeding and dysmotility; tissue biopsy with Congo red and evaluation for monoclonal gammopathy are diagnostic steps.

title: Peripartum Cardiomyopathy Diagnosis and Care
text: Peripartum cardiomyopathy presents with heart failure in late pregnancy or postpartum; echocardiography confirms reduced EF and standard heart failure therapies adapted for breastfeeding and pregnancy status.

title: HLH Triggered by Autoimmune Disease
text: Autoimmune flares can provoke HLH-like MAS with high ferritin and multiorgan dysfunction; treat the immune trigger aggressively while supporting organ systems.

title: Prevention and Management of Postherpetic Neuralgia
text: Early antiviral therapy for acute zoster reduces PHN risk; gabapentinoids, TCAs, and topical lidocaine treat established neuropathic pain.

title: Diagnosis of Prosthetic Joint Infection
text: PJI often involves biofilm-forming bacteria; synovial fluid analysis, cultures including sonication of implants, and DAIR vs staged exchange decisions guided by timing and organism.

title: Management of Inhalation Injury from Chemical Exposure
text: Inhalation injuries cause airway edema and respiratory failure; early airway management, bronchoscopy, and supportive ICU care reduce mortality.

title: Neuropathy in Hansen Disease: Ulnar Nerve Involvement
text: Leprosy causes peripheral neuropathy often affecting ulnar and peroneal nerves; slit-skin smear, PCR, and prolonged multidrug therapy with nerve care are recommended.

title: Overlap Syndromes: PBC and Autoimmune Hepatitis
text: Some patients present with features of PBC and AIH requiring combined management with ursodeoxycholic acid and immunosuppression guided by biopsy and serology.

title: Bulbar-Onset ALS Clinical Course
text: Bulbar-onset ALS presents with dysarthria and dysphagia; multidisciplinary care including nutrition and non-invasive ventilation improves quality of life and survival.

title: HIT Type II Diagnosis and Management
text: HIT presents with thrombocytopenia and thrombosis after heparin exposure; stop heparin and start a non-heparin anticoagulant while confirming with PF4/heparin immunoassay and functional testing.

title: Heritable PAH and BMPR2 Variants
text: Heritable PAH can present in younger adults with exertional dyspnea; BMPR2 mutations confer higher risk and family screening may be appropriate.

title: ITP Management in Pregnancy
text: ITP in pregnancy managed with steroids or IVIG for bleeding or very low platelets; neonatal platelet monitoring and delivery planning needed.

title: Recurrent Oropharyngeal Candidiasis
text: Recurrent thrush prompts evaluation for HIV, diabetes, or inhaled steroid use; topical or systemic azoles treat based on severity and patient factors.

title: Glucocorticoid-Induced Myopathy
text: Steroid myopathy causes proximal muscle weakness with normal CK; reduce steroid exposure and implement physiotherapy where possible.

title: Early Infantile Epileptic Encephalopathy (Ohtahara)
text: Severe early-life epilepsy syndromes present with intractable seizures and suppression-burst EEG patterns; genetic testing can identify treatable causes in some cases.

title: RAPSN-Related Congenital Myasthenic Syndromes
text: CMS due to RAPSN mutations causes early ptosis and feeding difficulties; acetylcholinesterase inhibitors and supportive care improve symptoms.

title: Prosthetic Valve Endocarditis Clinical Approach
text: PVE presents with fever and prosthetic dysfunction; blood cultures and transesophageal echo guide diagnosis and early surgical consultation often required.

title: Management of Severe Alopecia Areata
text: Extensive alopecia areata may respond to systemic immunomodulators including JAK inhibitors; monitor for adverse effects and counsel on prognosis.

title: Hereditary ATTR Polyneuropathy Overview
text: hATTR causes progressive neuropathy and cardiomyopathy; genetic confirmation and disease-modifying therapies (tafamidis, patisiran) change management.

title: Gadolinium-Associated Systemic Symptoms (rare)
text: Rare systemic symptoms reported after gadolinium exposure; weigh risks and use lowest effective dose and macrocyclic agents when MRI required.

title: Cancer Surveillance in Bloom Syndrome
text: Bloom syndrome confers high early-onset cancer risk; tailored surveillance and early intervention strategies advised for affected individuals.

title: Surgical Management for Refractory Hidradenitis Suppurativa
text: Wide excision and reconstruction can be curative for advanced HS when medical therapy fails; multidisciplinary planning reduces recurrence.

title: Isoniazid Hepatotoxicity Monitoring
text: INH can cause idiosyncratic hepatocellular injury; monitor LFTs where indicated and stop therapy when thresholds for transaminase elevation are reached.

title: Microsporidial CNS and Disseminated Disease in Immunocompromised
text: Microsporidia cause chronic diarrhea and disseminated disease in immunosuppressed hosts; diagnosis via PCR or specialized staining and therapy with albendazole where active.

title: Topical Antibiotics in Mild Hidradenitis Suppurativa
text: Topical clindamycin can reduce inflammation in mild HS lesions; implement alongside hygiene measures and consider escalation for moderate disease.

title: Secondary Oxalate Nephropathy from Enteric Hyperoxaluria
text: Enteric hyperoxaluria post-bariatric surgery or IBD can cause oxalate nephropathy and progressive CKD; dietary modification and hydration advised.

title: Parvovirus B19 and Fetal Hydrops Risk
text: Maternal parvovirus infection can lead to fetal anemia and hydrops; fetal transfusion may be lifesaving when severe anemia detected via MCA Doppler.

title: M. marinum Cutaneous Infections from Aquatic Exposure
text: M. marinum causes nodular skin lesions after fish-tank exposure; culture at lower temperatures or PCR confirms and prolonged antibiotics (eg, doxycycline, clarithromycin) are used.

title: Rare Soft Tissue Sarcoma Subtypes: Clinical Notes
text: Management of rare sarcoma subtypes requires histologic and molecular characterization and referral to specialist centers for multimodal therapy planning.

title: Progressive Pulmonary Fibrosis of Unknown Etiology
text: Some patients have progressive fibrosing ILD without clear cause; antifibrotic therapy and multidisciplinary discussion may be considered.

title: Paraneoplastic Cerebellar Degeneration and Onconeural Antibodies
text: PCD presents with subacute cerebellar dysfunction; anti-Yo, anti-Hu and others guide cancer search and immunotherapy consideration.

title: Neuroimaging in Neurocysticercosis
text: MRI and CT show stages of cysticerci (vesicular to calcified); lesion stage determines antiparasitic vs conservative management.

title: Acute Porphyria Attack Recognition and Management
text: Acute porphyria presents with severe abdominal pain, neuropathy and hyponatremia; hemin infusion and carbohydrate loading reduce neurotoxicity during attacks.

title: Gestational Pemphigoid (Herpes Gestationis)
text: Gestational pemphigoid presents with pruritic papules and tense bullae in pregnancy; bullous pemphigoid antigen antibodies and topical/systemic steroids manage flares.

title: Complex Pulmonary Co-Infections in Immunocompromised Hosts
text: Immunocompromised patients may present with polymicrobial pulmonary infections; broad diagnostics including culture, PCR and antigen tests guide combination therapy.

title: IIH Diagnosis and Weight Management
text: IIH presents with headache and papilledema often in young obese females; weight loss and acetazolamide reduce intracranial pressure and vision risk.

title: Photosensitivity in Porphyrias: PV and PCT
text: Cutaneous porphyrias cause photosensitivity with blistering; sun avoidance, phlebotomy for PCT, and specific enzyme assays aid management.

title: Noninvasive Diagnosis of Cardiac ATTR
text: Bone scintigraphy with technetium-labeled tracers can noninvasively identify ATTR cardiac amyloid in the absence of monoclonal protein.

title: Systemic Mastocytosis Diagnostic Criteria
text: Criteria include elevated baseline tryptase, KIT D816V mutation, and multifocal mast cell aggregates on marrow biopsy; management includes symptom control and cytoreductive therapy for aggressive forms.

title: Reversible Cardiomyopathy from Sustained Tachyarrhythmia
text: Persistent tachycardia such as AF or flutter may cause reversible systolic dysfunction; rate/rhythm control or ablation can restore function.

title: Gestational Trophoblastic Neoplasia: Hemorrhagic Risk
text: Choriocarcinoma can present with bleeding from metastases; hCG monitoring, imaging and chemotherapy are central to management with surgical intervention for hemorrhage.

title: Anti-GBM Disease Rapid Presentation
text: Anti-GBM disease causes rapidly progressive GN often with pulmonary hemorrhage; plasmapheresis plus immunosuppression is urgent therapy.

title: Bell Palsy and Corticosteroid Benefit
text: Acute peripheral facial palsy benefits from early corticosteroid therapy to improve recovery, with antivirals considered when severe or herpetic signs present.

title: Asbestos-Related Pleural Disease and Malignancy
text: Asbestos exposure leads to pleural disease and increased mesothelioma risk; history, imaging, and biopsy guide management and compensation processes.

title: Granulomatous Mastitis Diagnostic Dilemma
text: Granulomatous mastitis can be autoimmune or infectious (eg, Corynebacterium); tissue biopsy and cultures guide immunosuppression versus targeted antibiotics.

title: Recognition of Severe Dengue and Plasma Leakage
text: Severe dengue presents with plasma leakage, hemorrhage or organ impairment; vigilant fluid management and monitoring of hematocrit and platelets are critical.

title: Acute Childhood ITP Natural History
text: Most childhood ITP is self-limited after a viral prodrome; observation recommended for nonbleeding cases with tailored therapy for severe bleeding.

title: Acetaminophen-Induced Acute Liver Failure
text: Acetaminophen overdose causes rapid transaminase rise and encephalopathy; prompt N-acetylcysteine reduces progression to liver failure if administered early.

title: Management of Febrile Neutropenia in Cancer Patients
text: Febrile neutropenia requires prompt empiric broad-spectrum antibiotics with risk stratification (MASCC) guiding outpatient vs inpatient care and de-escalation by culture results.

title: Visual Monitoring in IIH Patients
text: Regular visual field and optic nerve assessment are essential in IIH to detect progressive vision loss and guide escalation to surgical CSF diversion when indicated.

title: MECP2 Duplication: Neurological Regression and Susceptibility to Infection
text: MECP2 duplication causes severe neurodevelopmental regression in boys with recurrent respiratory infections; genetic diagnosis informs prognosis and supportive care.

title: Prevention of Tumor Lysis Syndrome in High-Risk Malignancies
text: TLS prevention includes aggressive hydration, uric acid-lowering agents (allopurinol/rasburicase) and monitoring electrolytes in high-risk tumor types or bulky disease before cytotoxic therapy.

title: Response Assessment in AL Amyloidosis After Chemotherapy
text: Hematologic and organ responses to chemotherapy in AL amyloidosis guide prognosis and transplant candidacy; serial free light chains and functional measures track response.

title: CA-MRSA Skin and Soft Tissue Infection Management
text: CA-MRSA commonly causes purulent SSTIs; incision and drainage with or without targeted antibiotics is standard, and decolonization in recurrent cases considered.

title: Neurobrucellosis—Neurologic Sequelae and Prolonged Therapy
text: Neurobrucellosis can cause meningitis, encephalitis or myelitis; prolonged combination antibiotic therapy with CNS-penetrating agents is often needed.
